description:
Warm Taiyaki with Ice cream? YES!

This place one of my favorite dessert place! I love cold ice cream on warm taiyaki (fish shaped waffle). The ice cream comes in 4 flavors: black sesame, matcha, lavender and tofu. The ice cream is creamy and taiyaki is just perfect balance between softness and crunchiness. They just go perfect together!

I am a huge fan of black sesame flavor and they did not disappoint me. I highly recommend getting this flavor!

I'd definitely be coming back to try other flavors!
author: Clare L.

description:
A nice dessert shop in the middle of Japantown.

Flavor: 4/5
Texture: 2/5

Their seasonal flavor was this peach thing which I really liked. But the texture was much closer to a sorbet, which was really disappointing.
Nonetheless, I'm happy to come back to try the taiyaki sometime! (We were heading out, so I had to get the soft serve in a cup.)
author: Calvin C.

description:
Solid dessert place in Japantown!

It is very unique in a sense that their icecreams can come in taiyaki cones (fish-shaped cone) with a filling of your choice, that being nutella or red beans. I've tried taiyakis with red beans before, but I never thought that they could come with icecreams on top! 

They offer different flavors, but I recommend you to start off with matcha icecream your first visit and black sesame for your second visit! 

My favorite combination has been, 
Small Taiyaki w/ Red Beans Fillings + Matcha flavor + chocolate sticks & matcha powder so far. 

It starts with ice-cream of your choice on the top and as you move further down, you would be able to eat it with taiyaki cone and end with taiyaki + red beans at the bottom (last part seems to be my favorite!)
author: Justyn P.

description: All the ice cream flavors here were really good except for the seasonal watermelon flavor lol. My boyfriend and I shared the Matcha, my brother and his girlfriend shared the Tofu and my parents shared the Black Sesame. They were all good in their own way but the Matcha was probably my favorite. This is probably the best taiyaki ice cream I've had in California. It's not quite like taiyaki in New York or Japan but it's 75-80% there.
author: Tiffany P.

description:
I had the deluxe taiyaki, which comes with 1-2 flavors and 2 toppings for $8.99 before tax. I chose matcha soft serve on top, black sesame on the bottom, a red bean paste filling at the bottom of the taiyaki cone, and topped with pocky sticks and matcha powder. I came on a Sunday afternoon and waited about 15 minutes till I was able to order, then about another 5 to get my order. 

The matcha flavor wasn't very strong in my opinion, so I thought it was just alright. I liked the black sesame much better because it has a strong, bold flavor. I also got to try some of my boyfriend's tofu flavor, which reminds me more of soy milk than the actual tofu taste. As for the taiyaki cone, I thought it was a little salty and the batter was a bit dense. The cone goes really well with the red bean paste filling, though, so I'd recommend getting that. 

The shop is very small, and since there are a bunch of people waiting inside for their order, it gets pretty stuffy. There's also no seating area so you'd have to take your dessert outside, which is a better idea anyway so it doesn't melt everywhere. Overall, I'd say if you haven't tried it before, you should, since it's a unique and picturesque dessert. I probably wouldn't make a trip across town for it, but I'd stop by if I was in the area and in the mood for some taiyaki and matcha/black sesame soft serve.
author: Bonnie N.

description:
I have wanted to try this place for a while, but every time I've stopped by there was always a line. So, I decided to get here right when they opened at 12:30pm on a Sunday. To my surprise, there were about 5 people already waiting in line. 

I knew exactly what I wanted when I reached the register. I got a small Taiyaki with red bean filling, black sesame soft serve, and Pocky sticks and chocolate sticks for my toppings. My total came out to $6.82. 

The black sesame soft serve was pretty good! Just enough sweetness. The Taiyaki had a nice pancake like texture. The red bean bean made for a nice filling and I enjoyed the matcha Pocky sticks and chocolate sticks. 

It's definitely worth a try! They also offer you a stamp card if you want one. I'll be back for sure!
author: Fallon P.

description:
Dessert time! 4.5 Stars to be exact!

My hubby and I definitely cannot leave Japantown without dessert after our dinner. This place was jamming with a line out the door. We got the large Taiyaki with tofu flavor and their seasonal watermelon flavor. We were both very happy with our choices. The dessert was light and not too sweet to satisfy our sweet cravings. Soft serve was just perfect for us since we are both lactose intolerant. Tofu flavor was quite unique and it tasted like a soymilk and tasted healthy too! Watermelon did not taste artificial at all, in fact, it was really fresh. Taiyaki was pretty impressive - crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. 

When we were done, we really wished we got another one!
author: Cynthia D.

description:
My brother and I came here after dinner. We usually skip out on trying to come here because there's always a huge line, but luckily an hour before they close on a Monday,  we were second in line.

My brother got the fish cone with sesame once cream and pocki sticks and he loved it. He thought the cone was very soft like a puffy pancake.

Because I'm gluten free, I had to settle with just a cup, but also got to the black sesame ice cream and it was very tasty! 

We both also sampled the watermelon ( seasonal) and tofu flavors. The tofu was surprisingly tasty and not very sweet. I'm sure it would be even better with toppings since it has such a subtle taste. The watermelon was really good... it tasted like a perfectly ripe watermelon. With that said it was a little more sweet, and at the time I just wanted something different, but I would definitely get it next time.

I would recommend this place if the line isn't long and also if you buy food for the gram;).
author: Gita r.

description:
As with my typical experience in Japan Town, I see a line and I stand in it (see my review for Marufuku). My friends and I were at the Daiso side of the Japantown Plazas and saw a bunch of people standing in line so naturally, we got in line. 

They have 3 flavors of soft serve - black sesame, matcha, and tofu along with a seasonal flavor, which was watermelon. We were intrigued by the tofu since we've never heard of tofu ice cream, and I figured it was going to taste like tofu fa. 

The line moves pretty quickly, the biggest hold up is probably the people standing at the register trying to figure out what they want to get - which... it will happen to all first timers. The nicest thing is that they have little sample cups available in a mini freezer. I tried the black sesame and the matcha and went with the black sesame. The matcha tasted very fake - reminded me of Starbucks matcha. Ick. The girl at the register 

I got a small nutella taiyaki with black sesame and pocky sticks + chocolate rolls. I think it's like $7 for a small or something. 

It's messy. There's ice cream everywhere. At some point I got sick of eating the soft serve and just wanted the taiyaki and there was no good way for me to eat it without eating all of the soft serve. :( I never got to the nutella inside the taiyaki. 

Overall, it was okay. But I probably wouldn't stand in line for it again.
author: Judy H.

description:
Was drawn here by the amazing smell of the fresh taiyaki cones being made. There was a bit of a line out the door (the shop itself is very small, no seating just standing area), I waited about 10 minutes in line and then another 10 after ordering (because they were making fresh taiyaki cones- basically like a pancake in the shape of a fish).

I got the deluxe black sesame and matcha and it comes with 2 toppings (~$8). I got the pocky stick and chocolate stick for the toppings. (Note: on a separate occasion I got the Azuki filling at the bottom and it was SO good, highly recommend).  I wish they had mochi balls as a topping, as it's in some of their pictures, but when I asked they did not :( I enjoyed both the black sesame and matcha, the matcha had a good matcha flavor (but I've had better), and same for the sesame. They recommend getting only one flavor to get the full flavor experience, but I enjoyed the combo of matcha and black sesame. 

I will say, it drips A LOT and can get very messy so make sure to have lots of napkins prepared. Worth the mess though and I look forward to coming back!
author: April L.

description:
True rating: 3.5
Here's the breakdown:

1. There are 3 flavors and 1 seasonal flavor: Matcha, Tofu, and Black Sesame. You have the option to add Nutella or red bean as a filling inside. Then you get couple to a few picks of topping depending on what size you get. When I went in Sept 2018, seasonal flavor was watermelon.

2. The prices are reasonable. For the amount and instagram worthy pictures, it's a fair price. 

3. I came because of a recommendation of a friend who said their Matcha is the best in Japantown. I personally thought it was too sweet, but this seems like a personal preference. 

4.The store is small and there is no inside seating inside the store. There are sitting right outside the store that is indoors. 

5. The line depends. I went around 9pm on Saturday and there was a very short line. I came back the next day on Sunday around 1pm and there was a good line. The one goes by fast.

6. Service is decent. It's not the best service I received but they were respectful and got the job done.

7. You can try samples. Just ask for it.

Overall, I would recommend this place to a friend who likes instagram worthy pictures and over likes Japanese ice cream/ Taiyaki. I'm not sure if I would go back again on my own but if a friend wanted to go, I would not be against it.
author: Shin L.

description:
This place taking over that previous boba and cotton candy shop has been a hit since. There's a at most times in the day and for good reason!

I've been here twice, each time trying something different. Each time, the wait wasn't super long, it definitely can be awhile! But don't fret because the item itself get put together pretty quick after you order. 

I've had the black sesame in the taiyaki and the seasonal roasted purple sweet potato in a cone. Both were good and had decent flavor. I'm def more of a black sesame person but also down to try new flavors. 

One flavor I didn't seem fond of was tofu. It seemed a bit more bland, not much flavor. Maybe that has changed since I've been there
author: Karen Y.

description: Black sesame and matcha ice cream. Too freaking good. I didn't really expect to like the sesame ice cream as I don't like sesame too much, but I loved it even more than the matcha!
author: Savannah S.

description:
Now this is what Matcha and Black sesame soft serve is supposed to taste like! There's something about the flavor quality that other stores just can't replicate.

Usually I would recommend avoiding the taiyaki cones when it comes to ice cream but it's probably a better idea at uji time. No, it doesn't make the ice cream taste better but it's large enough to get more than one flavor (the regular size). In addition to the flavors, you also get choices of toppings. You MUST get the soybean powder, you won't regret it. 

Uji time has definitely made it on my list of things to get in Japantown, highly recommended if you like asian flavors for your ice cream.
author: Wiseley F.

description:
We walked over to Uji Time after dinner in the area. There was a small line, but we were in and out fairly quickly. By the time we had gotten our taiyaki's, the line had grown to be three storefronts down.

They let you try the soft serve before you order, which is a huge plus for me. They were running a seasonal flavor of Honey Lavender, which I wasn't 100% sure I wanted to commit to. After trying it, I opted for their sesame flavor instead. BF had the honey lavender and our friend got the matcha. I think I ended up with the best soft serve. It was so creamy and smooth.

I ordered their large taiyaki with red bean filling and it was pretty good. The structural integrity was really solid and it felt very secure. The small taiyaki's take about 10 minutes to make - perhaps not a lot of people get them?

It's not as good as Japan - but it's just about the best taiyaki I've had in the US.
author: Michelle T.

description:
As always, Japantown has some new stuff to try.

Unlike other ice cream shop in the town,  Uji Time dessert serve special favor ice cream to cater to Asian customers' tastes. 

I ordered the soymilk ice cream with taiyaki (A fish-shape pancake). It tastes like iced sweet soymilk melting in my mouth. Be aware that the taiyaki is getting soft while the ice cream melting. 

The honey lavender favor tastes surprisingly amazing. It makes me want to exchange the ice cream with my friend. XD

Tips: Get some napkins when you eating ice cream.  You will thank me for the reminder.
author: Regina W.

description:
Uji Time is located Inside a shopping center in Japantown. It's a very small location with a line out the door. When I first came last December, I was lucky enough to not have to wait in line..but of course, due to social media popularity, this place blew up to a famous must visit ice cream spot. 

Again, the place is small and offers a variety of desserts such as their famous ice creams in a Taiyaki cone- featuring flavors black sesame, tofu, matcha, and the seasonal (lavender when I came!). Since I'm ALWAYS getting black sesame in a come, I decided to opt for the lavender in a taiyaki cone with Nutella filling ( you can get Nutella, red bean, or no filling). 

The place is smart and only allows enough customers to go In  and order when it's their turn. There's signs that asks you to wait outside and wait to be called into order, which is smart so we're not all trying to fit in the small place like sardines. The staff works very fast and gets everyone in and out ASAP to avoid any mix ups/over crowding. The menu even tells you how long the wait is the taiyaki cone to be cooked so you can anticipate the length of your wait. 

The flavors here is SOOOO good. I have friends who have never tried these 'different' flavored ice cream before and they enjoyed the eclectic taste. The lavender was surprisingly amazing and actually had a taste that lasted, so you KNEW it was lavender. 

Since this place is only popular on the west coast, it's a must for me to come here (along with other ice cream places) and get all my cravings in before leaving. If you're ever around the area, definitely check this place out!
author: Tiffany Y.

description:
Black Sesame and Matcha!! What a great mix. I ordered my soft serve in a taiyaki and red bean toppings. I loved it! I wish they had added more red beans. I'll be back again soon for more! 

The lines are out the door bc the space is small and they don't want everyone to bombard the counter. The lines do move quickly but it's also so hot inside the place. I hope you enjoy your soft serve as much as I did!!
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
Definitely expect a wait. Not only is it a popular spot it takes people a while to order and receive their food.

Despite this, I really enjoyed the dessert! I ordered a Small Taiyaki with black sesame and the flavor of the soft serve was really great. At first, I was taken aback by the strong flavor of sesame but then I was really taken by it. The lavender was the flavor of the season and it similarly was extremely strong in taste. Both were very tasty and would recommend either!

The toppings I got were the chocolate sticks (very instagrammable) and adzuki bean fillings. I wish the adzuki beans had a better consistency (a little hard) but I always enjoy adzuki beans so I was still happy! The Taiyaki cone tasted OK, not amazing, it was actually a little bland.
author: Angelina H.

description:
This was my first time trying taiyaki and I loved it! I got the matcha flavor and even though I am not usually a fan of matcha, it was really good. I also tried a bit of the black sesame and thought it would at least taste a bit sweet but it actually wasn't sweet at all. It just tasted like pure and plain sesame. There was also pumpkin tofu which was a seasonal flavor. That tasted like a saltier and lighter version of pumpkin pie which was interesting. As for the fish waffle part, that was great and had red bean coated on the inside and at the bottom to keep the ice cream from dripping. It's just a really cute concept and a unique dessert I'm glad I got to try.

The store is located in a small indoor plaza and the store itself is really small so there is not really a place to sit down. The shops around are interesting though so it's fun to just walk around inside the mall.
author: Amy P.

description:
Wow, this place is amazing! It far exceeded my expectations. 

We visited on a Saturday evening, and the line wasn't too bad, maybe 15 minutes total. They were cranking out the desserts super fast. We got ours within 5 minutes of ordering.

I had the large fish cone with black sesame seed ice cream as well as matcha ice cream. It was absolutely delicious. It was sweet and refreshing, without being tooth-hurting levels of sweet. The fish cone was awesome. It got more cakey as you got to the bottom of it, which was satisfying. I really liked the bean paste on the inside of the fish... reminded me of red bean paste fish treats you get in Korea as street food.

Overall, I highly recommend this place. I've not been to an ice cream place that served ice cream anywhere close to this. It's an experience!!
author: Andrew L.

description:
Uji is okay. Their  ice cream is too watery for me although their handmade waffle cones are great. Mochi is very delicious.

Personally I am a frozen custard fiend and this place is far from high butter fat nirvana. However two of my family members love this place and they do offer some very interesting flavors.

Definitely a great stop after having dinner at one of the many restaurants near by!
author: David G.

description:
Yum yum. Not very Instagram worthy but tasty.

The small and large are both not very pretty fish pastries and both hidden below the napkin line.

I ordered the large with tofu flavored and a black sesame flavored, but with no toppings. Instead of two ice creams next to each other, they are layered. Mine happened to have black sesame with the tofu on top. Omg. So good.

I love tofu ice cream. I've never had this flavor but so good. In Japan I've had soy based ice cream, but this straight tasted like dessert or sweet soy milk. The black sesame was rich and delicious too.

Under the ice cream is a layer of red bean. I think the purpose is to insulate it from making the fish into a soggy mess as the ice cream melts.
author: Dennis L.

description:
It's hard to find taiyaki in the Boston area, so I admit I'm not a taiyaki connoisseur. I was worried that the combination of black sesame soft serve and red bean filling in a fish-shaped pancake cone would be too sweet. But the flavors and textures were all perfectly balanced! The black sesame soft serve was delicious and complex, with just a hint of sweetness. Besides adding flavor and texture, the red bean filling forms a protective barrier, so the soft serve doesn't melt through the warm pancake. 

The taiyaki are made to order, unlike some of the other stands in Japantown. There was no line when I was here (weekday afternoon), and it only took about 2 minutes to get the fresh taiyaki!

$6 is a bit expensive for a small cone, but it includes one flavor of soft serve (matcha, black sesame, tofu, or seasonal), one filling (red bean or Nutella), and two toppings. It's actually a pretty filling snack! If you want something a bit lighter (and cheaper), you can also purchase the soft serve in a cup--but then how will you look cool and cultured on Instagram?!
author: Cathy Z.

description:
their tofu is so amazing. very light and great tofu flavor, not creamy at all since it is soy. Tastes just like what we had in Japan nishiki market in kyoto. The soy powder sprinkle on top was a great addition. We tasted the black sesame as well which was good but tofu was truly special.

$5.99 for a soft taiyaki cone, 1 topping (recommend red bean), and 2 flavors. We had tofu and matcha andy fiancee and I were so happy. Amazing deal!


They have a special flavor of the month lavender that a family was raving about but we didn't try.
author: Norases V.

description:
Best dessert I've had in Japantown so far. 

Line - Moves quickly. 

Service - Fast, efficient, and friendly. "Can I sample the tofu' flavor you have?" Response, "No, but we have something like that and you'll love it." It tasted like the sweet soy milk in slushie flavor from my childhood memory. 

Black sesame in taiyaki cone (red bean filling) - Incredible. It satisfied the sweet tooth that wasn't filled from a prior dessert fix. The sesame was grainy, the cone was warm and soft and about to fall apart, and the red bean filling was cool and filling. 

Wait time - I barely had 1-2 minutes between paying and pulling out my phone to set the camera setting to the optimal Instagram filter!
author: Ee Vonn Y.

description:
YASS it is overhyped...
YASS it is all for the gram...
AND YASS the wait can be too damn long...
BUT also YASSSS it's really freakn tasty!!!

This place is very small and it's also true (not sure why) that the line and process moves very sloowwww. But the trick is to pick up or eat beforehand (obvi. since this place is located in Japantown food central there are many yummy choices) AND then wait in line for dessert so you're not HANGRY. 

Menu is pretty straight forward and I highly recommend their well known flavors - Green Tea & Black Sesame!! Both of the flavors had a great creamy texture to it, while the taiyaki cone was fresh, slightly crunchy, and super tasty - not too sweet at all which I loved. Green tea was perfect (my fave) with matcha powder and pocky toppings, while the black sesame was also tasty with classic choco sticks. Also for portion, the size small was perfect for a sweet treat after a good meal - while other sizes can be good for sharing or empty bellies :)
author: Saleen L.

description:
This location is inferior compared to the Berkeley one. 

I was excited this location opened after frequently visiting the Berkeley one. Much closer and I don't have to go over the bridge. 

After I found out they didn't serve the mini taiyakis, I didn't bother going over to try it. I even went as far as asking their Facebook page when this location was going to serve the taiyakis, and they responded that they already do. Maybe I wasn't clear enough.

I decided to give it a go recently and was soooo let down. First off, their lines are ridiculous and not efficient. This results in a long line out the door, all the time. It's actually faster getting your order.

The quality is not of berkeleys standard. The soft serve was ice-y. Like it had tiny chunks of ice flakes in it, it was soft serve at all and barely had any flavor.

Side note: there was a guy that came back in with his taiyaki asking if the ice cream was supposed to be leaking out......I think he wasn't eating fast enough hahaha. 

I would avoid this place and go to the Berkeley one instead.
author: Lynn C.

description:
I don't really know what it was but the soft-serve was icy and not as smooth, creamy, or ... soft as I had anticipated. 

I got the matcha and sesame swirl in a cup. My first impression was that the color of the matcha was not as vibrantly green as what I've seen from Matcha Love, Milkcow, or LA's Tea Master. The color reminds me of matcha drinks that aren't blended well.... it looked pretty dark! 

Both flavors were disappointing. They were just okay, but nothing impressive. I think the texture put me off more than the flavor did.

On a more positive note, this soft serve might be good for those who like desserts that aren't that decadent or sweet. It's not rich at all and it actually tastes lighter than a lot of soft serves I've tried; I didn't taste much cream. 

Overall, the matcha was unmemorable. I enjoyed the coarsely ground sesame bits in the soft serve, but I wouldn't come back. It's just not as rich as I like my soft serves, but you might like it if you're into something light!
author: Emily C.

description: Yummy!! I got the black sesame and tofu with Nutella filling in a large! It was everything I wanted! Super happy with it. I later got the matcha and watermelon (not pictured). Can't wait to come back and check out there new flavors.
author: Alison B.

description:
My party asked for samples of ALL the flavors and they delivered! We were presented with small servings of EACH flavor. Bomb.

Ordered Small Taiyaki with black sesame! Red bean topping was molded into a little ball, so cute! The soy bean powder was just a small dusting. Couldnt taste anything. Choose another topping. 

Green tea doesn't taste like real green tea. Tofu flavor was interesting but not that interesting to actually order a small/full size.

Overall great customer service but they could make their green tea and tofu flavors more delicious!
author: Cynthia M.

description:
Ever since the novelty ice cream craze, I've been longing to try the ice cream stuffed in a fish shaped cone (taiyaki) and other things that Uji Time has to offer.  Located across from Daiso, you can easily spot this place due to the long lines, which moves painfully slow. However, the workers were kindly enough to offer samples of different soft-serve as we waited in lines. 

My pick is the black sesame with taiyaki and it goes beyond looks, they are actually delicious!  It was light and perfectly sweet, but not as creamy as I thought they would be. The only drawback is they melt quickly, especially if you paired it with the freshly made, warm taiyaki. The soft-serve are decently priced (~$6), but can get expensive with add-on toppings. 

Try for curiosity :)
author: Veronica C.

description:
What time is it?? It's Uji Time! 

As soon as you walk into the Japan center you instantly smell something sweat and doughy baking. Everywhere and in every shop you can smell it! Once the boyfriend and I located the culprit, we were lucky enough to walk right in and get our desserts quickly! As soon as we sat down on a bench outside, however, an enormous line formed.

Never having heard of this little shop (or even reading any reviews, we simply knew we had to try whatever was baking!) we walked in unaware of what to get. We both decided on the small little fishies filled with matcha (green tea) flavor. I got honey and matcha Pocky sticks on mine; boyfriend got crepe (I think) and chocolate rolls (I think lol) on his. WOW. That's all I can even say! Just remembering how creamy the ice cream was and doughy (in a good way). The taiyaki had just enough crunch on the outside but was so soft and warm (they make them) on the inside. 

Overall, I wish we lived closed because I could literally eat this everyday!
author: Anissa R.

description: We were walking around looking for a desert place to eat after finishing our dinner and stumbled upon Uji Time. It was the best decision we made. I've tried taiyaki but filled with cheese back home but this time it was filled with ice cream. The taiyaki shaped of a fish and you can choose different ice cream flavors. I wasn't familiar with the other flavors they had at the time other than matcha so we went with that. We also got the red bean filling. The wait time for this desert was about 10-15 minutes due to it being freshly made. But of course it came out faster. The large size is enough for 2 people or 1 if you're loving it aka me. There was no line so when we went so it was fast ordering and serving and eating it of course. I'd recommend coming here after eating a meal in the area or if you have a sweet tooth.
author: Mark D.

description:
Whenever I visit San Francisco, I often make a stop here for dessert. So far I have tried the Matcha, Black Sesame, Tofu, Strawberry Rose, Pumpkin Miso, and Sweet Potato. For a non-sweet tooth, order the Tofu soft serve. To my surprise, my favorite was Sweet Potato. Sadly, it was a seasonal flavor and it didn't look that pretty for pictures, but it was very naturally sweet tasting, and I wish that was on the everyday menu. 

Also, I have tried these softserve on a Takoyaki, waffle cone, and just a cup. I wish the takoyaki was crispier, instead the texture was more like an egg puff. The waffle cone doesn't taste right with softserve, should just be for ice cream in my opinion, therefore i prefer my Uji Time in a cup.

In addition, this location is in the heart of Japantown conviently located near Daiso,  grocery stores, and many popular resturants.
author: Sarah T.

description: Visited Japan town and after a plate of katsu curry, we wanted to grab a matcha dessert. There was about a 15min wait for the small size and a 20min for a large. The matcha flavor of the ice cream was pretty good. The wait makes things more trouble but the workers here are very fast and pumping out desserts very quickly. A little difficult to eat also, bc the fish cone is soft and the ice cream was melting on my hands.
author: Sarah C.

description:
instagrammy photos. but otherwise i may have to pass just because the flavors are not my cup of tea. but they have a huge line everytime i go so i know alot of people love it! if you like asian dessert then you should try. 

the fish cone is really cute though. here are the ice cream flavors: 

-matcha green tea
-tofu
-black sesame
author: Lisa V.

description:
No frills taiyaki-soft serve as well as offering mochi ice cream. I wasn't a fan of the flavors at the Berkeley location. But they have a seasonal melon flavor and it was good. I wasn't too fond of the black seasame and tofu flavors. 

You can either get a small/large taiyaki fish with nutella or bean inside with a flavor of soft serve and toppings. 

The line was pretty long at 9:40 pm on a Saturday and by the time ordered/received it was 10:10. There's no seating inside and it gets pretty warm in there. Best to get it and walk around or sit outside.
author: James H.

description:
Cashier was not having it. You can totally tell he does not want to be there. On the other hand, the soft serve here was good. I got the small Taiyaki and I thought it came with red bean filling by default but it didn't. I was bummed and my cone was empty inside. The small comes with 1 flavor and 2 toppings. I got the black sesame flavor with matcha powder and azuki which is red bean. I wished I had gotten the poppy seeds instead of the red bean but it was still good. They put the red bean on a stick and unfortunately mine fell :( My bf got the melon flavor and that was really good. 

The taiyaki cone is SUPER MESSY to eat. The soft serve will start to melt and drip down to the cone. I loved the taiyaki cone tho because it was soft, warm and had a bit of sweetness to it. But man it was dripping EVERYWHERE! Make sure to get about 5 napkins! Maybe ask for a cup to put the cone in. Overall it was good and it came out real fast right after ordering and I enjoyed my dessert!
author: Vanessa L.

description: I was excited to try this place but if I am being honest... not the best matcha and the new matcha cafe downstairs won me over more. It's still decent. The matcha black sesame swirl is a good combo. Nice people
author: Vicky T.

description:
Yum! Matcha is the way to go. I'll have to try black sesame next time though. I've gone to the Berkeley location before and their soft cream portion is small compared to here! Line was just at the door on a windy Saturday evening. I ordered a deluxe taiyaki fish cone with 1-2 flavors and 2 toppings for $7.99 + tax. Choose a filling of red beans, Nutella, or none. They filled my cone with Nutella, matcha below, seasonal hojicha on top, 3 matcha pocky sticks, plus rainbow sprinkles. Small taiyaki $5.99 comes w/ 1 soft cream flavor and 2 toppings while large $6.99 has 1-2 flavors, no toppings.

I don't know if it was my hot hojicha tea experience at Samovar 3 hours prior, but the soft cream wasn't to my liking. Not creamy enough and I might've gotten tired of the flavor. Matcha was on point, not too bitter nor sweet. I prefer Matcha Love's hojicha ice cream. Their taiyakis are premade so the estimated wait time was only a minute on the electronic menu board, despite the 5-15 min paper notice. It's definitely more thick and pancake-like than I'm used to. My first taiyaki experience was at Recess in SJ, hot and crispy with a soft interior and comes in flavors like green tea, taro, red velvet, and pumpkin. I've become accustomed to made to order cones. At least the premade one from Uji didn't melt my ice cream.

They also have mochi ice cream and slushes offered here. I wonder what the tofu soft cream tastes like, must be popular to be a menu regular. I'll try a sample in the future. Customer service is nice, nothing to complain about. It was warm in the shop due to taiyaki baking.
author: Kristine F.

description:
Woohoo! Finally had a chance to try this location. 
Best black sesame softserve I've had! The flavor is definitely rich & authentic black sesame, just the way I like it! Not for someone that wants something sweet.
I also tried the seasonal honey lavender, and it was okay. Too sweet for my tastes, and more honey than lavender. 

Normally I don't like red bean desserts, but combined with the warm taiyaki and the slightly bitter black sesame, it was a perfect combination.

The only downside, like all the other reviewers mentioned, is the mess. The taiyaki comes out fresh and warm, making the cone drippy. Its not hot enough to melt the ice cream at the top, but just expect a steady drip at the bottom of the cone. NAPKINS are a must.

There will most likely be a line out the door, especially since its a small storefront. Also you can smell the delicious taiyaki from a block away, so what do you expect? The line goes decently fast though, and is well worth the wait IMO! 

Ask for samples, they are happy to oblige.
author: Angela C.

description:
I really like the black sesame soft serve here so I came back to try their other items. There was a line, but it moved pretty quick.

I ordered the TOFU. The texture was more on the icier side instead of creamy and the flavor was subtle. It tasted of fresh cooked tofu, but the flavor was very light and aromatic. It wasn't bad, but it can be an acquired taste to some. The MATCHA was okay. I'm not a super huge fan of it, but it still had that nice earthy matcha flavor, but just not enough of it. It was on the lighter side of matcha. 

I would still come back. It's still my favorite place to get some black sesame and the service is always friendly.
author: Anh L.

description:
Apparently through a friend who is familiar with the popular spots in SF, we got lucky that there wasn't a line to get some dessert at Uji, so naturally we took advantage of the opportunity.

I'm not a big dessert person, but their black sesame soft serve was really good! The green tea pocky sticks were cool and the matcha powder was a nice contrast to the tasty gray soft serve, so it helped set up a nice little foodie worthy picture.

After I had a little bit of the soft serve, my girlfriend put in work on the rest of it and she got to the taiyaki part which was I was secretly waiting for!

It was definitely good, but it was also kinda cold, obviously not the part that was touching the soft serve, but the rest of the taiyaki itself was cold, like it had been left out for awhile.

Overall the place smells great and the dessert itself is worth getting. It does get kinda messy once it starts to melt though, so grab a few napkins beforehand.
author: Kurtis C.

description:
One of the very few traditional Japanese Taiyaki style ice cream desserts. Basically just very good "light" ice cream in traditional Japanese flavors like Black Sesame, Macha tea, or Sakura (cherry blossom) served in a soft waffle cone in the shape of a fish. It is almost impossible to find black sesame or macha ice cream at an ice cream shop and so this is a special treat. The prices seem very fair given that you get a couple toppings included. 

Not sure about tofu flavor...that just does not sound right for an ice cream flavor! It would be like serving cardboard flavor... 

I just wish some shop would serve ginger shoga ice cream again...can never seem to find this flavor anymore!
author: Ron M.

description:
We came here twice in the span of 2.5 days. That's how you know something is good. Girlfriend LOVED the black sesame soft serve. I liked it but wasn't that big of a fan. The matcha wasn't bad either. The cherry blossom soft serve was nice, subtle. My favorite thing was actually the fish cone, it was SOFT, WARM, Not too sweet and just doughy enough where it felt filling...just kidding, like this wouldn't be filling! The red bean inside of the cone was amazing. Really worked well with the cone. 

I like how the shop only lets 1 person in at a time to prevent crowding, since the shop is so small. The people who work there are super nice and helpful. Shop itself is incredibly cute, we loved the artwork on the walls. Lots of seating outside the store (mall and outdoor area).
author: Wennie H.

description:
Came here because they serve matcha and black sesame so I ordered the combo in a cup. This place is known for their taiyaki but I didn't care much for it as many reviewers have already said that it's overhyped, but it makes for a good instagram shot.

I was so excited to try their soft serve but honestly it was just decent. The matcha lacked that "matcha" flavor and was very underwhelming. I liked the black sesame the best but even then I wouldn't say it was amazing. Both flavors just tasted a bit watered down and is missing the richness of what matcha and black sesame should taste like. 

The soft serve looked like a lot but once you get passed the swirl you'll find an empty hole in the middle of the cup that should have been filled.
author: Christene M.

description:
I have book marked this place for quite some times.  I am glad I finally got to try it.  

I ordered the large with matcha green tea and black sesame soft serve with red bean filling.  Matcha green tea tasted little bit on the bland side, however the black sesame was very good. I think i would just come here for the black sesame instead.  

cute little shop for take out only.  good thing there's plenty of seats outside of the store, so you can enjoy it little bit.  

service is very nice and pleasant.  I was the only one there at that time, so i got my order right away... will I come back? sure will.  Black Sesame is LOVE!!!!
author: Candice Y.

description:
I am so glad I stopped by this dessert place in Japantown! Located in the plaza inside the shopping center, this little dessert shop is a force to be reckoned with! They are always busy and the line goes out the door.  Seating is very limited but you can find a seat on a bench outside. 

They have a small menu but great options.  Their most popular dessert is the taiyaki cone which comes in three sizes, or you can opt out for regular soft serve cone or mochi ice cream.  

I got the small taiyaki cone for $6, which comes with one flavor and two toppings.  Taiyaki is a pancake shaped like a fish, which they use as a cone.  For the flavor I got matcha (even though I sampled black sesame which was amazing also).  The toppings I got were pocky sticks, and azuki which is red bean paste.  This dessert was amazingly delicious and satisfying.  I would definitely come back next time I am in town.
author: Serena L.

description: They're super popular and have lines out the doors, however disappointed in their lack of vegan options. Especially since most of their flavors make an extremely creamy base that wouldn't even need dairy substitutes, they're naturally great vegan flavors. So I think it's a bit overrated and sweet, not flavorful enough to be worth the hype. Still giving the three stars for awesome flavor options. Just don't think it's the best it could be.
author: Alicia C.

description:
Stood in line for 15 minutes on a Saturday night. Was it worth it? Not really. Got the black sesame & hubby got the matcha. Decided to get ours on a waffle cone instead of the fish cone. Everyone who walked out with a fish cone was literally struggling to keep the ice cream from falling out the fish mouth! The fish was sogging up faster than expected. 

Anyhow, my black sesame was not as creamy as I expected it to be. Don't get me wrong, it was still overall good with a strong taste of sesame! The matcha was ok; tasted a bit chalky. 

I sampled the tofu flavor, and omg it literally tastes like tofu! I love tofu...but not enough to eat it as an ice cream flavor!!
author: Mei W.

description:
Super overdue review. This place replaced that one boba spot with the cotton candy  (Mitsu Teahouse), and I had no idea this place existed until I randomly searched up Taiyaki and it popped up. 

Think of this place as being like Matcha Love with the addition of Taiyaki.

Since it's located in Japantown (the side with Daiso Japan) it's pretty much near all the other stores.

Pros:
- Fairly simple menu, you choose your ice cream flavor, whether you want it in a fish or nah, and the toppings.
- Love the pocky sticks and matcha powder as my toppings.
- Parking is just pretty much the kind of parking you'd get if you were going to the other side of Japantown. Garage or Street.
- Interior is very simple and spacious however..

Cons:
- The layout of the inside is kinda weird so you'll be waiting outside the store for your order instead.
- Pretty expensive just to have the taiyaki instead of the cone.

I luurrrvvee matcha but I decided to be adventurous and opted for black sesame. It's pretty good and has a semi creamy texture, but it melted sooo fast because of the taiyaki. It's not really strong in flavor as Matcha Love, but it's closer so I'll take that.
author: Jerianne G.

description:
Best soft serve!!

What I've tried: 
*Matcha soft serve w/ red bean taiyaki
*Tofu soft serve w/red bean taiyaki
*Black sesame soft serve 

Overall thoughts: 
*Great flavors, my favorite is tofu and black sesame

*I love the consistency. It's on the icey side and which I like since I'm not into too creamy things

*A little pricy but also not really compared to your usual Ben n Jerry's typa ice cream shops 

*Busy hours are pretty inconsistant. I came on a weekend when there were only a few customers but came another weekend when there was a huge line out the door. Either way it's worth the wait!
author: Sarah W.

description:
I had a small taiyaki with Nutella filling and matcha ice cream with green tea pocky and matcha powder as toppings...BOMB. It wasn't overly sweet and it was good enough that I ate the entire thing which I normally don't finish most desserts. My friend had the sesame flavor and it was really good as well! The line was steady as we came on a Friday... but I most def recommend coming here and getting the taiyaki! 

See you next time, Uji!
author: Kathy T.

description:
Went to this location around 9:20pm on Saturday night. It's a bit hidden in the center but follow the smell of batter. ;) When we got there the line was long. We waited around 25 minutes to order. Ordering was easy and it didn't take long to get the dessert.

I got the small taiyaki with black sesame soft serve, Pocky/matcha powder topping, and the optional red bean filling. The other option for filling was Nutella.

I'm not sure what it is about black sesame but I love it. Texture of the soft serve is more icy than creamy. The seasonal flavor was cherry blossom and it was a very suttle, nice flavor. Not flowery or too sweet at all. The black sesame is delicious and you get a lot of flavor of black sesame. After eating through the soft serve, you end with the best part, the taiyaki! It's a nice mix of chewy and soft. Red bean filling wasn't overbearing and I was still able to taste the taiyaki. It's very similar to waffle batter but different texture. Would wait in line again over and over to get this every time. If you're in the area, GO HERE!! Even if your stuffed to your brim, you'll grow a second stomach. It's worth it.
author: Kimberly Y.

description:
This small soft serve shop had a line outside the door when we entered. You'd think serving soft serve would take seconds... but not quite. It turns out that the small fish cones are made fresh so they take a few minutes and the larger fish cone take 10 minutes!! That explains the wait.

Anyway, I ordered the matcha soft serve which was probably the best I've ever tried. I chose matcha powder and choco-sticks as my toppings. Huge warning to anyone who chooses matcha powder: DO NOT STEP OUTSIDE THE MALL. The wind blew the powder all over my clothes and it turned into a huge mess. I didn't know whether to eat my soft serve or pat off the matcha powder. 

Also, the fish cone comes out warm so your soft-serve melts faster. If you're like me, hurry up and take your pictures quick or else the soft serve drips everywhere. (This is why I couldn't insert a picture on Yelp).

Would I come back? Yes! Next time I'm getting more scoops.... in a bowl!
author: Love K.

description:
To be honest, I wasn't expecting much after reading a bunch of Yelp reviews while standing in line, but I really enjoyed my soft serve! I waited about 20 minutes in line which wasn't too bad. There were a lot of people but it moved fairly quickly. 

They are famous for their taiyaki with soft serve which comes in three sizes: small, regular, and deluxe. The small comes with one flavor and two toppings. The only difference between the regular and deluxe is the deluxe comes with toppings and the regular does not. You can choose two flavors for these. The taiyaki is also bigger. My boyfriend chose the regular size ($6.99) and I chose to get mine in a cup ($3.99) since I'm not big on taiyaki. As mentioned in other reviews, the soft serve starts melting down the sides of the taiyaki so it can get a bit messy. 

You can ask the cashier to sample the flavors! We tried the matcha, tofu, and the seasonal strawberry rose flavor. Their matcha soft serve isn't as good as other places I've been to, it's less creamy and more matcha-y. If you choose to do the swirl, you can do either matcha/sesame, or tofu/seasonal flavor. The strawberry rose was actually really good and had a strong strawberry flavor. I came here primarily to try the tofu soft serve and I was not let down! It tastes exactly like tofu pudding! I would stand in line again just for the tofu. Uji Time is worth a try if you're in the area and willing to wait a bit!
author: Cecille W.

description: Uji Deluxe ice cream is my favorite dessert in Japan town mall. My favorite flavors are tofu and sesame. Tofu flavor especially is unique and haven't found any flavor similar to it, I can only find at Uji. The Deluxe comes with 2 toppings of choice, bigger fish bread, and up to 2 flavors of choice. There are a lot of options for toppings. I recommend the pocky and red bean. There is this popular dessert in Korea called "boong uh bbang" aka "fish bread". Uji ice cream reminds me of my childhood eating those but just a better version of it with delicious ice cream. There's always a long line in front of Uji, especially on the weekend, so expect at least 15-30min wait. It will definitely be worth the wait, also instagram worthy appearance to it. #forthegram
author: Adel A.

description:
I've walked by Uji Time Desserts several times and there was always such a long line of people that I always passed on trying them. This time, however, there was no line and I relished the opportunity to finally try their soft serve ice cream.

I ordered the Deluxe Taiyaki with Matcha ice cream, Sesame ice cream, Azuki, and Dango. $7.99 for a beautiful work of art! Sadly, though, I found the flavors to be very subtle and not very sweet - great for people who don't care for sugary sweets but not so much for people like me!  I'm glad I didn't stand in line but I'm glad I finally tried them.
author: Aileen M.

description:
I came here with some coworkers after lunch on a Sunday. My go-to flavor has always been green tea wherever available, so I immediately knew what I wanted here: the matcha flavored soft ice cream!

There was no line and the orders came out quick for everyone. I got my matcha ice cream in a cup and couldn't finish all of it because I was kind of full from lunch (and probably because I don't really have a sweet tooth either).

The matcha ice cream was pretty good and I thought it was rich in flavor. I tried a scoop of my coworker's black sesame ice cream, and thought that was pretty good as well, maybe even better than the matcha!

One thing I wish for them to have would be an extra small size cup/cone.  Like I mentioned above, I don't care for sweets too much, but sometimes I do want something really small.

Overall, I would recommend this place to anyone looking for some matcha or black sesame ice cream.

P.S. If you want a nice Instagram photo, get the fish cone!
author: Wesley S.

description:
Stopped by Uji Time Dessert because my hubby has been talking about Taiyaki Ice Cream non-stop! Lol. Now, he officially tried it! He liked it. Quite spendy for what you get. But whatever, it cured his curiosity. He's happy, so I'm happy. :)

The cashier was very attentive and nice. To get to the ice cream, you'll have to wait in a very long line. Bleh. Smells heavenly outside though. Mmmm! :)

No vegan options. :(
author: Jen N.

description:
OVERALL: Great, smooth ice cream with warm toasted fish waffle cone? Can't ask for much more! 

THE WAIT: None on a Sunday around 12:45pm, but a small crowd formed right behind us. It seems to come and go in waves, but you probably never have to wait more than 5-10 minutes!

THE FOOD: 
* Black Sesame in fish cone w/ Red Bean topping - 4 stars
Smooth & rich, authentic flavor to the ice cream. However, the fish cone has red bean built in! Otherwise I wouldn't have gotten the red bean topping. 

* Seasonal flavor: Strawberry rose - 2.5 stars
I only sampled this, but the flavor wasn't very tasty. I have a friend who lives near Japantown and he says the seasonal flavor is never that great, unfortunately.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
I looooooove me some Uji time! I know its not everyone's cup of tea, but it's definitely mine. It certainly isn't for the ice cream lovers that love the standard extra creamy, extra sweet stuff- but for those of us that love a lightly sweet treat with a great balance of salt, an itty bit of savory/bitter, and a texture balance between the cream, taiyaki, and azuki beans then it is definitely the best! 

I always have trouble deciding between their delicious matcha, black sesame, and tofu flavors so any of those are great. Definitely try the fish pancake-- when you get to the bite where the cold meets the warmth of the pancake its like the perfect bite! 

My current fav is the small taiyaki with tofu, kinako (soy bean powder) and matcha powder as toppings. Give it a shot and let me know what you think (;

Also-- I've tried the Berkeley location and this location is WAY better. The cook/texture of the taiyaki is worlds apart.
author: Maggie Y.

description:
After a warm bowl of ramen, a nice cold soft serve sounded so amazing. So, I decided to stop buy at Uji Time! I was really drawn in when I saw this on yelp... First of all: it's adorable!! Secondly: it's a combo of 2 things I love, which are taiyaki and matcha! As my toppings I went for matcha powder and pocky sticks.

The soft serve's flavor of matcha was very light. The "taiyaki" tasted more like a waffle cone. Not the taiyaki taste I so much enjoy and expected. 

I'd come back next time to try the different soft serve flavors but might just get a regular cone. The taiyaki made it hard to eat without making a mess.
author: Mary R.

description:
There are some times when you just can't trust the hype. After waiting what seemed like an eternity holding off on spots like Somi Somi and other soft serve Taiyaki cone spots. I finally bit the bullet and tried Uji Time.

First off, for a place that's been open for a while now the line is just out the door ... line speed is also very slow. Probably waited close to 20 minutes. Once inside decided on their Summer flavor of Strawberry Rose in a small Taiyaki cone with dango. At the pick up window, I was told that they had no dango and they could give another topping and had to settle for some Pocky sticks- mind you, toppings cost extra.

The flavor of the Strawberry Rose was okay, more Rose tasting than strawberry which made it hard to finish when it was like eating really floral perfume. It was also too icy instead of the advertised "soft cream", seemed to be more of a sherbert than soft serve which was disappointing. The cone itself was okay. This dessert is definitely more for the aesthetics and the gram than it is for consumption, it's very messy to eat.

The shop itself is super small, it's more of a grab and go place. Perhaps the seasonal flavor wasn't a good choice, since it looks like the matcha is their signature flavor here. However, the appeal of the Taiyaki cone is not one worth waiting 20+ minutes in line for. Ended up eating half of the dessert and trashing the rest, was very underwhelmed at the experience here.
author: Janet N.

description:
I haven't been in Japan Town in years and was walking around nostalgia and happened to find this little shop! I went in around 1pm on a Thursday Noon and there isn't any line, So that would be the best time to come for desserts.

The staffs are friendly and the space of the shop is cute and clean! Menu is very easy to read so I don't feel lost ordering my ice cream. I ordered a Small Taiyaki with Matcha Ice Cream and toppings was Green Tea Pocky and Chocolate Swirl Sticks. It was so good and satisfying. 

The Matcha ice cream is rich in flavor and not too sweet and is well balanced with the Taiyaki breading. For a small size, they gave me a lot of ice cream! I thought they gave me a medium! So for the price of it, is worth it! Their menu did mention there is a 1-5min wait because they are making on the spot to give you the freshness of the Taiyaki.

Once I finished all the way to the tail, There was a hidden topping inside. It was red bean paste! I love the ending surprise. I would definitely come back here for more. Must try their Mochi ice cream next time!
author: Sheena C.

description:
With the matcha, black sesame and tofu soft serve, taiyaki cones and mochi offerings, Uji Time's second Bay Area outpost fits in perfectly in SF's Japantown.  However, I prefer the Berkeley location because it has seating and an expanded menu (i.e. the parfait, mini taiyaki stuffed with either red bean or Nutella).  

I've been here on weekends and have experienced long lines (Saturday afternoons) and no lines (Sunday evenings).  The service has always been quick and orders get cranked out in no time.  

If you've never had a taiyaki cone you might as well get one for the 'gram/snap, but I find them stiff and unappealing taste-wise.  My go-to is the black sesame in a waffle cone.  It's decent soft serve at an alright price.  I honestly prefer Matcha Love in San Jose, but if you live in the East Bay you'll just appreciate having Uji time close by sans the craziness of the Mitsuwa Marketplace.  We'll see what happens when Matcha Cafe Maiko finally lands in March...
author: Iona C.

description: Very reasonable prices for taiyaki! I have been here twice in two days and I have to say that their flavors are very good. I got the black sesame on my first visit and the tofu on the second, the worker was very friendly and she let me sample flavors because it was my first time. I would highly recommend the tofu flavor!!
author: Tammy L.

description:
Tofu soft serve. Excellent tofu flavor (reminded me of dofu fa) and slightly sweet. $4.25/cup plus tax.

Service = friendly. They let us try all the flavors - matcha, black sesame, tofu and lavender (limited summer flavor). 

My only issue with this soft serve and it might just be their style, it's more icy than creamy. 

Yes, they have taiyaki but I'm not a fan of that cone so I skipped it. (~$7.) They also have toppings for a surcharge.
author: Fannie S.

description:
Tofu and sweet potato were pretty good. Could not pick one over the other. Glad to have ordered both. Their ice cream is not heavy, creamy, nor sweet. Taiyaki as an alternative over a cone is great option beyond the norm. It pairs well especially when you are in the mood for cake. 

The line can stretch but generally moves quick. Undecisive customers requesting samples can be a factor. They are well staffed and that's a plus.
author: Gene B.

description:
If you don't order the taiyaki cone, what was the point of even coming to uji time?

The wait however can be a big deterrent. Aside from the line to place your order, depending on how far along the next batch has been prepped, you could wait an additional 15-20 minutes for your cone to be finished.

Black sesame and matcha are my go to flavors but am interested in trying out the tofu next time. There's also seasonal flavors - which is currently strawberry rose.

I do prefer the Berkeley location over Japantown. There's much more seating and a larger menu.
author: Jenn Y.

description:
Overall: sorta overpriced and overhyped but I still think it's super yummy! 

I got the seasonal rose strawberry with the taiyaki and my bf got the matcha taiyaki. 
Taiyaki - I'm not a big fan of the bread and ice cream trend (not counting waffle cones) so I thought the taiyaki was just ok. 
Soft serves - The matcha was strong matcha flavor - I really liked it but I could see how it could be overwhelming. I really really loved the rose strawberry. I thought mine was very refreshing and wasn't overly floral. 
 
Small place that usually has long lines, so expect to wait. This place could be compared to a soft serve Hot Dog on a stick. Just like waiting for the hot dog breading to be fried, you gotta wait for the taiyaki to be made.
author: Christie S.

description:
Yummy dessert place located in Japantown near Daiso.

A bit pricey but they have some rare flavors like: matcha, sesame, tofu, and a seasonal flavor which is currently strawberry rose atm. 

About $4 for just soft serve in a cone or bowl. Next they taiyaki w/ soft serve which varies in price according to size and amount of toppings. Prices for it are $6-$8  

No seating inside and it's pretty small as well. Parking garage (paid) or street parking available 

I ordered matcha with taiyaki. Ice cream was not overly sweet. Taiyaki was soft and crispy. Only thing I didn't like was how messy it was! Ice cream also melted at a fast rate. Overall yummy dessert place!
author: Michele G.

description: Ever since I came here first time a few months ago, I have to get the Taiyaki ice cream here every time I come to Japan town. Personally love the matcha flavor with read bean and pocky toppings, so delicious. My friend got the black sesame last time and it's also not bad. Honestly, I like the Taiyaki better than the ice cream, it's like a very flavorful pancake, very soft and pairs with the ice cream perfectly. Would definitely come back again. The one downside is the ice cream melts sooo fast, I literally have to shove all the ice cream in my mouth very quickly or throw half of the ice cream away. The line can be long when there is an event at Japan town, but not too ridiculous most of the time.
author: Rachel G.

description:
Yessss, finally got to try taiyaki soft serve! I wasn't intentionally seeking Uji Time out, but we passed it on our way to grab ramen from Marafuku and our dessert spot was decided right then and there. They must get pretty busy later on in the day, as there was a sign telling you to wait outside until it was your turn at the cashier. 

Don't be afraid to ask for samples, except maybe let the cashier know if you want to sample all 4 flavors (matcha, black sesame, tofu, and seasonal) so they don't have to keep walking back to the soft serve machine...hehe, sorry! Matcha was alright - pretty weak tea flavor. Current seasonal flavor is honeydew melon, and they got the flavor spot on! Really refreshing. Tofu reminded me of doufufa, or the silken tofu pudding you can get at dim sum - my friend was not so much a fan of this. I ended up getting black sesame on a small taiyaki, but it was a pretty close call with the tofu and melon. My friend got the large taiyaki for a dollar more with the black sesame and melon. The taiyaki itself it slightly sweet and they seem to be inconsistent with how cooked it is - mines was darker than my friend's. It certainly is very photogenic, but not the best vessel for soft serve - I had soft serve dripping down my arms by the time I got to the tail, and I eat FAST.

They can swirl the matcha and black sesame, but if you want to mix any other flavors you'd have to get a large/deluxe. Red bean/nutella is an optional filling for the taiyaki, and I didn't realize so I wasted one of my toppings on red bean, which is literally a scoop of red bean held in place with a popsicle stick...bound to fall off. And of course, mines did :(
author: Anna R.

description:
I can't believe I waited 45 minutes for this place! 

Their soft serve is DECENT. It's nothing spectacular considering how long the line is. If you want really good soft serve, go to LA and check out SomiSomi. I would totally wait in line for that!
author: Angelina H.

description:
This place is kinda hard to find! It is in Japan Town and is located on the very first floor (kinda basement-ish) inside of the shopping center. I actually went out of my way to look for this but I was a bit disappointed. 

I got the Taiyaki with seasonal flavor (Strawberry Rose) with matcha powder and Pocky stick as toppings and my boyfriend got Sesame soft serve w/ red bean paste and Pocky stick. I personally liked the Sesame better, you can really taste the flavor. Strawberry Rose is kind tangy and not too sweet but the flavor didn't really stand out as the sesame. 

Unfortunately, our Taiyaki were really dry :( Not sure bc we came late or that's how it's supposed to be. But overall, I liked the soft serve and I thought the toppings were good.
author: Yen L.

description:
I loooooove this place!!! The black sesame ice cream is incredible. If you have a sweet tooth, you will also appreciate the lavender flavor.
My favorite: Yuzu Mojito Mochi & Mango Thai Basil Mochi Ice Cream
author: Aakriti S.

description: Super yummy soft serve ice cream! You can have it in a cup, a waffle cone, or a fish shaped cone (taiyaki, which is soft like a pancake, not crunchy like a regular cone). We tried the matcha and black sesame flavors and were not disappointed. The azuki beans were a great addition! There was a line of people before it opened on a Friday at noon, but it went quickly. Uji Time is located on the first floor of the Japantown East mall.
author: Florence A.

description:
When I was a student at Berkeley, I would go to Uji Time all the time! It was one of my absolute favorite dessert places to visit with friends. After graduating, I rarely ventured north of San Francisco so I was super excited when I heard that Uji Time was opening another location in Japantown. 

I came on a Wednesday afternoon, and there was a line to order but it moved pretty quickly. I really wanted to try the dango (mochi) topping but they were sold out so I decided to just go with the regular taiyaki cone ($6.99). This comes with a full-sized taiyaki and your choice of 1-2 flavors of soft cream. I've tried the matcha, black sesame, and tofu flavors at Berkeley, and my favorite has always been matcha. It's earthy, sweet, and has a pretty concentrated flavor. The tofu flavor is really unique - it tastes like soy milk and tofu pudding but in a frozen yogurt form. The Japantown matcha and tofu soft creams were pretty identical to Berkeley's. The Taiyaki cone tastes like a thick, crunchy waffle, and the red bean at the bottom is always a nice surprise. I enjoyed my dessert, as always. 

Unfortunately my experience as a whole wasn't as great as I expected. This Uji Time had a very different vibe than the one in Berkeley. I fondly remember sitting at the Berkeley location for up to 1 hour sometimes, just chatting with friends, playing board games, and enjoying our desserts. At the Japantown location I felt extremely rushed, and there was nowhere to sit and enjoy the ice cream. In addition, the cashier was extremely unfriendly. I had a couple questions about the toppings and prices, and she seemed really annoyed.

I'm still giving this place 4 stars because my ice cream was tasty and brought back fond memories of my dessert outings in Berkeley, but my experience as a whole was a bit of a letdown.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Because we are masochists, my friends and I decided to swing by here for some taiyaki ice cream after KBBQ buffet. Maybe it was because I was already full to the brink of pain, but I wasn't terribly impressed with this place.

Rating Breakdown:

1/2 Stars for Taste --
I tried the matcha, black sesame, and pumpkin miso (seasonal) before ultimately settling on the pumpkin miso. I think all three were more subtle flavors. If you had blindfolded me and made me guess the three flavors, I probably wouldn't be able to guess them without much lip-smacking and deep thought. I wouldn't say the pumpkin miso tasted particularly like pumpkin or miso, I ultimately just chose it because I'm a fan of savory-sweet combinations. Also, FYI their ice cream borders more on the icy side and less on the creamy side. (I must confess I tend towards creamier ice cream, but that's a personal preference.) I found the taiyaki to be a little over hard/dry, but I think most places make it that way to withstand the sogginess of melted ice cream. 

0.5/1 Stars for Value --
It was $5.99 for a small taiyaki (1 flavor + 2 toppings), $6.99 for regular (1-2 flavors), or $7.99 for "deluxe" (1-2 flavors + 2 toppings). There are a few options for free toppings, but most of the worthwhile toppings cost $.50 or $.75. I don't think $6 is out of line at all (you would definitely pay $3 each for a scoop of ice cream and a taiyaki), but it is a pricy option for dessert. I didn't feel like the quality of the ice cream or the taiyaki quite cut it for me.

1/1 Stars for Customer Service --
The server offered us samples to help us choose an ice cream flavor. Even though the line behind us got pretty long, the ice cream pretty much came out right after we paid. I don't know if that's the norm or if we just got lucky.

No bonus star because I probably wouldn't come back. Not a fan.

TL;DR -- Interesting flavors (but subtle), ice cream is more icy than creamy. Come here more for the novelty than anything else.
author: Abby W.

description:
Their sweet potato flavor goes so well with the taiyaki. It's much sweeter and creamier than their tofu ice cream, so be prepared for a mess if you order it!

Personally I would just order a small taiyaki with sweet potato next time instead of a regular with two flavors. I thought that it would go well with tofu, but it didn't. If they are unfortunately out of sweet potato, I will continue to get tofu and black sesame.

One star off this time because my taiyaki wasn't cooked all the way through! There was still some raw batter near the tail and I had to break that section off :(
author: Erika C.

description:
Good service and cute place, but the "soft" serve doesn't cut it for me. I gave this location a try since I've tried Uji Time in Berkeley too. Both locations have hard icy ice cream. And the cone is hard. I haven't been able to finish a cone at either place. It makes for a great picture though. 

Matcha love in San Jose is soooooooft and delicious by far.
author: Corinna T.

description:
The hype is real. The soft serve ice cream is delicious and quite perfect. I got the regular matcha and black sesame in a taiyaki come. Both matcha and sesame were super delicious in their own unique way, but the flavors don't really blend well so I would suggest picking just one. The red bean in the taiyaki was a sweet surprise and went perfectly with the ice cream. (The small size doesn't come with red bean inside.) The taiyaki cone was crispy on one side and soft on the other; I do wish it was crispy all the way through. 

Overall, I would definitely come back! There was a long line but they are pretty efficient and it moves at a steady rate.
author: Jacqui C.

description:
Taiyaki cone: $5.99 (small); $6.99 (Reg)
Regular waffle cone: $3.99 (one size)

Uji has a countdown clock on their menu board displaying your wait time if you order a Taiyaki cone (because the taiyaki are freshly made daily).
On a cold Saturday night the line was approx. two stores down at around 8:30pm. 

The black sesame here is delish and I'd recommend it for everyone who is tired of Matcha at the moment.
author: Victoria X.

description: Long lines for this "fish" cone. The Macha was light and flavorful and the cone was great but I bet if the cone was fresh this would be epic and worth the wait dessert. Since our cone was cold it missed its potential. Enjoyable treat but would not wait in line again
author: David B.

description:
The sweet smell of absolute mouthwatering cold perfection hits you like a truck. Came here twice, and it keeps me wanting more! We came on a weekday around noon and there was practically no line. 

Y'all but real talk: the black sesame was so good I gobbled it down 'til the last bite. I'm kind of biased cause I love black sesame but srsly this was hands down one of the best I've tried. The red bean on the side added a nice change in flavor and texture. 

The matcha on the other hand was alright. I also tried some seasonal tea flavor the last time and it was amazing. So upset that it's no longer on their menu :(
author: Graciela T.

description:
I loved the swirl of matcha and black sesame! I knew I wanted to try both flavors but did not want to get a large size as I was pretty full at the time. So the swirl worked perfect for my taste! Each flavor was very satisfying.
I went on a Thursday afternoon and the line was short (5 mins wait). They also have tofu flavor and a seasonal one (it was melon when I was there). 
The swirl was less than $5 which I thought was very reasonable. I highly recommend it!
author: Amy L.

description:
I'm not big on sugary sweets, but I am big on tofu. How does this relate? Why, tofu dessert, but of course! 

For those of you who are like me who want to indulge in ice cream without it being too sweet, Uji Time's tofu ice cream is right up your alley. Mild and refreshing, this was such a unique concept to dessert on the go. 

Located in Japantown San Francisco, this small ice cream shop is surprisingly not busy. It's hidden inside the Eastern part of Japantown Center Mall where Daiso is. 

Love!
author: Ann S.

description:
My sister and I came here to try out their taiyaki.  She had the Sesame, and I had the seasonal flavor, Sweet Potato.  They were both awesome as they were cute.  I also had their Mochi Icecream.  All was delicious.

This is a small ice cream shop located in Japantown.  We were fortunate to get there when it wasn't so crowded.  We sat in front of the shop to enjoy our dessert, and saw it get packed when it got closer to closing time.  It was crazy how busy it got.  I can easily see how a long line forms right outside.  It was like waiting to get into a club...had those ribbon things outside the door. LOL. 

I gave it 4 stars because our taiyaki could have been more fresh.  It felt a little stale until I got further down towards the end.  The ice cream was great on both the taiyaki and in the mochi.  

Great little spot!
author: Cat D.

description:
There are a lot of amazing ice cream joints in San Francisco, but this one is my favorite. Upon arrival, you might notice there's a long line, but have no fear, the line moves fast! It's also super warm inside because of all the homemade taiyaki cones they're making.

I always order Matcha soft serve with the taiyaki cone. The soft serve is by far the best matcha ice cream I've ever had. The taiyaki cone is so unique, I've never had such a soft and flavorful cone. When you reach the bottom of the cone, there's some yummy red bean paste to finish everything off. It's seriously the best treat!
author: Mallory L.

description:
Something new! We were walking around japan town when we stumble upon this place. The first thing that caught my attention is fish looking cone. And of coarse as a foodie i should try it. 

We ordered the regular size that comes with 2 flavors. The flavor of the day which is pumpkin something (i can't remember) and the matcha. Those were the 2 flavors we picked. And it was really good. I like how its not so sweet at all. It was just right, not as creamy and thick like a regular ice cream,more like a soft ice cream kind. It was really good! And the fish looking cone was good as well. For me it taste like a waffle but more on the cakey side. 

It was definitely worth the try. I would go back again and try other flavors.
author: Jhearl S.

description: This is my favorite place to go for matcha ice cream! It's flavorful and savory and the red bean paste at the bottom of the taiyaki cone are such a great combination. I always get matcha soft serve in a taiyaki cone with red bean paste, and top it off with honey drizzle and two Pocky sticks. The cone taste like a pancake and is usually still warm when they hand it to you, guaranteeing that it is made fresh. The only downside is that the line can be very very long and it can be pricey, $5-6 for a regular size. Still worth the trip and wait if you have never experienced taiyaki though!
author: Libby M.

description:
I love that there's a place where you can always find black sesame and matcha flavored ice cream! 

For those that don't know, black sesame has a deep, earthy, nutty flavor. It isn't very sweet. If you are someone that really likes nuts, enjoys sesame, then this is definitely for you. 

The matcha is really good here - it's very vibrant and deep, and doesn't taste chemically or super sweet like some cheap types can. 

We got here just 10 min before closing and they still had some of those lovely fish waffles. They weren't the most fresh at that hour, but they did the job. We got small taiyakis with red bean filling. The red bean was great, not overpowering. 

I don't know that I'd stand in line for 30 min like some people do, but if I'm ever in the area again and there's no wait, I'm definitely popping in for some more black sesame! 
Also, hella people got the tofu flavored, so I know I definitely need to try that out. 

Oh, and last note, dudes: freakin' tip! There were a couple of people ahead of us that ordered taiyakis (which take time to prep and serve!) and they didn't tip! Don't be those people. Be kind. If you can afford to eat out, you can afford to tip. If you can't tip 20-25%, at least do 10%.
author: Amy R.

description:
We were on the search for taiyaki. We stumbled upon this place thanks to yelp! 

Parking is available in the Japan Center Mall. Uji time Dessert is located on the 3rd building of the mall. It is a small shop on the 1st floor. 

We came in and were greeted by the staff. There were different items to choose from, but we knew we wanted taiyaki with black sesame ice cream. 

You can add on other things like mochi, pocky sticks, azuki beans and powders. 

We ordered and got the right ice cream but in a waffle cone. Changed it, and still got it wrong. Third times a charm, because we finally got it with the taiyaki cone on the third try. 

The taiyaki cone was crisp on the outside and soft on the inside. The black sesame was pretty good! There were other flavors like coconut ash and tofu (whaa!? Ya i know, but I sampled it and it was pretty good). 

Overall it was the perfect dessert to share with my new hubby! Much better blemd of flavors than the one we tried in Hawaii.  Hoping we make it back one more time before we leave!
author: Aggie C.

description:
I actually came here simply to try their matcha soft serve. I honestly would have been content with it in a waffle cone for $3.99 but just my luck, waffle cones had sold out so I had no choice but to try the taiyaki cone instead. It's not that I didn't want to in the first place, but $6.50 was pretty steep for a fish shaped vessel.

All said and done though, my matcha taiyaki cone really hit the spot on a warm San Francisco afternoon. The matcha soft serve wasn't as creamy as other places I tried, nor did it have a nice strong matcha flavor. However, the option of matcha powder as a topping definitely added the much needed boost in flavor. My other add on was pocky sticks but I think I'll try azuki beans next time (was sold out this time. Poppy seeds were also sold out).

As for the vessel itself, it's pretty much a thicker waffle cone with the crispy exterior and soft interior. It's definitely more for the Instagram though because I found that it was pretty difficult to eat without squirting soft serve one direction or the other. That said, my favorite part of the cone was undoubtedly the azuki nugget towards the tail. Totally awesome surprise there!

All in all, decently good dessert/snack. Hopefully next time I come, they won't be sold out of multiple things...!
author: Elaine Y.

description:
Heard so much about this place figured I'd give it a go and honestly wasn't impressed at all. 

First of all you'll never get the daily special ice cream unless you come the moment it opens and they don't take down the sign either so they get everyone's hopes up for nothing.

Secondly, the wait is too long for the taiyaki's to be made. It seems like they run out way too quickly and do small batches so be prepared to wait 30 minutes.

Finally, my taiyaki was overcooked and the black sesame ice cream just towered over it so you had to scarf it down before it ended up every where.

While visually it looked pretty it was pretty much average overall.
author: Vanessa S.

description:
Great location in Japantown, near Daiso in the side that is less busy.

Fun decor and vibe, and a steady line of people out the door around 9:40pm (20 mins before closing) on a Tuesday. 

Very good taiyaki. I regret using matcha powder as 1/2 of my toppings for a small taiyaki because it made me cough. It would probably be fine with a flavor other than green tea matcha, however!
author: Lizzie S.

description:
It's cute, it's quick, and it's organized well. A small taiyaki is actually a lot more filling than it looks!

Just FYI, they do let you sample flavors.
Matcha tastes like matcha.
Black sesame tastes like peanut butter.
Tofu tastes likes Vietnamese soy milk. 

Their descriptions, not mine, although their descriptions are pretty accurate.

I had a small red bean taiyaki with matcha ice cream. The dough held up to the ice cream well, which is also a bonus.
author: Sany N.

description:
Good spot in Japantown to get a trendy taiyaki cone dessert. The taiyaki outshines the soft serve ice cream itself though, so I'll only say its so-so. I'd probably come back though since I'm a sucker for these.
