Note that if you want to get Taiyaki there's additional wait to that since they make it fresh! They also have seasonal flavors that are worth trying, I sampled the lavender flavor and it was delicious as well!
author: Jamie Y.

description:
Not a huge selection but still good. To be honest, I went more for the aesthetics and because my friend really wanted to go there. 

Their selections for soft serve: matcha, black sesame, tofu, and their seasonal flavor (which wasn't available when we arrived during opening.. what's up with that :( also, on one of their pictures near the line, it said that taiyaki cones come with mochi as a topping? It was a little misleading since they didn't offer it as a topping. 

They offer free samples which was cool. Tofu literally tastes like tofu loool. 

And the black sesame and matcha were great in flavor.

I got the matcha with red bean and green tea pocky sticks (they ran out of chocolate sticks.. we literally ordered 20 mins after opening) in a taiyaki cone. It was great, and fun but melted through the cone fast! So warning: it can be very messy!! Grab extra napkins if possible lol. 

Would I come back? Not sure. Maybe for the mochi ice cream? But to be honest I'd rather go to Mitchell's ice cream or get a crepe from Sophie's, but the concept was fun. Perfect place if you just wanted matcha, sesame, or tofu ice cream though. 

They do serve in a cone and serve mochi ice cream (I think it's ice cream?) as well.
author: Kimberly T.

description:
Something is missing from their soft serve. It was just okay. I think its more waterly than the others I have tired. I just got the blend of matcha and black sesame for $4. The flavors doesn't really stand out as much as the sugar they put in it. My friend and I didn't finish the small. I think I prefer matcha love a lot more.

No rush to go back.
author: Sandy B.

description: Delicious ice cream treats! Located in the Japantown shopping area and is worth visiting. You choose from 4 flavors: black sesame, matcha green tea, vanilla, and tofu. Then you can choose between a cone, cup, or fish bun with various toppings. When I went they had a seasonal flavor; lavender, which was amazing! Would not recommend tofu, as it has a very strong flavor. My favorite was the matcha, and I hope to come back.
author: Caitlin H.

description:
Absolutely adorable ice cream taiyakis! If you're an Instagram food fanatic like I admittedly am, Uji Time is worth the 30-45 minute wait, and the drips and drops that come with your melted soft-serve when you're done taking pictures.

This is the trendy but tasty place you've probably been seeing all over the Internet. I'm glad they haven't gone for mainstream, Americanized flavors, and stuck with matcha, black sesame, and tofu. There is a lavender option if you want something more floral. You can top your taiyaki off with stuff like matcha Pocky, sprinkles, or roasted soybean flour.

You'll be best off eating a small taiyaki with toppings to save space for the other delicious food in Japantown. However, if you really have a craving for red bean-stuffed fish tails, the most expensive taiyaki (deluxe, which comes with 1-2 soft-serve flavors and 1-2 toppings) only costs $7.99. I think the mochi is certainly a bit more pricey than I'm used to, as is the soft-serve cones, but rent around here is pretty expensive.

It appears that dango is featured on many of their pictures, but they don't yet offer it at this location. I'd also like to see more drinks outside of Calpico slushies.

They're also hawking succulents on a ledge against the wall, which make for a nice picture background if you hold your taiyaki in front of the price tag.
author: Gwen W.

description: I love their flavors: matcha, black sesame and tofu. They also have seasonal flavors and currently it is strawberry! And it is so good!! If you have not yet tried their taiyaki cones, you need to! The small one comes with two toppings!
author: Theresa H.

description:
Approve of the tofu flavor (reminded me of a classic chinese dessert), matcha was solid as well and the black sesame paired well with the matcha 

The shell itself, while great for IG and looks pretty it had one major drawback. The shell was too doughy which made it hard to finish and gave the dessert a strange texture. Also, the challenge was biting into the shell without accidentally squeezing out the froyo so keep that in mind unless you want froyo on your clothes 

Mochi had a good consistency and the flavors ring true

Overall Thoughts

I wouldn't want a long time to get dessert here but if it's quick I would pop in again...apparently, they still have a few more items that aren't available yet but can be found in the Berkeley shop
author: Eddie W.

description:
Tried this place in Berkeley recently and very excited that they decided to open in Japantown! It is still soft opening but grand opening is this Saturday. Glad I was able to come by before the long line!
Ordered the regular taiyaki cone with matcha and black sesame soft serve. I wish the soft serves were swirl instead of matcha on top and sesame on bottom. Regular is a bit big for one person so I would order the small next time. I also wish they had the mini taiyakis like they do at the Berkeley location! But I'm sure they'll add them once they get started. 
Also they have Calpico slushy!!!!!! Whaaaaa? That's the first I've heard of it. The girl was very nice and let me try some and I would definitely get some when it's warmer or the next time I go. Be sure to get a stamp card!!
author: Kristie L.

description: My favorite matcha soft serve ice cream place in San Francisco, the flavor is strong but not too overwhelming. The texture is not too thick / hard to swallow. Hands down one of the best places, but of course nothing compare to the ice cream in Tokyo
author: Kaylee P.

description:
Hands down the best authentic taiyaki place in California. 

The soft serve is really good with rich flavors that don't taste artificial, while the fish is softly baked and scrumptious.

My personal favorite flavors are the matcha and the refreshing soybean. The only downside is that you can't swirl these two flavors together.

Additionally they have seasonal flavors from time to time, so don't forget to ask!
author: Hennie N.

description:
Smelled the waffle cone smell passing by and decided to stop in. I ordered chocolate mochi, the deluxe taiyaki and 2 small taiyaki. Total price was $25, which I'm still undecided if it was reasonable. 

So, for the taiyakis we all ordered matcha. Maybe I'm not a matcha fan, but I just did not care for it. 

The presentation is really cute, and I'm pretty sure the rest of my party liked it, but for me, it just wasn't my thing!
author: Emie S.

description: To me, it is one time experience spot for ice cream.  I ordered small black sesame flavored taiyaki. The ice cream was ok, but lack of creamy feeling, more like sesame flavored snow to me. Taiyaki was cold, hard to say it is good or bad. At least, the red bean paste was oki taiyaki was ok.
author: Silvia L.

description: My favorite go spot.   I highly recommend matcha with nutella filling or black sesame and red bean.  I was hesitant to try black sesame but they let me sample it and he described it as peanut butter. To my surprise it is very similar.  I like this location in particular because you get 2 sides like choco sticks or pocky sticks.
author: Lynnelle E.

description:
The line was long but it was moving pretty quickly. The taiyaki cones were definitely the best part! Fresh, warm, and soft! We tried all 3 available flavors: matcha, tofu, and black sesame. 

Of the 3 the black sesame was our favorite! If you're a matcha fan that one was good too, and the tofu tastes a lot like Yeo's Soymilk. Good topping options: complimented the soft serve. 

They also have Mochi ice cream (we didn't try) and a seasonal flavor (out of stock). The only thing I wish was different was more flavor options.

Overall, a very enjoyable experience!
author: Aja M.

description:
This was my second time trying taiyaki and boy, did it satisfy my sweet tooth and matcha addition! 

SWEETS:
In addition to the taiyaki (fish ones) they also have regular cones and cups. They offer 2 sizes for fishes: mini and regular. (we ordered the mini size: see picture below for reference) They have 3 soft serve flavors: matcha, tofu (taste like asian soy milk) and black sesame. I enjoyed all the flavors as they were strong and true to actual flavors! Since this is a specialty shop, I dare say the matcha flavor is definitely stronger than non-specialty places. As for the fish cone itself, it felt sturdy. Soft crunchy texture on the outside and soft spongy on the inside without being soggy from the soft serve. I also like the touch of red bean that is hidden at the bottom if the fish. Each fish cone also comes with 2 toppings of your choice (pocky sticks, red bean, sprinkles, etc) The only improvements I suggest are adding a flavor swirl option and different flavor fishes! :D

They also server Calpico flavored slushies and mochi ice cream in various flavors. 

SERVICE: 
I was surprise there was no line when we came on a Saturday evening. So our fishes came out quickly,but also melted quiet fast. 

AMBIANCE:
Uji over took that cotton candy milk tea place across from Diaso in the JT plaza. It's actually very small and has pretty much zero room to sit, but there are benches outside the shop for you to enjoy your fish - not to mention the many benches outside the plaza!
author: Samantha F.

description:
Not a fan. The tofu and black sesame were both too icy for my taste. The ICE cream tasted watered down and not CREAMY as I expected :( 

Also very pricey! The fish cone is unique, and looks great for IG, but not worth the $2+ additional. One serving is def enough for two people. 

Glad I finally came to try it, but I'll likely not come back :(
author: Dana Z.

description:
Not worth what ended up being an hour wait for an undercooked taiyaki cone; kinda sad this ended up being my first 2 star rating.  

I arrived on a Saturday at around 4pm, and ended up waiting 30 min in line and then 30 min for their regular-sized taiyaki cone.  They had originally told us 15 min but for some reason it ended up being 30 min.  One couple in front of me ordered two regular-sized taiyaki cones; by the time they gave them the second one, the guy was almost done with his cone. Another couple asked to switch to a mini with a refund; it was taking so long.  Mini cones on the other hand take 5-10 min.  

Service didn't help with the wait at all.  The cashier had a bored attitude and had me repeat my order maybe 3 times.  They forgot orders rather frequently; during my 30 min waiting for food time, maybe 6 people came up to inquire about an order they had forgotten.  Even when people asked about the time for their cones, they probably gave some of the most insincere "sorry" I've ever seen, for example when they changed the wait time from 15 min to 20 min and then to 30 min.  

I ordered a deluxe cone (regular sized cone with two toppings) with black sesame soft serve, azuki bean and pocky.  While waiting I also ordered a red bean mochi ice cream.  

Red bean mochi- good texture; not too sweet for my taste.  Also wasn't served ice cold but warmed enough to enjoy immediately.

Taiyaki ice cream- the black sesame ice cream thankfully wasn't sweet, though it did have a weird aftertaste (and I usually love black sesame anything).  Adding the azuki was helpful to add sweetness.  Because the cone was still warm, you had to eat the ice cream quickly because it melted quickly.  However, my biggest problem with my taiyaki cone was that one side was UNDERCOOKED.  To think that I waited that long for an underdone cone is incredibly disappointing.  

Things I would have done differently (and who knows if this would have affected my experience):
- go on a weekday possibly to avoid any long line
- order a mini taiyaki cone so it won't take so long

I sincerely hope that the staff will work on making the experience better, especially since there were a LOT of disappointed / frustrated customers today.  Until then, even if I'm in Japantown and my friends want to come, I'll be the one dissuading them from going.  :(
author: Audrey H.

description:
In our teens and in our 20s, it's all about being and looking cute - wasn't it? Back then, I wouldn't be caught dead in a pair of flats. Even when working retail and standing for 8+ hours, heels were a must even if each talon required bandaging at the end of the night...as long as we looked cute for the AT&T guys that worked in the kiosk out front. *wink wink*

Pass forward many sprained ankles later, flats are my BFF. Comfort over style on any day, says this 30ish old grandmama. 

I may be over cute shoes but I still can't turn down cutesy looking desserts. 

Last year, I started seeing all the Taiyaki fish cone pictures from Uji Time in Berkeley and heard they were opening up a location in San Francisco. That time has come...

Uji Time softly opened last week in the old Mitsu Teahouse space in the East building in Japantown near Hotel Kabuki, across from Daiso. Do note that the hours of operation currently listed on yelp does not apply to their soft opening. If you want to try their Taiyaki fish cones, I would try to come about an hour after their listed opening on Yelp. If you come a lot later in the day, they may have stopped making the taiyaki cones for the day. 

They have three soft-serve flavors: matcha, black sesame, and tofu. You can choose a serving in a cup or regular cone ($3.99) or regular taiyaki cone (1-2 flavors - $6.99). You can add toppings for 50 cents each (they only had chocolate sticks and wafers).  They also have mochi ice cream ($2.29 each) in 12 flavors and calpico slushy. Cc's accepted. 

I ordered the Regular Taiyaki Cone with half matcha and half black sesame soft serve: http://bit.ly/2r4jfKM. The employee was very nice and kindly gave me free toppings (chocolate stick and French wafers) for waiting.

I know Uji Time is really popular on IG but the cutesy Taiyaki cone is more a millennial Instagrammable novelty than anything else (i.e. they look cute but not functional). I'm happy I got to try it once but I would not go out of my way for it again.

(+) Strong matcha flavor with a pronounced bitterness. 
(+) Black sesame was a lot more subtler with a nice nutty flavor.

(-) I didn't like the icy and gritty texture of the soft serves, particularly the matcha one. Matcha Love is so much better IMO - their soft serves are deliciously creamy. 
(-) If you choose two flavors, they're aren't swirled like what I've seen in pics at their Berkeley location. You have to quickly eat one flavor before getting to the other. 
(-) The taiyaki cone is NOT functional. The soft serve quickly melted along the sides of the cone so it was really messy to eat. The soft serve that was in the cone had melted before I could even get halfway through the top of the soft serve. When I took a bite of the cone from the side, all the melted soft serve from inside the cone squirted out and splattered all over my lap. I ended up tossing it. 

I thought maybe it was soft opening kinks or that I was crazy not to like it. I asked several friends who've been to Uji Time in Berkeley and they all said, they were not impressed with their Taiyaki cone or soft serve. 

Sorry, Uji Time is just not my cup of matcha. I rather make the drive to Matcha Love in Man Jose...
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
What a waste. Young people running the joint that were bored, unfocused (at least not focused on customers), and generally a waste of space. The sweets were great, but not good enough for me to return to try and give this business money.

Mommy and daddy should not leave the business of running the business to kids.

My prediction: Soon to be a memory in Japantown.
author: Scott A.

description:
I love this place. A little pricey, but worth it.

I ordered the Taiyaki Ice Cream with two toppings.
I had the Matcha and the seasonal flavor, Honey Lavendar. Both were excellent.

They give you huge portions, and they also make sure it looks good enough to snap a photo.

But what I loved most was the taiyaki fish. They make these FRESH in the shop. I was not expecting that. And you can taste the quality in the batter.

Be prepared for long lines, but it's definitely worth it.
author: Ron Z.

description:
It's true! Very instagrammable! 

Stopped by here after grabbing dinner and got the green tea ice cream in a cone w/choco sticks. Line was not long and ice cream came out fast! 

Ice cream was pretty good but I'm not a huge fan of soft serve. The fish cone was pretty good though!
author: Elaine C.

description:
I was really excited about this place when I first found out about the opening and went to eat dinner in Japantown just so I could check out this place for dessert. First, the ice cream itself is pretty good. I was able to try the matcha and the sesame. However, it is definitely not worth it to order the teyaki fish cone. My cone was super soggy and cold when I got it. And the cone itself is rather thick so when your ice cream is inside and you're trying to bite out of it, the ice cream will ooze all over you. Furthermore the red bean paste is very minimal and I only had a bite of it before it was gone. The fish cone is $2+ than the regular cone depending if you get a small or regular teyaki fish. 

TLDR: good ice cream, really bad fish cone that's not worth paying extra for.
author: Christina G.

description: I got a small taiyaki cone with matcha ice cream, pocky stick toppings and red bean filling. It was really good and just enough to satisfy my dessert craving but didn't make me feel like I ate too much.
author: Kevin T.

description:
The boyfriend wanted boba after our ramen date. We walked into the plaza after dinner and saw this long line wrapped around.

The boba shop we were expecting to be there was a 3.5 at best, so when I saw this long line, I was thinking "what the hell.."

I peeked into the store and realized the store had been completely changed, as well as its menu and interior design. They had changed it to Uji Time Dessert, which was probably a good business move. They were having a soft opening, which was an obvious success. We ended up waiting 30 minutes in line for a dessert, but I guess you gotta wait that long for the 'gram. 

We got half lavender half matcha in a large fish taiyaki, which ended up melting quite fast. The fish taiyaki was nothing I've ever had before--it was deliciously crunchy with soft, melting bread. I really liked that the entire dessert wasn't too sweet, which is often time the case. I am definitely a fan and would come back again.
author: Emily F.

description:
This spot is still unofficially open, but I'm proud to say my boyfriend and I stopped in while they were still constructing the store and menu, and just had some matcha soft serve and exotic mochi ice cream on hand. 

The matcha soft serve here is AUTHENTIC: made overnight and sifted, not some artificial powder full of chemicals. I cannot wait to try the sesame soft serve, taiyaki and eventual anmitsu.

Such a gem in Japantown.

5 stars!!!!!!!!!!
author: Bonnie G.

description:
Pretty busy on a Saturday night at 7 pm we waited about 25 minutes before getting to the front. Compared to the Berkeley location this place had an option for sizes - small, regular, and deluxe. The small was perfect for me. I sampled the season flavor which was Corn - mild and sweet. But ultimately settled for tofu - which was a variation on the sweet Asian dessert "do fu fa." Very refreshing! 

Small = one flavor and two free toppings.

This location is next to Daiso.
author: Wendy L.

description:
I've been here a few times already and the soft opening sign is still up. Loved their soft serve. They were sold out on most of the mochi every time and I have no desire to try the taiyaki.

I've read some of the other reviews and I haven't come here during a particularly busy time, nor have I ordered the taiyaki which is what everyone is posting on instagram. 

I tried their matcha, sesame, and seasonal (honey lavender) flavors. I like them all except the seasonal one. 

The matcha is a great mix. It's sweet without being overpowering and they used a good amount of matcha but not too much that it's bitter. 

The sesame has a rich nutty flavor that reminds me of the filling in the Chinese dessert, tangyuan (汤圆).  

I liked the idea of the seasonal flavor, but the execution needs to be worked on, or maybe they need to tweak the lavender ratio. The soft serve tastes exactly like what I imagine the hand lotion from L'occitane to taste like. The flavor punches you in the face and it's overpowering! I'm not sure if the honey is in the soft serve, but they also drizzle it on top. 

Def will be back for more!
author: Junella T.

description: I tried the ice cream at the night market not in San Francisco. I got the matcha one and my friend got the sesame one. We love both of them. They are rich in flavor, not sweet, and the sesame one is really creamy. Uji offers a lot of toppings which we like, and the fish cone is delicious. However, the red bean paste is a little bit too sweet in my opinion; but if you combine it with matcha flavor I think it balances out a little bit. Def will visit the store in SF when I have a chance.
author: Giang N.

description:
Yay Uji Time is now in SF! Ever since seeing all the photogenic desserts from their original location in Berkeley, I've been wanting to check it out but couldn't quite bring myself to drive across the bridge just for ice cream in a fish-shaped cone :X (plus, they open starting in the afternoons = horrendous Bay Bridge traffic)

The SF location is across from Daiso in the Japantown Plaza. It opened in early May 2017, and not all the menu items are available during their soft opening phase (soft serve during soft opening... oh the puns that amuse me.) However they are very friendly and helpful; when I emailed them to confirm the hours, they promptly replied and even advised me to arrive ~3:45pm when the taiyaki cones would be ready.

We got the regular taikayi cone ($7, tax not included) with matcha and sesame soft serve. I think it's quite reasonably priced given all the work that goes into it, typical SF prices, and the sheer deliciousness P:

The taikayi cone was outstanding, arguably as good as the taiyaki made in the food stalls around Japantown. It had the perfect balance of mochi-like softness and light crisp, and tasted like a delicious cross between waffles and dorayaki pancakes. It was slightly warm, which was amazing but melted the bottom of the soft serve. There is also a layer of red bean paste at the bottom, so towards the end it turns into a traditional taiyaki pastry P:

I must say, I think the matcha soft serve is the best I've had outside of Asia--the matcha flavor is strong as evidenced by the dark green hue, and the texture is a bit coarse from undissolved matcha. The mild sweetness and attenuated creaminess is just right. (It almost seems more appropriate to call this soft serve flavored matcha rather than matcha flavored soft serve!) 

The sesame was tasty too, though not as memorable as the matcha. It's on the sweeter side, and the sesame flavor is less concentrated. (My favorite sesame ice cream place in SF is Marco Polo on Taraval.)

Overall, my visit to Uji Time exceeded my expectations. They also serve ice cream mochi with interesting flavors, which look good too but a bit pricey. My suggestions would be to have more pretty backgrounds around the store (essential for Instagrams) and to perhaps tweak the presentation a bit so that both flavors show (also important for Instagrams).

Can't wait to come back when they have their full menu. Now I don't have to trek to Berkeley for Uji Time, or to Mitsuwa in SJ to get my matcha soft serve fix P:
author: Edna C.

description:
We went here during soft opening. This review is 1 month over due.. sorry! 
Be prepared to wait in line about 30-45 minutes, and additional 15 minutes before getting your soft cream BUT! Worth the wait. 

I love everything match green tea and I was so happy to find this hidden gem in Japantown during our visit in San Francisco. I ordered a small Taiyaki cone ($5.99: you get 1 flavor + 2 toppings) and the small is perfect for me! My flavor was matcha green tea and for my 2 toppings I got green tea pocky stick and kinako- soy bean powder. The cone is freshly bake to order.. and there's a surprise at the fin of the fish :) That was a total shocking! 

Parking: There's a parking garage and charges $2? 

Can't wait to come back and try other flavors. Super instagram worthy picture!
author: Hazel Chastine R.

description:
There aren't many things that can make me get off my comfy couch and rush out of the door on a fine Saturday afternoon. Unless, of course, there's something truly important, like when matcha soft serve is involved. 

As a big fan of matcha, soft serve, and taiyaki (or any soft waffle), Uji Time Dessert is like a dream come true. 

Location: 
Japan town shopping center (east hall), right across from Daiso.

How I found it: 
Searching "hot and new" on Yelp. It's close to where I live. 

What to order: 
Matcha flavored soft serve in taiyaki cone is a must! You can definitely taste the matcha, and the consistency of the soft serve is just right. It doesn't melt the minute you hold it in your hand but also not too icy. The taiyaki cone is made to order (took ~10 minutes, hopefully this will get faster in the future), it's soft, flavorful and not overly sweet. The combination of the cone and the soft serve is perfect! 

Other notes:
If you are not a fan of matcha, there's other flavors to choose from. Black sesame is another popular one, and the best thing is you can choose two flavors at the same time. Besides taiyaki cones, paper cup and waffle cone are also choices of vehicle for the soft serve. 

Since it just opened, some menu items are not available at the moment. I will definitely go back in the future. 

With the recent(ish) additions of casual dining options like Ramen Hinodeya, Udon Mugizo, Marafuku Ramen and Uji, combining with higher end restaurant like An Japanese restaurant and Kiss Seafood, the overall restaurant quality in Japan town is becoming more and more impressive.
author: Rachel Z.

description: Excellent service! It also helped that there was no one there when we went. Apart from that, my friend and I shared a small pumpkin miso (seasonal flavor) in a cup. It was nice that the guy was extra generous and it was more than enough for the both of us that we didnt even finish it. We also added green tea pocky sticks which went together perfectly with the pumpkin miso. If you're in the area and in the mood for something not too sweet, I would recommend stopping by here. I love trying their new seasonal flavors and this month, they did not disappoint! Stop by and get your swirl on ;)
author: Brittany D.

description:
I usually buy this kind of dessert in LA but I found this place better! 

First of all, I got the regular taiyaki cone with matcha ice cream which tasted perfect for me - not to bitter nor sweet. The cone was bigger than I had expected but it was only a dollar than the small so why not?

The wait was a bit long ~around 10-15 minutes. We got there around 9 pm on a Saturday night after searching for food places around Japan Town. I randomly saw someone walking with a taiyaki cone then saw a big line outside a store after! It wasn't that bad for me since I'm okay waiting anyways.

I gave this 4 stars only because my sister was not satisfied with her black sesame ice cream. She's not a very picky person when it comes to food but she complained about this one meaning, there is something wrong. But we all have different tastes anyways so ‍. JUST CHOOSE MATCHA AND BE SAFE!
author: Pamela N.

description:
UPDATE(08/05/2018): I gave the matcha another try and sampled their seasonal watermelon flavor. The matcha soft serve by itself is pretty strong in flavor but maybe not if you are looking for THE matcha treat. Otherwise, my friend who loves her fruity flavors enjoyed the watermelon flavors very much. Overall, this is a nice spot to grab dessert with a group of friends. 
ORIGINAL REVIEW: This is just a very instagram-able dessert... The matcha had no taste and I've tried better black sesame ice cream. The combined flavors makes the black sesame overwhelm the tasteless matcha ice cream. Wouldn't waste my money there again.
author: Olivia G.

description:
I decided to try this place after seeing people walk out of this shop, carrying an ice cream cone that looked like fish. I am picky when it comes to eating seafood, but this was an exception ;). 

When I saw a mini poster that had tons of text on the wall, I got super excited. I thought the menu had over 20 different ice cream flavors until I realized it was just the nutrition facts for the four ice cream flavors that this place sells...

I ended up going with the medium sized Matcha Soft Cream ($6.99) that included the fish cone. The Matcha Soft Cream tasted very average. Pretty much how it should have tasted. There was nothing really special about it. The fish cone reminded me of pound cake and was sweeter than I expected. At the bottom of the cone, it looked like there was some kind of black sesame paste. I actually thought the fish cone would be as hard as a waffle cone, but it was actually super soft!

I liked the fish cone a lot better than the ice cream. However, I do not think I will come here again since it will probably be weird for me to walk into the shop and ask for the fish cone by itself.
author: Kristina M.

description: Took over the old boba tea house in Japantown. I've been to the one in Berkeley and they didn't have cone sizes or toppings and this location have those choices. We got the deluxe which comes with two flavors of ice cream and two toppings and we just got green tea ice cream with matcha powder and two green tea pocky sticks. Ice cream was okay but the toppings were a good addition. Next time probably go for a small because that was a lot of ice cream even for two people. Taiyaki come was somewhat soft but a bit hard too which was okay and it had red bean on the bottom which wasn't all that great though. The girl at the cashier looked like she really didn't want to be there by the way she's leaning on the cash register as we're ordering and just the whole body language vibe she's giving off.
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
So we had an awesome conversation with one of the owners today at this storefront.  I've been to their location in Berkeley and I am a huge fan.  They aren't officially open yet but they plan to be available next week with most of their menu.  Right now, they only offer matcha ice cream.

What I noticed about their matcha ice cream is that it is grittier than most.  The owner told us the reason behind that.  They use real matcha...not the powder...not the fake stuff...but the real deal.  It creates some sort of reaction to the dairy and makes it a little more textured than others.  Keep that in mind when you chomp down on your first bite.

They will be offering their most awesome taiyaki cones.  Fish shaped cones filled with red bean topped with your choice of ice cream.  Delish!!!!  The menu will be a little different but shoot...as long as they have these available, I will definitely be a regular!  

5 stars to the max!
author: Jen W.

description: This one was on my bucket list. I went during Fleet Weekend. I LOVE the cone! It's not like a cone but more like a heavy pancake and it's delicious. They don't have ordinary flavors such as vanilla or chocolate ice cream. They have special flavors. I tried two seasonal flavors - Black sesame & coconut ash. I wasn't a fan of the flavors because I'm not used to that flavor palate, so I'm not a good judge as far as that goes. Either way, I enjoyed my pretty ice cream cone.
author: Danielle S.

description:
I wanted to go to Chocolate Chair for a Dragon's Breath once again.  But since Uji Time has opened its door, it'd be a perfect afternoon to have soft serve ice cream...in a taiyaki cone!  Just what I like for dessert, a baked sea bream acting as a cone to hold soft serve frozen yogurt!  

I chose the deluxe version with two flavors, tofu and black sesame, and two wafers, French Crispy and chocolate swirled Polky sticks, for a total of $8.24.  The tofu on top with black sesame on the bottom is a picture perfect choice which is similarly related to yang and yin.  On to the taste.  I don't mind about the wafers.  And I already know black sesame is as smoky and nutty as ever.  The tofu flavor taste as good as the soybean flavor, just like the soymilk I used to drink.  I also thought about the taiyaki cone; it still has sweetened red beans inside.

I might go back to Uji Time another day for one mochi if I feel like it.  That's why I never need a card that allows me to go on the eleventh time for any free dessert.  If Chocolate Chair isn't a best place to have liquid nitrogen ice cream, Uji Time is the right time to soft serve.
author: Jimmy C.

description:
I have no words because I'm in awe at how good their soft serve is. San Francisco is getting more and more dessert places and I'm just happy to include Uji Time. This place has been on my bookmarks since forever but I couldn't find the time to go to Berkeley so when I saw this, I had to pay my respects. The store itself is very simple, located diagonally from Daiso. It was a cold day but it doesn't stop me from having this. Since they just opened, they told me they didn't have the fish cones yet, but they have most of their items. I got the matcha/black sesame soft serve split into a cup. I already knew I was going to like it due to the anticipation I've been building. 

Pricing/Flavors:
One flavor in a cone/cup is $3.99 but you get a lot for what you pay for. Mochis are $6.39 for 3pcs with many flavors or you can buy them single as well. They have three different flavors: matcha, black sesame, and tofu. 
I had to try both flavors since they didn't have tofu so what better way than to split it. I was scared the black sesame taste would be too strong but instead, it was very light. It sort of tastes like vanilla soft serve with slight hints of black sesame. The matcha ofc tastes like actual matcha powder combined into a soft serve. Nothing fake or artificial about these two. 

Customer Service:
The cashier was friendly and told me right away what they had/didn't have. She came out with the soft serve really quick too. 

Recommend?
Heck ya! I'd come back every week bc this can get so addicting. Soft serve is more preferable when you want some light yet sweet. Amazing soft serve and service!! Come next week when they start having their fish cones.
author: Lisa W.

description:
Yum!!!! So glad we followed the line into Uji Time! 

Lines are long but move fairly quickly. Yummy Taiyaki (Japanese fish-shaped cake) is made fresh and used as a cone for Matcha, Black Sesame, or Tofu flavored soft serve (seasonal flavors are posted on their menu). The taiyaki is filled on the bottom with red bean paste - Don't be scurred- it's delicious 

You have the opportunity to try-before-you-buy so be sure to ask for samples of whatever flavor you have in mind. I thought the tofu flavor would be my pick but after tasting all the flavors I went for the black sesame - yuh-meee! 

So if you find yourself in Japantown be sure to stop by Uji Time and catch yourself a little taiyaki
author: Sonnia P.

description:
This is no Berkeley Uji Time...

Was excited for uji in sf so gave it a try. Came here late afternoon to a quiet minimal line. Checked out their menu which had a "seasonal" flavour and a mini taiyaki that comes with two toppings of your choice. The cashier said these options are only this store.

When I went forth to ask about the seasonal flavour she tells me they don't have it. They only had Matcha or sesame which was disappointing. I came hoping for tofu because you can't get tofu flavour at too many places. Then I went about asking about the choice of toppings for the mini taiyaki. She then goes we don't have ......toppings today. Okay...there's a lot that's not available...what's going on?

With minimal options left, I chose the regular taiyaki with the only two flavours they had(matcha and sesame).

It took less than 2minutes for me to get my taiyaki...which I questioned(how long has the taiyaki been made and sitting given the low foot traffic?) you see the taiyaki being made at Berkeley uji and usually there's a wait time just for that and how fresh it is.

The matcha tasted the same. The sesame is not as good as the Berkeley uji. The sesame was for some reason more thick/milky? 

Now for the taiyaki, it definitely was not warm and tasted like it had been sitting; very soft and mushy(broke very easily). Not to mention the bottom half of my fish had a crack. :( 

Might give it another chance if there's seasonal flavour. Otherwise, I'd much rather drive to Berkeley .
author: Carmen L.

description:
This time we ordered 1small Taiyaki with Tofu Ice cream and 2chocolate stic |･`)
 1waffle cone with Matcha icecream (.)

Always here cuz here has tofu taste icecream.

This time the ice cream taste too much water, taste contain less milk than the first time I were there.

This time the person also is much less, not like before the long group.

But this icecream shop is better than Amami(dt).
author: Yingying C.

description:
The line seemed daunting at first but it actually moved very quickly. There is a dashboard inside above the cashier that shows you real time wait times for small and regular taiyakis. The current (July 2017) secret mochi flavors are lemon & poppyseed, mango Thai basil, and passionfruit.

Matcha taiyaki: delicious rich matcha flavor, as you would expect.

Tofu taiyaki: unexpectedly tasty and refreshing. I traded my friend for this because I liked it so much.

Corn taiyaki (seasonal flavor): solid

Black sesame mochi: it's good but didn't seem all that different than a supermarket mochi ice cream. Probably not worth the price (2.99) unless you're looking for this flavor which doesn't usually come in supermarkets.

I'll definitely be back to stand in line the next time I'm in the area!
author: Dani T.

description:
Located across from Daiso in japan town. It replaced what used to be a boba shop. 

I got the sesame cone since the taiyaki ones were not available. I asked if I could do half sesame and half matcha and the chick said no...but someone who ordered after me was able to ...so idk whats up with that........

Sesame flavor was ok. not as particularly nutty or creamy as I hoped. Not really understanding why people love this place so much, so far

Got the ice cream mochis:
matcha with choco chip
red bean
ginger zing
thai basil tea [or w.e it was called]
raspberry white chocolate
lychee colada

overalll they were mediocre. Nothing too amazing about them and they were expensive. I think the flavors that I tolerated more was the red bean and either the ginger or lychee. I was a bit sad that the matcha wasn't that good either.  Personally would not get again as I feel the flavor is not worth the price. Sure the flavors sound unique but upon taste, did not feel so great. 

I understand this was their soft opening...but I am not sure if you can improve flavor...since I am assuming the flavors are passed from their other stores. 

So far, I feel this place was just a hype. I came with a friend and he agreed too. :/
author: Eva L.

description: The matcha ice cream was good we added nutella to the cone which made it even better. I regret not getting to try their watermelon soft serve
author: Manouk B.

description:
The shop sells soft serve ice cream served on fish shaped bread.  Bread is sweet with sweetened red beans in it. 

Quality of ice cream is average but the unique flavors are what sets Uji apart. 
My favorite was Macha green tea. You can ask to try some before choosing one. 

Below are what I tried.
1. Macha - green color
2.  Black Sesame - black color
3. Hojicha (roasted green tea) - grey color

Uji was 4 stars for me. Reason for taking away one star is because ice cream was not the quality I was hoping. 

But I would recommend this place to anyone who is visiting Japan town in San Francisco.
author: Peter J.

description: Didn't see a line when we got our ice cream.... thought that was normal... after shopping and passing by there was a line out the door... WE GOT LUCKY!!! Quick in and out, the ice cream was BOMB!!!!! Not super sweet, takes long to melt, and delish!!!!!!!!!! Try it next time. We were too full so didn't get to try the fishy with red beans but next time
author: Karrie C.

description:
This is literally about the photo and not much else. I came here with a few coworkers because it had been on to-try list for a while...

They had a special season flavor - pumpkin miso - and we tried a sample and I honestly didn't love it but that's fine. I ended up ordering the sesame since I got the small and could only choose one flavor. The sesame really is not sweet at all which is fine, except I was expecting it to be considering it was ice cream. You can tell they used real sesame to make the flavor as you could still feel the grains of ground sesame seed - so that was really cool.

Personally liked the cone better than the ice cream. Unfortunately, as the ice cream started melting, it got all over the cone and since I didn't love it - and neither did any of my coworkers - I ended up throwing it away after taking my snap.
author: Josephine T.

description: This is my favorite Japanese style ice cream spot in the city! I'd get taiyaki when I'm feeling bigger snack, and soft serve with smaller appetite. Taiyaki has soft serve in a fish cone, with surprise red beans toward the bottom! With large size taiyaki, it also comes with a few toppings of choice, which add a fun and nice touch. For soft serve, they usually have two pairings, or four individual flavors. Matcha and black sesame swirl was my go to, and tofu flavor was surprisingly tasty (like tofuhua)! They also have seasonal flavor, though I haven't got the courage to try pumpkin miso :P Sometimes some flavors run out and line was long, but I definitely come back whenever I am in dessert mood.
author: Jaclyn C.

description: Black sesame and matcha swirl...a must try...it wasn't my first choice as I really wanted the charcoal one but they ran out of it. The soft serve is perfect as it is not too coarse,but has the right amount of cream and smoothness... hard to explain..but just need to try it out.  They also had a tofu flavor one.  Don't let that fool you...it reminded me of the soy milk that you get from the can from back in the days.
author: Charlie T.

description: Legit Japanese matcha soft serve in he Bay Area! They also have three alternative flavors: hojicha tea, tofu, black sesame.
author: Thomas C.

description:
Super yummy! Tofu is really good very sweet!
I would highly recommend this place! I wish there was a location in San Diego!
author: Jessie D.

description: Waited for over an hour to get a deluxe with red beans, matcha ice cream, poky and matcha powder but it was well worth it. I would do it everyday if I could.
author: Erika G.

description: I bookmarked this place because every time I go to SF, I always head to Japantown and I LOVEEEEE ice cream. This place was very easy to find and there was no wait at all, one customer just finished paying for his order. The menu was very straightforward and clear. My boyfriend and I ordered the small taiyaki with green tea, which is $6 each and comes with 2 toppings. I got the chocolate stick and the pocky stick, while my boyfriend ordered the sesame powder and pocky stick. We sat outside the place, which has some benches. I dug in and the ice cream was not overly sweet, which appealed to my boyfriend because he has less of a sweet tooth than I do. The bread part of the taiyaki was soo good. Best $13 spent in Japantown that was not filled with regret. =)
author: Tina H.

description: Yay another location! I would prefer to just go to the Berkeley one. The line here was sooooo long and for that 30 minutes of waiting, my ideal order wasn't even available! The seasonal flavor for my visit was taro and they ran out I guess so I went with the usual black sesame on a half taiyaki. Those are really hard to finish as a regular so I would recommend the smaller one. It's always a journey to eat ice cream and find the red bean paste at the bottom. They had a good selection of toppings but I couldn't get dango. It's really up to you, tailor it to your taste or compliment your toppings to make it picturesque. Happy to have one in japantown but since I don't live in SF I'll just go to the less busy one lol.
author: Krysta M.

description:
Had the chance to visit this place while in San Francisco before i travel back home for New Years Eve.

The venue was inside the Japan town and honesty parking can be pretty hard in the garage or streets.

I ordered a medium sized Taiyaki with Matcha and my sis had Charcoal flavor soft served ice cream. Actually enjoyed the flavor and i love how the shell was still crunchy after i finished the ice cream. They also had red bean inside towards the tail so your not left with just the taiyaki. The matcha has a good green color, refreshing and very creamy in texture & the charcoal taste like burnt sesame seeds but in a good way ;). Both flavors were really good and the taiyaki cones is also available in 3 different size so you'll have choices just incase you just want to try for the first time. 

Will come again if ever im in San Francisco again :)
author: Rhen D.

description:
Located inside Japantown, this place can get crowded a LOT on the weekends from what I can see and how they have people wait outside their place before ordering. Luckily, my friend and I visited this Uji location on a Monday during lunch, so it wasn't as busy at all. I've also been to the Uji in Berkeley, so if you're wondering, I think they're both great!

Because we had just eaten ramen, we weren't as hungry enough to have one of their delicious taiyaki cones, so we opted to each have a waffle cone of soft-serve matcha and their limited (10 times a day) melon (made of canteloupe). The cones were the perfect size to finish off our lunch for dessert. 

Their melon actually tasted really good, and I'm not one to eat a canteloupe (ask my friends! I'm not a huge melon fan). It had a little bit of sweetness to it that made it more delicious than melon usually is (to me anyways). It's definitely something I wouldn't mind getting again! 

As for the matcha, it tasted like matcha and not green tea, which was PERFECT. There are places that say they carry matcha-flavored items, but they straight up taste like green tea...there's a HUGE difference between the two! Their waffle cone tasted just like any other waffle cone, but the thing I liked about this place, is that they serve it to you, wrapped in a small, black napkin. This is nice because it can get messy quick.

I haven't had this location's black sesame yet, but I'm sure it's just as good as its Berkeley location, so I would also recommend that too! Eat your Uji dessert as you walk around the various shops at Japantown, or while sitting in front of Japantown's only pagoda outside on a beautiful day!
author: Jun-Jun L.

description:
When I heard about a matcha soft serve place in Japantown from my friends, being a huge matcha fan I definitely had to give this place a try. Came here with a friend after having dinner in Japantown.

I ordered the matcha soft serve in a waffle cone (think it was around $4). The matcha soft serve itself was alright -- nothing particularly too special, the taste of matcha was decent but not strong enough for my preference. It did go well with the crisp waffle cone, and it was a good portion size.

Besides matcha, Uji time also has some interesting flavors such as tofu and black sesame. Also they also have an option where you can get a taiyaki (the pastry that looks like a fish) cone instead. That looked interesting to me but I think I would rather prefer the crisp waffle cone over the soft taiyaki shell.

Definitely worth a try.
author: Alvin W.

description:
I love it here! I usually go with my friends or my sisters. I'm a big fan of the black sesame flavor with the taiyaki and red bean. Best combination ever!!!

I'm a loyal customer. I try to go at least twice a month. :) Depending on the day and time, it can be super crowded or not at all. I advise folks to get there early. After dinner can be a bit hectic, but the line usually moves pretty fast. 

Uji Time is the best! :D
author: Bernadette B.

description:
This is place was really good. Simple menu.
I got the matcha with the taiyaki. And added match powdered.
It was really good and the taiyaki was nice and crispy on the outside and soft in the inside.

I went with a friend and we were waiting outside for them to be open. When the clock stroke 12:30, my friend rushed in and the employee gave her a stern look and told her they're not open yet. He looked really offended. She was confused and asked him if they opened at 12:30 and he said yes but they're still not open. My friend went back outside. My friend's fault for barging in I suppose, but their door was cracked open and it was 12:30 the time they were suppose to open and I suppose it was an honest mistake, but I felt like the employee should have still been a little more polite to her. He didn't say, " Sorry, but we're not open yet." or " We'll be opening in a minute, please wait outside until then." You know? Customer service skills.
author: Carmen L.

description: I got the matcha taiyaki with red bean filling!! So delicious and very worth it for the price. I thought the combination of flavors worked well together, so I definitely recommend it! Only downside is there aren't a lot of seats in the shop, but that's fine to be honest. Overall 5 starrrz love it!
author: YL L.

description:
Sooo happy they opened a Uji Time in SF JT, dont have to go to Berkeley now. 

WAIT: I went there right when they opened (1:30pm) and there was already a line. I waiting about 20 minutes. Wasn't too bad. Once I ordered my soft serve was ready in 2mins!! 

DESSERT: I got the regular with Tofu and Matcha flavor. The tofu soft serve was surprisingly very good! The taiyaki DID NOT DISAPPOINT ME A LOT. It was perfect. At the perfect soft and crunch. The red bean on the bottom of the fish makes the perfect "closing".

Current seasonal flavor is LAVENDER HONEY. The flavor was very powerful and strong. I'm not a huge fan of it but to those who loves lavender smell and flavor... you will like this.
author: Cyndi L.

description: It's a good dessert place to go to. The taiyaki is very fresh and fluffy. The matcha ice cream didn't have a strong matcha taste, but the amount they gave was nice. The anko went really well with the matcha and pocky sticks were a nice touch.
author: Monica D.

description:
We came here on a Saturday afternoon. The sun was shining and the dessert was yummy.

We got:

Regular cone with black sesame, topped with pocky sticks and dango 4/5

Regular cone with seasonal flavor -- sweet potato 4/5

Staff here re awesome! Someone accidentally dropped their cone in store, and staff here immediately refilled with a new one and cleaned everything up.
author: Yu S.

description: We loved it! We tried it yesterday and I think we're going back today. We had the seasonal honey lavender soft serve in the special cone. Oh yum!  My husband said it's the best soft serve he's ever had. We love honey lavender ice cream but I think this one is the best. Super delicious!!!
author: Rikki M.

description: YUMMM!!! Been wanting to go to this place for forever and I'm glad I did :) it took forever for my friend and me to actually find the place - it's located in the east mall, next to Daiso. There was a small wait (it was Saturday afternoon so figures), but we got our soft serve almost immediately after ordering. I got a large taiyaki cone with Nutella filling and black sesame soft serve. The soft serve was DELICIOUS. And it kind of tastes like peanut butter. The cone is really soft and kind of waffle-like, and the portion size was really big for a large. Tbh the cone wasn't thaaaat great, I feel like it's more for the aesthetics. But the soft serve itself (+the Nutella filling!!!) was definitely worth it. I think next time I'd just get a regular waffle cone or cup with just the black sesame soft serve.
author: Angela L.

description:
Since it was just opened in Japan town center and lack of staffs so we have to wait in line to order and for an ice cream for awhile. I am a big fan of black sesame ice cream but here i would say that green tea flavor is way better, 
The price and its test(taiyaki flour) quite not worth. Next time i will order just green tea with regular cone.
author: Tiratiwan L.

description: Im pretty sure I won't be back here again, but I'll say the ice cream is good, the cone is soft but the line wait was wayyy out the door. I waited probably 15 minutes before ordering. I recommend getting the small cone because you can either wait 1 minute for it being made OR play yourself and wait 15+ minute wait for a larger cone. Let's be honest you ain't gonna finish that. Sure it's great for Instagram and it's very photogenic, and worth a first try. But it's a slim chance I'll see myself going here again. Maybe for the green tea!
author: Alex L.

description: Yummy.  Small ia about 6 bucks.  Very satisfied for the treat after eating dinner!  Matcha flavor rocks.  I saw no problems getting dessert here
author: Matthew L.

description:
This is my favorite dessert place in Japantown. 

I usually get a large taiyaki to share with my gf. She loves matcha and I love the black sesame soft serve, so we get a scoop of each. 

The matcha soft serve is good, but I think the matcha soft serve at Matcha Cafe Maiko is much better. The Black Sesame soft serve here is amazing. You can really taste the Black Sesame, and its really creamy with a hint of gritty texture. 

The Taiyaki is a fish shaped pancake with a filling of your choice of Red Bean paste or Nutella. We always opt for the red bean. It's not overly sweet, so it goes really well with the pancake and ice cream. 

Pro tip: try to eat most of the ice cream before biting into the fish or you'll have ice cream all over the place.
author: James L.

description: I wish I had more time in SF, I probably come here everyday!!  The sis got the new black coconut flavored ice cream, mom got the Matcha green tea and I got the black sesame ice cream with pocky sticks and red beans. I definitely will come back when i'm in the area!!
author: Phuong O.

description: The line was kind of long but went by quick. Very fun design and tastes delicious. I ordered the matcha flavor and it tasted pretty pure, not too sweet. Not expensive, which is nice.
author: Nicole W.

description:
Japanese taiyaki desserts are taking Japantown by storm. While I've seen signs for a couple other places, this place is open and delicious. If you are looking for something over the top definitely get the large taiyaki cone with two flavors of ice cream. There is a nice assortment of toppings as well, including sprinkles, mocha, asuka beans, and pocky. The taiyaki is similar to eating a waffle, if you are looking for a comparison point.

If you are looking for something on the lighter side, get a soft serve. Top flavors would be matcha, sesame, and tofu (if you are into it). You can get two flavors mixed, but the last time I did this, it really was 75% of one flavor.

And if you aren't sure what you want yet, in typical Japanese fashion, they actually have examples of the different types of cones, and toppings on display by the counter.

Also be careful of peak times. This place can get packed with a line out the door on a casual Saturday afternoon.
author: James S.

description:
I was craving some mochi ice cream after getting ramen, so I decided to drop by here to get some. They've got a great selection of flavours, but it was incredibly slow--despite there being three employees, it seemed like only one of them was doing anything. There was only one person in line ahead of us and we had to wait ten minutes.

When I finally got my mochi, it was frozen. Like, have to wait twenty minutes for it to thaw enough to eat frozen. Sigh. The taiyaki cones looked good though, so maybe I'll come by again to try them.
author: Yves L.

description: Line was out the door and wrapping the corner even around 9 pm. Worth the wait. They actually moved really fast. Would come back again if in the area
author: Andrew M.

description: The line in this shop is always long whenever we go to Japantown so we were curious what the ice cream tastes like. We finally decided to try this ice cream last weekend. Ordered green tea ice cream. It was just soft served ice cream. Nothing really special about it. It was expensive. We could have gotten better ice cream with the price.
author: Leanna C.

description: I had to try this place after Seeing a picture of the pumpkin miso flavor on Instagram! I ended up ordering the pumpkin miso and tofu ice cream. The pumpkin miso was a little salty so I probably wouldn't get that again, but the tofu ice cream was really unique! It tasted like those Asian tofu desserts in ice cream form and it was still sweet but not too heavy. I would probably come back for that one.
author: Katherine C.

description:
I was introduced to this place through a friend while spending sometime in Japantown.  One thing is for sure, be prepared for a line and a wait.  Especially if you are craving anything in their taiyaki cone (a fish shaped cone with sweet red fermented bean curd lining the bottom).  They make it fresh and hot and that is what can delay your order.  At the cash register, just above as part of their menu, you can see the wait time for those cones.  However, despite the long lines and wait time, it is totally worth it.  They serve mochi, too. There's also regular cones and several delicious toppings to add on to your ice cream of choice.

Today I tried their regular taiyaki cone with black sesame seed ice cream.  They also had matcha green tea ice cream, tofu ice cream, and the specialty ice cream of the day was pina colada.  With a warm, fresh cone and deliciously cold ice creams with pocky sticks added in, I was completely in heaven. I like that their menu is simple and that they offer samples of their ice cream while one waits in the very long line.  I can't wait to come back to try the other flavors.
author: Angela K.

description:
O.b.s.e.s.s.e.d with this place. One of my favorite desserts :) 

The creamy matcha & sesame soft serve are my fave and complement well with the warm, slightly crisp taiyaki. The portions are pretty big. Regular size is perfect for sharing between two people. 

Small space with no tables, but there are several benches outside if you can snag one! 

Minus one star for: 
- inefficient operations (not the best layout, leading to longer lines than needed) 
- less than friendly service
- kindaaaa pricey ($6.99 for a Regular)
author: Samantha C.

description:
The line is long but don't be discouraged - it moves pretty quickly! The taiyaki (cute bread-y fish used as a cone) is made fresh so the wait is worth it. Just don't wait too long to actually eat the soft serve once you get it - the warmth of the taiyaki tends to speed up the melting process of the soft serve. 

I got the taiyaki with black sesame soft serve. The staff inside are super friendly and patient - they offered me samples of the tofu, black sesame, and the matcha soft serve since it was my first time. Tofu tastes more like soy milk. Matcha is what you'd expect - not overly sweet. But the black sesame won my heart - not overly sweet either and did not skimp on the black sesame flavor. Delicious!!! Creamy goodness + hot taiyaki with a little red bean inside. 

I have slight obsession with Genki and their ice cream crepes, but I think I may have found another contender for my sweet tooth fixes.
author: Erica H.

description: Quick service and nice staff that lets you sample some flavors. I got the Taiyaki with tofu and pumpkin miso. Tofu was super refreshing, but the pumpkin miso was a bit salty which is to be expected. I would probably get a small with tofu next time.
author: Katherine D.

description: Very sad news about this place, I got the wrong order and it is should be parfait not the deluxe one, and it was very embarrassing about this place and I will never go back again!!! :(
author: Tatiana V.

description: Soft serve was pretty good, Taiyaki could have been a little more fresh (tasted like it'd been sitting out just a tad too long) but overall good - I'd come back.
author: Nicole T.

description: whaa, tofu soft serve?! yeah, they have it there. i was able to get a sample and it tasted like tofu pudding, it's really good and it's not super sweet. i didn't order it because i was set on getting the matcha soft serve, and i wasn't sure if that would be a good combo. anyways, ordered the taiyaki with both green tea and sesame soft serve. it took awhile to retrieve the taiyaki but they do display an estimated time of the general order on the digital menu. the person making it and delivering the order seemed agitated as people aren't responding when their number is being called. i mean i totally get it, she was the only person making and delivering the order. the place is tiny, so some people wait outside. they definitely need a better way to notify customers that their order is ready.
author: Allison C.

description:
The line was out the door, but it went by in about 5-10 minutes. 

I ordered the Regular Taiyaki Cone with Matcha and Tofu flavored soft cream ($6.99). The taiyaki cone was too thick and I wouldn't recommend it. Maybe get it once for pictures. The tofu soft cream tasted like Dou Fu Hua (Chinese tofu dessert) which was different, but I really really enjoyed the matcha soft cream. It was a perfect balance of sweetniss and bitterness.
author: Megan L.

description:
Located in the west mall in Japantown. I stopped by Saturday evening with my brother & it was pretty busy. Not sure how busy they get, but the Taiyaki cone (fish-shaped cone) had a wait time. When I ordered, it initially said 25 mins wait. I didn't mind because I wanted to stop by the Daiso next door (one of my weaknesses) I came back about 10 mins later to check up on my order & apparently it was called out already. So definitely just wait next to the pick-up line to get your order because the estimated wait time is not accurate (at least for me) 

I got the matcha taiyaki cone. It had a subtle matcha flavor and it wasn't like "BAM...tea explosion in your mouth" I've tried many different matcha flavored ice cream/soft serve & appreciate each places unique take on tea flavors. 

I actually enjoyed my brother's choice of black sesame taiyaki cone! It was smooth & had a nice nutty sesame taste which I thought was two thumbs up. I kept taking a bite from his haha

The taiyaki cone itself was warm and chewy, not too sweet. Red bean hidden at the tail! (Just FYI)
author: Sarah C.

description:
A cute little Japanese dessert spot located in Japantown. They serve soft serve and mochi. The place is tiny but thankfully you can eat your dessert in the mall/outside plaza. The service was friendly and pleasant. Be warned the soft serve here isn't your typical sweet flavors. They have tofu, black sesame, matcha, and a season flavor that rotates. As of nov 1 the seasonal was a pumpkin miso. The soft serve isn't sweet but surprisingly interesting. I sampled the tofu, black sesame, and matcha and well it tastes like I expected. All the flavors were exactly as described, not really sweet but with the described flavor peaking at the end of each taste. I ended up going with the matcha which was my favorite of the bunch. For matcha soft serve it was one of the better ones I've tried. They have a handful of toppings, I choose the choco sticks and matcha pocky. You have the option on the cones from a normal waffle cone or a taiyaki cone (pretty much a waffle/cake-like cone in the shape of a fish). No surprises here I went with the taiyaki. Overall the dessert was ok. The taiyaki was a different twist on the typical boring cone and the soft serve was ok, but it isn't a place I'll go out of my way for. It's cute and worth a try if you want to try the taiyaki or you like matcha. 
They also sell ice cream filled mochi in several flavors which looked nice, I'll be sure to come back to check it out.
author: Peter P.

description: I wanted dessert and I wanted something different and this was the place to go! It's located in the mall, so go inside the mall and there is usually a line, heads up! They have unique flavors but they let you sample. The fish cone is a yummy soft texture. Overall very delicious, must try!
author: Meghedie P.

description:
My favorite:
Black Sesame (so gooooood)
Crepe
Soybean powder
Pocky sticks

The BEST part is when you get to the end and get to eat the Taiyaki. So good..................

Tofu flavor-- tasted weird, don't get it
Matcha-- is SUPER matcha taste. If you like it, you will love this.
Mochi-- this was definitely not what I was expecting. It was very hard and not chewy. (I don't think it was Mochi? Probably something else, but we were told mochi from the cashier).

Service is good. We got a topping we didn't like (mochi) and were able to switch it out for osmething else.

They do not skimp out! I always get the small and this cone is HUGE, a tonnnn of soft serve... you do not need the regular size unless you're sharing. It's quite a bit of work to get to the taiyaki, but I'm not complaining :P
author: Sophie S.

description: I've been wanting to try this for so long and I was honestly so disappointed. I expected the taiyaki to be better, but it was super cold, spongy, and not good overall. I got the black sesame flavored soft serve and it was decent! From all the other good reviews, I'm guessing it might have just been a bad day? Will maybe give it another try some time
author: Tracey N.

description: You can't walk by without stopping, just follow your nose. It's so good! Not sure why we waited so long to try this place. I got the black sesame with red bean filling. It was perfectly balanced combo, not too sweet or heavy. Will definitely visit again when we're in Japantown.
author: Diana M.

description: Loved this place! Super quick service and so tasty. I got the black sesame ice cream with the chocolate sticks, pocky sticks and Nutella filling... a must try!!!!
author: Amy S.

description: This place is solid!  I can see why there is often a line out the door.  I grew up across the street from here, so it's nice to see an ice cream place open up in JT that has a cool Japanese flare to it.  I lucked out and came on a day that it was raining, so no line!  I had the half green tea and half blank sesame in a waffle cone (duh) it was amazing!  I loved how the flavors were bold and delicious!  This place is small but the flavors are mighty!  Can't say I'll luck out with no line again, but worth the wait for sure!
author: Kim K.

description:
I came here one evening after dinner with a friend and we decided to get taiyaki since I heard that tofu soft cream was served here. I never had tofu soft cream so I was pretty excited about this. Haven't had taiyaki in roughly two years so I was psyched up for that as well. Anyways, when we got there, there was a short line and it was roughly a five-minute wait. When we got to the front, I made up my mind about what to get and was disappointed that they did not have dango, which was quite unfortunate for me. I ended up getting a taiyaki cone with red bean filling and tofu soft cream, topped with kinako (soy bean powder) and a French crepe on the side. 

After five minutes, my order was ready and we quickly got out of the store since it was pretty hot inside and it was melting the soft cream. I started off with the tofu soft cream and I can best describe it as similar to a vanilla with a strong soy taste. This was compounded by the fact that I got kinako, since it only intensifies the soy taste. One thing to note was that the tofu soft cream started melting pretty fast, and the taiyaki's mouth couldn't really hold all of the soft cream so it started dripping roughly after five minutes, although this pretty much happens with most ice cream cones. I didn't think much of the French crepe although I really did enjoy the kinako. I was thinking I maybe should have gone with the honey instead of the French crepe, but that's my opinion. The red bean was all the way at the bottom, and it was pretty sweet and complimented the tofu soft cream. Overall, it was pretty good, although I wish I could have savored it longer since I had to eat the soft cream portion quickly. 

In San Francisco, there are aren't that many places that serve taiyaki, so I'll take what I can get. This place does it pretty good, and I was pretty pleased with the tofu flavor. I noticed that they were out of hojicha (green tea) soft cream and I think if I were to come back here, it would be for that. I think for Japantown dessert places, this place is solidly among the best, and I believe one can't go wrong choosing this place.
author: Nelson X.

description:
Yum! Got the regular taiyaki with matcha and black sesame soft serve. Taiyaki was surprisingly well-worth it. It's got mochi flour in it, so there's a springy, chewiness to it with a hint of sweetness. Plus, there's red bean paste at the bottom of the taiyaki.

Soft serve options are:
- Black sesame- good
- Matcha- better, richer in flavor
- Tofu- good, tastes like tofu dessert or soy milk
- Seasonal- pina colada right now

Options:
- Cup/cone of soft serve- $3.99. Looks huge, but the inside of the serving is hollow.
- Small taiyaki- $5.99. One flavor, two toppings, smaller taiyaki.
- Regular taiyaki- $6.99. One or two flavors. No toppings.
- Deluxe taiyaki- $7.99. One or two flavors. Two toppings.

You can ask for samples, but they have to go to the back to get it. Luckily, there are only four flavors. Line can take a bit of time because of this. We got here around 7pm and the line was pretty short. By the time we left, there was a much longer line.

Uji is inside the same mall plaza as Daiso.
author: Alice T.

description:
You'll find a line and a lot of smiles around Uji Time when you come in for soft serve!

They have four flavors: matcha, tofu, black sesame, and a seasonal.  (When I tried it, it was pina colada- and was pretty good)  you can choose the fish shaped cone, which is kind of rectangular or a regular waffle cone with the traditional shape.  Cups are also avail for those who want to avoid gluten or just prefer it that way.

They'll give you samples before you commit to a flavor- but be aware that it holds up the line, as they have only three or so people working the operation.  Most people seem to get the matcha.   I wouldn't say that it's the best soft serve we've ever tried, its novelty seems to be the fish shaped cone cuteness that's freaking people out...add some pocky to it and flash your IG peace sign and you get the idea-lol.

If you're in the area and need a cool treat- this may be your jam!

TIP:
- Don't squeeze your fish cone, they're warm, soft and flexible -your whole deal will fall right on the floor!  (We saw it happen and the girl went back and asked for another and they gave her a hard time...but eventually relented. Yeah, your clumsiness may leave you sans ice cream. )

All of the waffle makers in that small space make it warm in there, and the space is small.  Your deal will melt fast if you hang in there-so grab and go for the best result.
author: Diana W.

description:
TL;DR love the taiyaki with black sesame but 30+ minute wait

I've gone to the Berkeley location 10+ times and have realized that I've been so spoiled. The average wait time at the Berk location is 10 minutes. 

Ok, on to their offerings. Their permanent flavors are black sesame, matcha, and tofu. Their current seasonal flavor is corn (July 2017). Here's my breakdown of the soft serve:
-black sesame: my favorite, tastes exactly like black sesame. If you're a fan of black sesame paste, you'll probably love this. I always recommend this flavor to my friends. 
-matcha: love this flavor too, bold matcha taste and not as sweet as the black sesame. I would recommend black sesame and matcha if you can get two flavors. 
-tofu: I love actual tofu, but I personally think this is gross. My friends think I'm crazy b/c they like it. Eh, to each their own
-corn(July 2017): seasonal flavor, lol tastes like sweet butter 
-taiyaki cone: get it if you've never been, def worth that Yelp pic! It tastes like a waffle pancake hybrid, and has the texture of a dense pancake batter. The bottom of the cone has red bean, probably to prevent your soft serve from leaking through. 

The one thing that beats this location is that they have 3 different sizes of taiyaki cones. 
Small: perfect for one person (only 1 flavor, 2 free toppings) 
Medium: great size for sharing w/ one other person (2 flavors, no free toppings)
Large: omg you must really love soft serve and saved a lot of room for dessert
author: Sophia L.

description: Where's that smell coming  from?? And what is the omg line about?  Where is everyone else getting the ice cream with fish cone. Oh there is the Soft opening.... long line already.  I gotta come back here after having dinner at Marufuku.  We came  back after an hour and got in line. I ordered the  half matcha and half black sesame with taiyaki cone. I got the deluxe for $7.99 with two extra toppings. For the extra toppings, I got two chocolate sticks. The cone comes with red bean inside.  You can also get it in waffle cone which they make fresh inside which is the cause of the lovely smell inside. They take cards. They also serve tofu flavor, seasonal flavor and different flavors of Mochi.
author: Claudine V.

description: Honestly just came here for the IG pic but was pleasantly surprised by their flavors.  I'm not much a sweets person but their sesame, tofu and matcha ice cream were perfect.  It didn't taste artificial and it was both rich and light.  I wouldn't mind stopping by again next time whenever I'm around the area.
author: Derek L.

description:
There were always craje long lines for this place and even though I was so down to wait, none of my anti-waiting friends were so I had to come back with someone I could easily nudge to wait in line with me. We went when there was a street festival going on in the Fillmore, so the line was much shorter.

I ordered the green tea classic one and it was actually just ok. I wasn't amazed by the ice cream and the fish bread cone was a bit too soft. It certainly looked a lot prettier than it tasted. I would actually recommend going to the nijiya market nearby and buying this hella delicious Japanese green tea ice cream sandwich for like $2. I forgot what it is called. Oh wait nvm, I never knew what it was called since it was Japanese, but it's a rectangle and in the ice cream section. Haha, hope that helps! It's actually so much tastier, but not as instagram-worthy. 

Uji Time is still pretty, still yummy. I think I might come back to try the black sesame.
author: Juliana P.

description:
Anytime I tried to try this place out, there was always a long line(probably due to the weekend). This time, my fiancé and I went on a Monday and at last, no line! My fiancé got a salted caramel mochi that had caramel bits in it. He told me it was good, not great, but good. 

I got the sesame soft cream with kinako powder as a topping. The craze here is the taiyaki fish cone, but I didn't want to wait an extra 5-15 for a fish, so I settled with a regular waffle cone. The sesame soft cream itself was sweet and tasty. The soft cream is a bit different than what I used to get in Japan. The texture is more like icy froyo(think the "tart" flavor), instead of more of a creamy texture. Still, very good!

Definitely stop by after dinner! Apparently, the Berkeley spot has a parfait option...hmm.
author: Naomi O.

description:
Located on the lower level of the mall. This place seems to always have long lines but on a Saturday afternoon I probably only waited about 5-10 minutes. 

I got the regular taiyaki cone with both green tea and black sesame ice cream just to try them both. The green tea was my favorite and had a strong green tea flavor. Underneath the ice cream was red bean. The taiyaki cone was crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, perfectly complimenting the ice cream. 

Definitely would get again but next time get a smaller cone. The regular portion was quite large and might be better for 2 people.
author: Jenny J.

description:
What a disappointment!!! The ice cream is icy and lacks depth in flavor. The matcha doesn't have a strong matcha flavor. Black sesame is better but still not great. 

The fish cone. Let's talk about it. I was *so* excited to try it. But much to my dismay, it was below average. A little soggy and mushy. 

Bleh. Won't be back.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
A small is 1 flavour + 2 toppings for 6.50. I ordered a small matcha Taiyaki cone with sprinkles and pocky. 

It's so good and worth it! Got a small because we went for lunch right afterwards. After finishing the delicious soft serve the Taiyaki has red bean paste in it too. The batter for the Taiyaki is perfect. The matcha soft serve had the right amount of flavor to it. I honestly would have eaten two if I didn't had to go for lunch right afterwards
author: Sally W.

description:
The line here can get pretty long here, but it goes quickly. 
The bread for the fish is a bit too tough/hard for my liking. However, the ice cream and the red bean paste are really good.
author: Annie C.

description: Great place for dessert! Low key location but always packed with people trying to get some of the great flavors offered here. Fresh, hot-off-the-presser taiyaki cones with red bean paste is all you need to satisfy the sweet tooth for the night.
author: David Y.

description:
I came during the hottest day ever in SF. The line was out the door and the wait for the fish cones were 20-30 mins. I gotta tell you that it's worth the wait. Every cone is made to order and is still warm in your hand. I got the small matcha in a fish cone. I think anything bigger would be too much to finish and a waste to throw away!

This is something you have to check off your bucket list and come again and again
author: Lisa X.

description:
Went here yesterday because we were in the area for Boba Guys but forgot they were closed on monday. We got there right before they were open and there was already a short line of like 10 people or so. Line moved pretty fast though even with people ordering the taiyaki cone which takes a few minutes longer. There were three flavors to pick from for the soft serve - matcha, black sesame, and tofu. You can do a cone, small taiyaki, large taiyaki, or a cup. They have mochi ice cream as well but seemed like a lot of flavors were sold out. You can also try some of the flavors as well. I got the small tofu taiyaki which comes with two toppings but I only got the red bean. It was very tasty and wasn't that sweet. You can slightly taste the flavor of the tofu but it was good.
