Store is located on the other side of Japantown same as Daiso aka the much quieter side. Will prob be back but I do wish they had a smaller quantity.
author: Tao Tao W.

description: Would never think I'd enjoy sesame ice cream but it's very satisfying, I love how you can add Nutella to the bottom of the fish shaped cone. The flavor is delicious, my daughter enjoys the matcha ice cream. This place is a must try!
author: Just Eat K.

description:
Not sure what the hype is about but I was really disappointed with my visit here. Came here on a Friday at 3:00 PM and was surprised to see how populated this shop was. Once we placed our order, we were notified that it would take about 45 minutes for our Takiyaki's to be ready. Fortunately there is a Daiso nearby to help kill sometime.

My friend ordered the Tofu & Matcha Takiyaki and I ordered the Matcha & Sesame Takiyaki. Overall the ice cream was underwhelming and the matcha ice cream tasted a bit too powdery for my taste. Out of all the flavors I sampled, the Tofu one was my favorite, even though it might sound a little bizarre. The Takiyaki itself was also pretty tasty with the warm red bean paste inside, but nothing worth waiting 45 minutes for. 

I would also recommend eating the ice cream fast since it melts pretty easily and can get really messy. Remember to bring lots of napkins with you and some hand sanitizer too! Overall, I don't plan on coming back and would rather eat at Sophie's Crepes in the other plaza instead.
author: MyTien P.

description: Got the hojicha and black sesame flavors. After ordering, getting the ice cream treat was quick. The shop is small so if there is a line it will form out the door.
author: Christy L.

description:
I think my friends and I made the mistake of coming here when we're still buzzed from our mimosas. And I am only saying that because we came here right after brunch, got in line and waited a good half an hour just to get to the register and then got our ice cream and ended up tossing most of it. 

I'm honestly happy that Uji Time has planted itself in Japantown because that idea just makes sense, right? Taiyaki with ice cream at Japantown? It's located on the other side of the mall where Daiso is and don't worry about not finding it because you'll probably see the line right away. The shop itself is quite small and no seating so you'll find that people standing inside are the ones waiting for their food. 

Prices are decent. I can't lie. From a small fish to a big fish isn't that big of a difference so depending on how much you can eat.. just go get a large. My first time there I got a small with green tea ice cream on top and the pocky stick, of course. The flavor of the ice cream is good, don't get me wrong. But I waited too long to eat the fish trying to get a good instapic out of it (totally failed by the way) and the nausea of the alcohol started rolling in so I'll probably have to come back to really experience it in full blown. But right now, from what I remember, still good.
author: Venus L.

description:
What $8+ Will Get You at Uji Time:

1) A spot in a long, painfully slow moving line.

2) 20+ minutes of conversation with your people and wondering if it is worth the wait but now you're invested and will see it through. #IceCreamGoals

3) The drool worthy aroma of freshly made taiyaki and waffle cones. (Made to Order = Long Line = OK I'll Deal)

4) Taste of all the Soft Serve flavors: Black Sesame was the clear winner IMO.

5) Large Taiyaki + Black Sesame Soft Serve + 3 Matcha Pocky Sticks + Schmear of Adzuki Beans = Asian Dessert Fusion Nirvana.
author: Amy C.

description: I wanna say that the black sesame here is better than Matcha Love. The line was long but it moved pretty quick. Wanted to try the matcha flavor too but was still full from lunch. This place is so cute.
author: Linda W.

description: This place, man! Everything about this place is good. We were here on a Saturday around 2:30pm and the line looked long but  it moved very quickly. Me and the wife ordered the same thing. Black Sesame and Seasonal Flavor, Ash Coconut! I loved how the Ash Coconut was straight up black. Both flavors were very delicious. We both got the Fish Cone thing but my two toppings were extra Azuki Bean and Pocky Sticks. My wife's two toppings were Pocky and Matcha Powder. The Fish Cones texture was soft and it taste like a Fortune Cookie. I do have to warn you, if you choose the get the Ash Coconut, make sure you're not wearing white. If you are, eat it very carefully. That shit will stain! Definitely coming back.
author: Maikell B.

description: Love this place! I've been to the Berkeley location a few times and I'm so glad they opened a spot a little closer. I ordered the small with tofu milk flavor, which is my faveeee! It reminds me of the tofu milk ice cream I had in Japan. I'm also really happy they have a smaller fish version now. I used to not order the fish just cuz it was way too big and too filling. The small is the perfect portion! And I love the red bean surprise at the end. My friend got the matcha flavor which tasted so yummy. Great quality matcha and not too sweet. They also had a seasonal rose strawberry flavor that I almostttt ordered after sampling. Basically, it'll be hard to find a flavor here you won't like :)
author: Carolyn L.

description:
Oh. My. Gerd. Best black sesame soft serve...ever!!!

So sad that I don't live in Cali. TT.TT Ever since leaving... I can only think why didn't we take our trip later so we can actually enjoy the whole menu! We came when it was soft opening weekend. Only got a LICK. ONE LICK. of the best soft serve ever. They didn't have any of the other items ready. When we came back for seconds the following day... they weren't opening. My sister and I looked at each in tears.

San Fran. You will see me again because I haveeee to have more of this heavenly experience! The creamy black sesame delight is hard to forget. I can only pray one opens in Texas!!
author: Emily L.

description: This place was just ok for me. The line was long but it moved rather quickly. I got the black sesame with Pocky sticks and seeds and it was refreshing since it was a hot day. We got it in a small which was enough for us to share. However, it was very hard to eat. The fish itself was not a very good ice cream holder, when you bite it, it would break and the ice cream would come out and just get messy. I would prefer it in just a regular cone. I'm not sure what the hype is but it's probably a good place to try once
author: Huong L.

description:
Yummy taiyaki! The hype is real. It's also worth it.

Came here on a Sunday evening after dinner. Initially, I was scared because there was a line out the door! However, the line moves relatively quickly and I was in and out in about 15 minutes.

I would recommend the small taiyaki. They fill your cone with lots of soft-serve, so you'll still leave happy and stuffed. I got the black sesame soft serve with a French crepe and red bean paste as my toppings. The servers are super friendly and nice. I accidentally used the wrong credit card and it was no problem to cancel it and refund me!

Not only was the ice cream delicious, but so was the toppings and fish cone! The only sad thing is you get the cone in a paper sheath (to protect from ice cream drips), which makes seeing the fish very difficult.

Overall, definitely an experience I'd recommend. If you're looking for an Asian dessert fix, Uji Time has got your back!
author: Angela C.

description:
Yes! Yes! Love it. Got matcha soft serve in a taiyaki plus pocky and matcha powder. It was all perfect - soft serve, pocky, and taiyaki.

I especially enjoyed that the taiyaki was fresh and had just the right amount of crunch to it. Plus there was red bean at the very bottom which i assume is what stopped the soft serve from soaking through.
author: Mimi T.

description:
What I liked:

- the fresh fish cone with red bean

What I didn't like and why I won't be back:

- lack of toppings, though they advertize mochi toppings the girl taking my order said they didn't have it

- very rude service. The girl at the register made me feel like I was annoying her when I was asking her questions in a friendly way, hoping for help to make a good choice. She didn't smile at all and you could tell she wanted me out of there. I understand you might have had a bad day and hate your job, but a smile would help us both to enjoy the experience more :)
author: Tea T.

description:
I did it for the grams. Yep. 

The flavors were okay. I wasn't blown away. I really wanted to try their honey lavender but it was seasonal. Darn it. 

Green tea was average. Black sesame was okay. Tofu was bland. Their sweet corn  seasonal flavor was gross.

Wait was long ~45 mins and not worth the hype unless you have plenty of free time. 

Expect to pay ~7-8 bucks if you want a pretty photo.
author: Suzanne T.

description: Love the matcha and tofu flavor. One of a kind in the bay area. Always pack on weekend thou.
author: Weiyu H.

description: I was really excited to try Uji time dessert ever since I saw it on Instagram. And I have to say I was severely disappointed. The black sesame flavor and the matcha flavor was way too sweet. It was so sweet that it was not pleasant to eat. My friend tried the tofu one and it straight up tasted like tofu. It was so unappetizing. The three of us couldn't even finish the ice cream because it was so sweet. If I were you I would recommend going to Matcha Cafe Maiko On tje other side of the plaza. Overall I feel like people only come here for an Instagram. And it's way too hyped up!
author: Carissa C.

description: Matcha soft serve can't be beat. I always get the small cone and it's very filling. The red bean at the bottom elevates an already wonderful dessert. 100% recommend when in Japantown.
author: Siena D.

description: With all the fun instagram pictures Uji Time Dessert, their taiyaki ice cream had made my list of bookmarked places. Luckily some family came and visited so I had the perfect excuse to explore Japantown and try some delicious matcha ice cream. I had their regular sized matcha ice cream with poky sticks and sprinkles. It was amazing, the ice cream was delicious and the taiyaki "cone" was tasty as well. The regular was probably too much for me, I'd get a small next time. They also have lots of mochi to choose from. Four stars for this place; the lines run long (though move pretty quickly)the lady at the register didn't prompt anyone to what toppings they wanted even though they are included in the price. Overall, clean, friendly and reasonably quick service.
author: Angela D.

description:
I was looking for Uji Time whenever I go to Japantown with friends. Usually we hang out at the West Wing of the mall and found out that Uji Time is actually located in the East Wing. The store is small and there is a sign locating you where the line starts. When walking into the store, it feels warm and the smell of freshly made taiyaki is in the air.

I got the regular sized taiyaki with matcha dn black sesame (you get two flavors for the regular size and one flavor for the small). The difference in sizes between both the small and regular taiyakis are very much different in sizes. I paid about ~$7.50 for my regular taiyaki. You can also order the ice cream in a cone if you're not a fan of taiyaki. On the menu, it says it'll be a +5min wait. I only waited a few minutes for my order to come out which is relatively fast considering there was already a long line when I first came. 

The taiyaki with matcha and black sesame was really good. It was a bit much for two people to finish.
author: Diana N.

description:
I got the deluxe with sesame and matcha flavored soft serve ice cream. 

$7.99 without tax, which includes the 2 toppings. 

The deluxe is a shareable ice cream. I wouldn't have finished one without sharing it with my fiancé. 

Very filling. The taiyaki cone was pretty good, soft and fresh!
author: Aprille B.

description:
Food: their ice cream is really tasty.

Price: affordable 

Service: it takes about 10-15 mins. For your icecream to be ready because they prepare it fresh.
author: Jela R.

description:
Taiyaki is the new ice cream phase.  stuffed pancakes shaped like fishes stuffed with soft serve and toppings.  they have good soft serve flavors: green tea, black sesame, tofu.  you can get a small with 1 flavor or a bigger sized fish with 2 flavors and toppings.
the fish cake was a little dense and on the dry side, even with the ice cream.  
overall cute and cool to eat.  it can take a while due for people ahead to decide and order, so be prepare for a wait.
they also have ice cream mochi with tempting flavors.
author: Linda T.

description:
I'm so glad an Uji Time opened up in SF because I'm never in Berkeley! I love their matcha and black sesame soft serve, they're so flavorful. Really appreciate that they have matcha powder as a topping. I usually get the deluxe taiyaki cone, which has a very generous serving.
My mom loves the ice cream here because she's kinda lactose intolerant and her stomach usually hurts after consuming ice cream. Her stomach didn't hurt at all after eating the ice cream here!

Not quite 5 stars yet because I wish the soft serve was a little creamier, like matchalove's. I've also had my taiyaki cone undercooked once. Other than that, this place is awesome. Please open up a location in San Jose .
author: Susan N.

description:
Okay Uji Time Dessert please land in Chicago!? They make my dream flavor ice-cream flavors sesame seed ice-cream and tofu WOW! Tofu flavor ice-cream is not what you think it is, it's the  Chinese Da foo Fa. It's a Chinese soft tofu sweet dessert turned into soft-served ice-cream on a cone! They have really cool mochi flavors like ginger, and lychee pina colada really yummy. There's a line out the door for this place and it's well worth the wait for fun desserts.

If you're In Japan Town I highly recommend this a stop in here and get some amazing soft-served ice-cream it's so good! I already miss this place as I am now in Chicago.
author: Jaci Y.

description: Seasonal favor is strawberry rose and matcha as always is delicious with red beans. I love Asian inspired favors, especially with pocky sticks and chocolate chips/honey added as toppings. Amazing little soft fishy biscuits in place of the hard comes. Price is reasonable $6.99 +/- as well for small with two toppings. Everything freshly made for a short wait on a Sunday evening.
author: Connie L.

description:
I guess I'll go ahead and address the elephant in the room, there is a fat line you have to wait through to get in. At least that's what I experienced on my time visiting this place on the weekend in San Francisco. However it is part of the hype to take a picture of this so obviously people away and I waited too lol. The taste and texture of each ingredient in this ice cream is just about worth the fact that it's almost 7 dollars for a small cone. 

This place has cute little challenges you can do with your friends and where you play a sort of flavor roulette based off of the color of the ice cream being either wasabi or green tea.  I think probably what separates this place from other ice cream parlors if you want to call it is the variety of toppings you have and where you can fill in your come and ice cream with Nutella which I thought was delicious. Hats off to this business!
author: Adrian G.

description:
After waiting for about 10 minutes in a line that was out the door, I can say the wait was worth it for my matcha soft cream taiyaki cone.
I found this place on yelp while I was in SF for the weekend.
Craving a cool treat on a warm day in the bay, my bro and I headed to Japantown and I am in love with this place!
The green tea flavor of the soft cream was delicious and it's awesome to be able to add two complimentary toppings to your cone if you wish.
I chose green tea Pocky sticks and chocolate sticks for my 'toppings' and they were a nice, crunchy addition.
The taiyaki cone is a creative use of taiyaki and they make it fresh at the shop. I liked the slight crunch or crispiness to the cone, which was flexible, and a size small was perfect for me.
Our desserts turned heads as we walked through Japantown and one man stopped my brother to ask where he could get one. 
A sign on Uji Time said that it was a soft opening and that they are hiring. 
I tried a sample of the tofu soft cream and it tastes just like tofu but with a slight sweetness to it that made it palatable in a dessert.
There was also black sesame flavor, which I didn't try.
The workers for friendly and quick. I'd come back for my next matcha craving in SF!
author: Kerensa U.

description:
The best ice cream I have had in a long while!! I absolutely adore the tofu flavor. It tastes just like Chinese tofu pudding (doufu hua) which I grew up eating, so the tofu ice cream really hit close to my heart for me. I love that the ice cream is just the right amount of sweetness, not too sweet. I went back to try the black sesame flavor as well, which was phenomenal, and the matcha flavor another time -- also phenomenal. The black sesame packs its punch without being too rich, the matcha is the perfect balance of strong tea and rich creaminess. Not only that, the cones are perfect and the warm Instagram-hyped taiyaki is always perfect, so warm and toasty with the surprise of red bean at the end. 

Uji Time is pricey and always seems to have a long line but it is definitely worth going as a special treat or with guests!!
author: Stephanie S.

description: The Sesame Soft Serve is amazing!!!! Easily one of my favorite spots in Japantown. Service is quick and it taste amazing!!
author: Vruti D.

description:
My friends and I waited about 20 minutes to try this popular treat. We sampled all the flavors that they had available - green tea, sesame, and tofu - and were pretty unimpressed with how tame the flavors were (they also advertised a seasonal flavor of sweet corn but unfortunately, they were out when we asked about it). 

The green tea was very weak and the sesame tasted kind of bland. The tofu was the only thing that really stood out - it tasted like vietnamese tau hu so it had more of a soybean flavor. Forunately, the taiyaki itself was delicious! It was like a soft sweet pancake with red bean filling at the end. 

Overall, the taiyaki itself was good but I really wish that their ice cream was better.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
Location: This place is in Daiso wing. It used to be a boba place. They have small space inside for standing only, no dine in or seating. 4/5

Ice Cream: ordering was pretty basic and could be fast. They have few selection of flavors so you don't have to think too hard to decide. The green tea flavor i had was regular green tea ice cream for me. Theres no special taste or anything. The fish shaped cone was another thing. Their the only one in dt SF and Peninsula who offers this kind of cone. It was super hyped in LA and a big deal when they opened location in SF proper. 

Ice Cream: 3/5
Taiyaki Cone: 4/5
author: Waine r.

description:
Long wait but yummy and instagrammable ;P

The wait when I was there was no where as long as the lines I've seen pictures of. Maybe it's because it's no longer as hyped up or maybe people were busy on this day. But the wait wasn't extremely long. 

I ordered the deluxe which comes with two flavors and two toppings of your choice. I only chose the matcha soft serve for my flavor and the dango (mochi balls) and pocky. I thought that the flavors were super yummy. I really like the soft serve and the flavors come through (fairly faintly, nothing overpowering). The dango and pocky were for pictures for me. The dango was actually kind of cold and gooey instead of chewy. It's fine. I would still get it again as my choice of topping. The fish waffle was a lot sturdier than I thought it would be. It holds up nicely and is filled with some red bean so the ice cream isn't just melting into the cone and making it soft. I was happy to see that it wasn't super filled up with red bean like some of the pictures I saw. 

overall, I would go again if the cravings were inclining me. The line passes quickly when you're chatting with friends and the wait for the actual ice cream is quick. They also give out free samples!
author: Tina Y.

description:
I would rate this place 3.5. The line wasn't too long on a Friday evening. The green tea ice cream was delicious, but the taiyaki thing wasn't that great in my opinion (it was really thick and bready). I do love that there's red bean in the cone thing, but it was almost nonexistent. Ordered a regular size and it was about $7, which I think is not really that worth it. I personally don't think I'd be back.

I know some people who liked it, so maybe I came at a bad time or I just had a higher expectation.
author: Maggie W.

description:
Came here on a Friday night after dinner across the street with my family. After all the reviews of the soft opening, I was scared the lines would be very long but it was actually very short. Only one customer in front of us. Their seasonal flavor is pina colada for now but not something that would go to well with the taiyaki lol so I decide to go with the matcha & the sesame. The 2 toppings I chose were pocky sticks and choco wafer stick. 
I was so excited to eat my taiyaki since I've been waiting to go to the berkley location but this one is more convenient for me since my family lives close by. Boy, I was surprised after I ate all the match on the top and started eating the sesame flavor underneath.... they even put red bean in there too mixed under the bottom flavor! That's what makes these a taiyaki! Since this is a soft opening they still have some work to do but def worth a try for everyone! pretty good, the matcha I liked better but def the sesame has a stronger taste just an FYI for my fellow yelpers. I'm a fan & the service was great so I guess I have a new spot for dessert in Japan town!
author: Lisa S.

description: Didn't care too much for their sesame flavor .. their matcha was good though so I scraped off the sesame in favor of the green tea at the bottom . Their fish waffle cone was a nice treat it had red beans at the bottom which I'm personally not a huge fan of. Overall delicious and cute .. you will wait for at least 30 min inside Japan center for it but at least There is a lot of good people watching . The seasonal summer flavor is pineapple which looked pretty tasty too but I didn't get to try it ...
author: Thang S.

description:
Get the tofu strawberry swirl! It's sooo good. (Strawberry rose is seasonal) 

Matcha sesame swirl was also on point! 

There was a line when I arrived on a Monday afternoon but the it moved fairly quick.
author: Kate W.

description:
Expect a wait for these Instagram worthy fish-shaped cones. Prices are high but the regular taiyaki cone is enough for two to share. Plan to enjoy your dessert elsewhere because this small Japantown establishment offers no seating. Worth a try if you have some time to kill.

Regular Taiyaki Cone - Choose 1 or 2 flavors. We layered tofu and matcha. The tofu flavor tastes likes Chinese tofu pudding, 豆腐花. This was my favorite of the four flavors I sampled. The matcha flavor is strong but has some bitterness. I thought the soft creams weren't creamy enough. The taiyaki cones come with sweet red bean paste inside that paired well with the soft cream and kept the cone from getting soggy. Check the bottom left of the digital menu for taiyaki wait times.
author: Amanda H.

description: Got the black sesame ice cream with red bean paste!! At first I wasn't too sure about the red bean but i'm so glad i tried it!! Nutella may have been a bit too sweet but i think together with the ice cream and waffle, the red bean complemented the treat really well
author: Kathleen Q.

description:
It wasn't perfect but it is a soft opening so it isn't supposed to be! Came here on Sunday afternoon with a few friends and we all really enjoyed it but be prepared to wait in a loooooooong line.

Black sesame soft serve: didn't taste as we expected, there was an herbal-ness to it that made us pass this time (fortunately you can sample the flavors first so please try for yourself!)

Matcha soft serve: very good in flavor and texture

Tofu soft serve: wonderful, reminded me of dou fu fa (Chinese tofu dessert with ginger syrup), if this flavor wasn't there I probably wouldn't have got anything

Waffle fish: there is a really hard working girl back there meticulously snipping off all the extra little crispy bits that overflowed from the mold while making the cone, I really love the crispy bits as it adds a nice texture and kind of wish she left it on there, otherwise it was really good

We each got a small with the freshly made waffle fish cone for $5.99. It was a good portion size and comes with two toppings which I appreciated.

Matcha green tea powder: self explanatory

Azuki beans: very good, keep in mind the tail of the fish waffle has a small amount of azuki bean regardless if this was one of your selected toppings so if you don't want to eat a lot of azuki and would rather get another topping then really it's like getting three toppings for $5.99

Mochi balls: major improvement needed, the center was very hard, to the point where we had to chew it off the stick because the center was so hard it wouldn't slide off the stick. I would say skip this one for now and hopefully they will perfect it by the time they truly open

Be careful when eating as it is very tempting to bite down on the mouth of the fish once you run out of soft serve on top but this causes a lot of the melted soft serve to gush out and makes quite a mess.
author: Karen L.

description:
The store is tiny with seating outside of the plaza. 

I would definitely recommend the Taiyaki cone, which is a Japanese fish-shaped cone that is warmed and filled with red bean paste at the tail-end. I'm not a fan of red bean, but there wasn't that much inside the cone!

The employee who took my order was super patient with our sampling. I ended up going with the mini, which is a perfect size (I eat a lot of ice cream normally) that comes with one flavor of soft serve and two toppings. The Taiyaki cone held my ice cream well, but it did get messy and was dripping everywhere for my friend - so grab lots of napkins!

I thought the mochi ice cream was pricey and would recommend buy three instead of just one to get your moneys worth.   

Overall, I would recommend the spot if the line isn't too long!
author: Patricia L.

description: I am so glad they opened a location here in San Mateo!  I've been to their Berkeley location when they very first opened.  Selection is less then other places and their ice cream is a bit melty, but I was told it's because of their machine not running optimum yet.  Hopefully later on they'll add additional flavors and get things up to speed.
author: Dennis L.

description:
Uji time has popped up on my instagram feed a bunch of times from the SF foodies I have followed so when I was in the city, I made time to stop by Uji time.

It is in the located on the side where Daiso Japan is (Sorry forgot if it's the East or West wing!) and after you pass the Daiso entrance you will walk down and see it. It is a small place with no place to eat if you are with a group.

There is a variety of selection for your ice cream and toppings. I was the bad customer and did NOT read how to order before heading to the cashier lol. The cashier was moody and I didn't mean to ask her questions but she just asked me "what ice cream do you want?" and when I was confused what kind of ice cream there was, she pointed with an irritated look. I was stunned how irritated she was with me! I didn't mean to irritate her! I didn't even know the toppings they offered.. I got the deluxe to share with my boyfriend so it includes 1-2 flavors along with 2 toppings. She said "It's right below the flavors" in a monotone STILL irritated face... I was so irritated at that point. I just wanted to order and get it out. I couldn't decide which 2 toppings since I was put on the spot.

Anyways.. that already left a sour taste in my mouth but my boyfriend and I decided to get tofu and black sesame ice cream long with pocky sticks and chocolate sticks. The tofu ice cream was okay. It tasted like soybean and the black sesame was strong and not really sweet. I guess black sesame is either a hit or miss. The pocky sticks we got were matcha sticks and the chocolate sticks we got were those wafer chocolate sticks.. The chocolate sticks we got were stale :'(

The taiyaki itself was bland even with the mochi on the bottom. For $7.99 for a deluxe, I was very disappointed overall. My airbnb was very close to Uji time so it wasn't a big adventure down. It's a great thing to add to your instagram, but nothing I would return seconds for.
author: Thuyen P.

description:
Long overdue review. I visited this place from Florida roughly two months ago so fair warning since I'm writing from my experience and things may have improved since then.

I came to Uji Time when they were fairly new, I guess. I can't recall if it was still their soft opening time but anyways, I decided to line up and wait with a lot of other people to try what they have to offer. The place opened up waaaay later than usual because the ice cream machine broke or something lol

It took I think almost an hour from waiting in line then getting my order. I got the taiyaki with matcha ice cream. Honestly, it was just okay. I mean it was good but not sure if it was worth the whole wait or price. I think its an interesting novelty but I've had better in general. The girls behind me commented a lot of people might be getting this for the aesthetic pics and I could see that happening but overall, my experience was just okay. 

Not sure if I would visit this place again but hopefully since the time of my experience its improved!
author: Beatrice C.

description:
I came during soft opening and the line was out of the door.  It took forever to actually get our taiyaki after we ordered, but since it was a soft opening and they were working out their kinks, I won't let that affect the stars on my review. 

I got the black sesame taiyaki and my friend got the green tea taiyaki.  Both flavors of soft serve were not strong enough.  Didn't feel like it was anything special.  Bottom of the taiyaki was filled with a little bit of sweetened red bean paste, which helped with the soft serve melting, but eating this snack in general is pretty messy.  Must eat quickly!  

Not sure I'll be back as I like the ice cream from Sophie's more.
author: Jenny L.

description: Craving soft serve?? Then this is definitely your spot..the seasonal flavors can be hit or miss,but the purple sweet potato is really good and you can't go wrong with there regular flavors black sesame or tofu and seriously get the taiyaki cone...
author: jonathan h.

description: You know the place is going to be good when there is a long line of customers. As you approach the front entrance you get a sense of warm toasted cone scent. The employees hard a work handcrafting taiyaki cones. Waiting for your cone can seem long, but  totally worth it. The taiyaki cone is pretty big, plenty of ice cream and a nice surprise at the end.
author: Daisy C.

description: After seeing so many pics of desserts from Taiyaki NYC on IG, I had to try Uji Time. It did not disappoint! I like the small menu of soft serve flavors (favorite are matcha and sesame) and selection of toppings. I think the taiyaki waffle is the star here - it's crispy, chewy, and fishy (pun intended)! I sometimes find the soft serve to be a bit icy, but on recent visits its been creamy and flavorful. I have never waited more than five minutes for my order, and not sure if I'd want to wait longer than that for it. It's a splurge at $6 for a small taiyaki + soft serve, but it's big enough to share so that's a plus. I'd love to see another taiyaki spot open up in SF or the Peninsula!
author: Edwina D.

description: Absolutely love this concept for ice cream! I tried the small taiyaki cone with matcha flavored ice cream. The ice cream was incredibly good as the flavor was consistent with the taste of match tea. The ice cream was also well textured as it was creamy and not icy. The taiyaki fish cone used to compliment the ice cream was freshly baked making it warm to the touch and creating a warming effect to the ice cream making it an incredibly tasty, but messy treat. However, in the end I loved the fish shaped design and the savoy and sweet flavors of this dessert. One word to the wise, visit this location early in the day if you want all the toppings. By the time we got there - around 7 pm on a Thursday - they were out of the sesame, tofu, and one other topping. Also, they are very generous with their servings so a small version was like a medium or large ice cream cone at some other places.
author: Dawn B.

description: Came for the taiyaki cones but stayed for the matcha and tofu soft serves. The taiyaki cones are super cute and insta-worthy but take an additional 5 minutes to get your order as a result (and can probably take longer from back up of people who ordered before you). I really fell in love with their matcha soft serve though the first couple times coming here, and the portions for just soft serve are huge! Definitely enough for 2 people to share or one... super hungry person. heh. The last time I came here, I found that the matcha soft serve was slightly icier and grainier than I remembered- you could see little specks of unmixed matcha, which is the same reason why I'm not as into their black sesame soft serve. Hoping that was just a fluke though. I can't wait to go back and try the calpico slush at some point!
author: Stephany L.

description: Oh my. How do I even start? Overrated. Hard. Messy!! I rather go to Safeway and buy some ice cream. I've been to the one in Berkeley (wasn't good either), but this one is even worse. I got the Taiyaki with matcha, matcha powder and pocky stick. Best thing was the pocky stick. Near the cashier, there is a sign that says the Taiyaki's are made when ordered. False. I got mine in a minute. My Taiyaki was hard! :( I could break a window with it. Seriously. Worst I've ever had. Don't give in to the hype and save yourself $6. lol
author: Darlene T.

description:
I tried the green tea a month ago and thought it was so good so I brought my family today to try it.  

We tried the regular with green tea and tofu.  Both were delicious.  
1. The tofu tastes more like Asian soy milk drinks or those sweet dessert tofu that's really soft that I don't know the name of.  My mom made a good point which was that "soy milk" would have been a better name but tofu gets people interested.  
2. The green tea is so packed with tea that it's slightly bitter. I love this.  I really dislike green tea ice creams that just have a hint of green tea.  I like for it to really punch me in the face with flavor.  
3. The tayaki was delicious.  Full of flavor and had some red bean paste at the bottom.  

I think the regular is worth it for having two flavors of ice cream and tayaki.  The odd thing is that it doesn't come with 2 toppings like the small and large do.  I tried the black sesame and didn't like it but mostly because I don't like that flavor in general.  You'd have to read other people's reviews on black sesame. The small size isn't worth it when you get so much more tayaki for 1 more dollar.  

TL/DR:  it's good!  Ill come back again for green tea or tofu! The regular size is more worth it than the small.
author: Jon P.

description: I ordered deluxe taiyaki, which is included 2 kinds of icecream and 2 toppings. You must try matcha and black sesame icecream. The only drawback is there are too many peoples, you will wait around 30-45mins.
author: Jenny H.

description: I thought this place was overrated. The wait was long, which is expected but I had better matcha ice cream. I got the matcha swirl in a waffle cone. The ice cream itself tasted okay to me and it melted so quickly. This was my first time trying this place and I don't think I will come back.
author: Jennifer T.

description: Finally got the chance to try this place! My friend and I got there, the line was pretty long but it went by pretty fast. I got the black sesame with pocky sticks in a regular taiyaki fish cone and my friend got the seasonal flavor, honey lavender with pocky sticks and sprinkles in a small taiyaki fish cone. Both were delicious and worth the wait. I also liked how there was red bean paste at the bottom of the cone! Definitely a plus for me at least because I love red bean. I will be back to try other flavors!
author: Misty T.

description: Went on a Saturday afternoon to try Uji Time and there was about 8 people in line. The staff seemed very organized because the line went by fast and others were served quickly. I asked to try two flavors, Black Sesame and Tofu, before deciding on what to get. The Black Sesame was flavorful and had a little gritty texture from the sesame..overall it was the taste I was expecting and loved it. The Tofu was also very delicious. It reminded me of Chinese tofu pudding aka "tau-foo-fah". It flavor was light but it had the perfect amount of sweetness at the end of each taste. Decided to get both flavors and went for the Regular taiyaki size which consisted of two flavors (additional toppings is extra cost) and pocky. The order came out in less than 3 mins from ordering. The taiyaki was warm and soft and the azuki beans at the bottom was the best surprise! YUM! Will definitely come back to try their seasonal flavors!!
author: Michelle S.

description:
Soft opening dessert place, and you Lina expect to wait for a while here.

I was lick to be the last customer tonight at 9:30pm, so I kinda skipped the wait. Order the mini Taiyaki with green tea ice cream and Azuki (red bean) and Polky stick. Because the mochi and Dango was out :( 

$5.99 + tax. A little bit pricy I would say. But the portion was big. We three people shared the mini Taiyaki (after big dinner) and we were so satisfied. Taiyaki was freshly made which is a plus (kinda explain why the line was so long) and they are very yummy as well.

I would definitely try it again if there wasn't a line. And it's good for share.
author: Sunny L.

description:
I'm always a fan of Uji Time since their Berkeley store has opened. I tried many other ice cream stores, but nobody can beat their matcha, lavender and tofu ice cream. I love their taiyaki fish cone too. It's crispy outside and moist inside, and I love the red bean paste on the bottom, it feels like a bonus or suprise at the end. 

My first time trying their SF location. As usual, there was a long line like their Berkeley store, or maybe even longer here. Everything look and taste exactly like the Berkeley one but I don't see the small taiyaki here, which I'm ok with since I always get the big one together with the soft serve. 

This time I tried the extra dark black sesame soft serve. It sounded mouthwatering already when I saw it on the menu and I had to say I'm totally addicted to it now. It is a must try for anyone who is a black sesame fan. It's so flavorful and rich with a very pleasant aftertaste.
author: Nara Y.

description:
This place did not disappoint! The line was decent at about 230pm. Wait time only took about 15 mins. Per menu, it takes +5 mins for the taiyaki to cook, but today I didnt have to wait. Small taiyaki costs about $5.99 while a regular sized one costs a dollar more. The regular size is enough to satisfy 2 people, unless you're in a sugar crazed mood and don't want to share.. womp womp 

Overall the tofu and black sesame flavor was !! Ice cream was smooth and not overly sweet. The taiyaki was semi warm and and perfect in taste. Not too sweet, not too crunchy. Slightly savory.. azuki beans in the bottom was a surprise treat! I highly suggest anyone to visit uji time while visiting Jtown.  The price might be a little expensive, but the taste is 100% fresh! 

Note- the delux price for 7.99 with 2 toppings is overrated... all you get is maybe pocky sticks, sprinkles, or additional azuki beans... in my opinion, unless you're doing a photo shoot or vlog about this place and you needed a colorful presentation.. skip it and just get the regular one. You're welcome.
author: Samantha W.

description: I'm scared that this is going to be the next dragons breath of Japantown but I'm so happy they crossed the bay! I just ordered a cup of their matcha soft serve and it's just as good as I remembered. Friendly service to boot. I can't wait for their actual opening!
author: Guisela L.

description: I ate taiyaki here with my uncle, aunt, and younger sibling. I don't think this is overhyped, the food just happens to also be visually appealing
author: Mirabelle T.

description: Black sesame, tofu and matcha flavored ^_^ tastes great but melted fast. There's red bean on the bottom if you get the taiyaki cone! Also there was a hair in mine........ :--/
author: S L.

description:
I guess this place had just opened up, so the lines were extremely long!! I've seen this concept before on my Facebook newsfeed, so for me to finally see it in person must have been meant to be! LOL. I'm a huge ice cream lover, so rating the ice cream itself, I give a 4 out of 5. I love matcha. My husband, however, tried a mix between tofu and black sesame. Both of the flavors are alright.. the tofu threw me off completely. It was a little weird, to be honest. Haha! 

Now, the reason for 3 stars.. we both had ours in taiyaki cones... which was hard to consume because the bread was suuuuuuuper thick and dough-y. We both couldn't finish ours.. not because of the sugar rush, but because it was really dry. I think they decided to put the azuki (red bean) paste to help out, but it really wasn't helping. As fancy, pretty and instragram-worthy the taiyaki looks, I highly suggest to just get the ice cream by itself.
author: Kaye T.

description:
belated review (^_^)
reasonable amount of ice cream for your taiyaki :-) costs around 4-5 dollars, but i have to admit i had other ones and this one was pretty good :-) others i was disappointed, like other restaurants wouldn't want to give you a fresh made one..... But this place made it just for me :-D I had the matcha taiyaki and the wait wasn't long. I went on a weds after lunch, and i had a place to sit outside. If its like a weekend or a holiday, i can imagine this place would get crowded. be aware of the crowds. But other than that, it's pretty darn good.
author: Debby D.

description:
New location! 
Next to Daiso. I thought it would've busy, but I guess not. There aren't seats and tables like the one in Berkeley, but you can sit at the benches outside. 

I didn't feel like getting the taiyaki cone today, so just got a cup. I tired there matcha before, so today I got the black sesame. Very strong sesame taste, but nothing too sweet. Next time I do want to try their tofu flavor.
author: Kiyomi K.

description:
This is a new ice cream store in Japan Town.  It was the soft opening, and people were lined up outside the store by Daiso.  The cool selling point are their extra ordinary flavors but common for Japanese flavors- Macha, Red Bean, Black Sesame etc.  They also offer Mochi, it's a bit pricey for many people's taste.

My daughter and I ordered 3 mochis- Macha with Chocolate Chip ice cream, Red Bean and Salted Caramel.  It was ok! So that's the reason for 3 stars, It was ok.  Not something that I would go out of my way to get!!
author: Melinda R.

description:
A+ would come again! I'm still thinking about the taiyaki + soft serve, and asking myself why I agreed to share with my husband. Please open one in the peninsula!

Matcha and their seasonal purple sweet potato was delicious - I'm looking forward to getting the black sesame next time. I don't recommend getting the red bean paste as a topping since it falls off easily and the taiyaki is already stuffed with it.
author: Liz L.

description:
I went last week on a Tuesday around 3:30PM so I came when there was no long line. I was afraid that I had to wait for more than 1 hour for ice cream. Luckily it was only less than 10 minutes. 

Ice cream was really good! I ordered green tea match and it was delicious! It was really smooth and loved it!

It melted really fast so make sure you take several napkins cause you're going to get your hands dirty! 

Overall, I would love to come here again and ordered other items on the menu but I will not wait for one hour for it. 20 minutes the maximum.
author: Jennifer B.

description: I like Matcha and Sesame here, the fish is nice with red bean at the bottom. But I wish that they could make 2 flavor at the same time because if you choose more than 2 flavor than they gonna make as a layer.
author: Mei K.

description:
I've never had a taiyaki before, but for whatever reason, and partially based on the pictures I'd seen, I thought that the taiyaki cone would be crunchy on the outside and light and fluffy on the inside.  It's not as I imagined.  Instead, it's kinda soft and doughy throughout; not horrible, not great.  I was also a bit bummed that there was only a smidgen of red bean at the very bottom of the cone under all the ice cream.  As for the soft serve, I opted for black sesame, which was not as good as the matcha I mooched off of my friend's cone.

Even though I had just stuffed my face with teppanyaki, I also got 3 ice cream mochis.  I was hoping for a Hawaii's Bubbies-like experience.  Bubbies-like it was not.  Not even in the same realm as Bubbies mochi ice cream mostly because the mochi part was thin, not chewy, and overchilled.  The matcha, red bean, and mandarin orange mochi flavors were sadly mediocre.
author: Christina L.

description: Came here whenever I was in Japantown and I'm absolutely in love with their flavors and toppings here. Always have fast and good service ! Even during rushes the workers are always very nice and kind, and never try to rush the orders or seem to get frustrated. I really recommend getting the black sesame ice cream with kinako and dango if they have it ! Dango and pocky seem to be the most popular toppings. Can't wait to come back again !
author: Kelley V.

description:
Perfect dessert after a meal in Japantown!

I came here an hour before closing. Though the line looked pretty long, I felt like it moved quickly. From the time we lined up to the time we received our desserts was about 40 minutes.

They were giving out soft cream samples in line. I sampled their current seasonal flavor, honey lavender and it was a little too floral for my liking - kind of felt like I ate perfume.

We ordered a small Matcha Taiyaki w/red bean & Pocky sticks and a small Black Sesame w/Matcha powder & Pocky sticks for a total of $13. The red bean and matcha powder toppings paired with the ice cream were so good. 

Both flavors were awesome but I'd choose the Black Sesame next time!
author: Bing L.

description:
!!! Lovey dovey sweetie for your mouth!

I would come back here again in a heartbeat. The taiyaki is a beautiful waffle fish with a tasty soft crunch on the outside and soft, warm bread inside. The matcha green tea ice cream is yum.

A combination of the two? Oomph. 

Plus, the taiyaki has a little bit of red bean at the bottom? I don't like red bean much, but it worked for me. The ice cream melts a little in the taiyaki and flavors the batter.

Ordered a small taiyaki cone with matcha ice cream, tofu bean powder, choco sticks for about $7. A little pricey, but it's so good. The portion size is pretty good, too! To top it off, the taiyaki is made in-house. While there's a wait time, it smells heavenly outside and inside the shop.
author: Lilian C.

description: Had the matcha ice cream in a cup! Absolutely delicious, but a bit pricey.
author: Kelly I.

description:
Cons
- hot and stuffy inside store
- taiyaki has been sitting out and not made fresh on the spot
- green tea matcha soft serve is too grainy that your throat starts to feel it the more you eat it although it got good matcha taste in first bite 
- tofu soft serve was okay, needs a bit more flavor
- black sesame was not bad nor great
- only three mochi flavors right now since they just started. So far mochi tastes normal, nothing extraordinary
- expensive desserts

Pros
- desserts are visually appealing
- cool selections of toppings
- pretty chill customer service
author: Karen J.

description: Awesome Idea. My cousin was visiting, she and my girlfriend were craving Matcha while we were touring SF. This place definitely caught us by surprise. We got in right before a big crowd and we ordered the small fish waffle. I had the sesame flavored ice cream since I havent fully acquired that matcha aftertaste yet. For the toppings I had red bean paste and French crepe. We ended the day with such an awesome dessert despite being full. A true gluttons reward. I highly recommend this place, Also they have seasonal flavors on top of the usual matcha or sesame. Hopefully you guys enjoy this too. P.s Be gentle on the waffle cones or you will have sticky fingers, they are so packed that they easily crack/rip.
author: Steve S.

description:
First thought: Where is this place?? I was so confused walking towards Japan Center trying to find this... Thankfully my friend and I found this place by trusting our gut. So PSA everyone **Uji Time is located in the same building as Daiso on the first floor.** This shop is small so after you order, you're pretty much given two choices: to either walk/shop around the plaza or to sit on the benches right outside the shop. 
We shared a regular taiyaki with matcha and black sesame soft serve ($6.99 -- $7.58 total). Overall the flavors were good but I was hoping for more of a creamy texture. When I first tasted the matcha here, my brain quickly compared it to Matcha Love but noticed that it was less creamy. The lady served the two flavors separately too, so matcha was on top and black sesame was on the bottom. I had to dig under the matcha to taste the black sesame while the matcha was slowly melting down... 
As for the taiyaki, it was meh. The taiyaki was soft on the inside and had a brittle, almost crunchy texture on the outside. It's not sweet and tasted like a pancake to me. The soft serve oozed on the sides of the taiyaki as I shared this with my friend. I was surprised to find the red bean inside though! 
I'm not sure if I'll come back. Maybe to try the other flavors. Their seasonal flavor rn is pumpkin miso btw! I wouldn't come back for the matcha but considering how far Matcha Love is (in SJ) and if I'm willing to make that hr drive... Uji Time is probably my best alternative right now for matcha soft serve.
author: Debby N.

description:
Super excited when I found out Uji Time was opening in SF! The original shop is in Berkeley and so a bit of a trek. 

Pretty disappointed with my experiences at the new location so far. First visit was during their soft opening. Waited over 20 minutes as they tried to crank out their taiyaki (fish shaped waffles that serves as a cone for their soft serves). Okay, soft opening. I get it. Forgiven.

Second visit: came on a Friday afternoon and got lucky, no line! Given the wait from the first visit for the taiyaki, I opted for a softserve in a waffle cone instead. No wait this time but the soft serve portion barely filled the waffle cone. 

Aside from that, I have to say I really enjoy their soft serve. Matcha, sesame and tofu are staple flavors. The texture is smooth but not overly rich and heavy with just the right amount of sweetness. Hoping they can find some consistency once they overcome the new operations struggles.
author: Chris S.

description: A seasonal lavender flavor advertisement brought me here. Long line on the cosplay day! The sample serving guy never got to the back of the line. Picked a large fish cone with Tofu & Green tea flavor & red bean paste, also a regular cone with lavender flavor. Short wait for orders & perfect sizes for the price. All 3 flavors are light & refreshing, perfect! Tofu flavor tasted so fresh tofu. I like it! The lavender one smells & tastes so lavender that makes you feel like you're flooded by lavender sea. The green tea flavor was not bad too, taste more tea than milk flavor, good. It feels like they are frozen yogurts made with powder instead of fresh milk. It would taste richer if they are ice cream! The fish cone is for pictures only-I've been to Uji. Its like super soft biscuits that caused the green tea flavor & red bean paste spilled from the body. It would taste better if crispy. The regular cone is not that crispy either, feel like it has been exposed in the air for 3 days. This is a perfect place for people who love frozen yogurts with refreshing flavors!
author: Freeda Z.

description: Super excited to finally get one of these Taiyaki cones. Even better was the matcha ice cream was delicious. Perfect ending to a nice dinner in Japantown. My first attempt to get one of these cool ice cream cones was in LA and the place ran out of both the teddy bear cones and fish shaped cones. The Taiyaki cone even tasted awesome. Everything about this was great. Hopefully this place stays here a while so I can stop by every visit. I almost wanted to try the black ice cream (can't remember what it's called) but it has been a very matcha trip. Previously this same spot was a boba tea shop that sold the tea with cotton candy on top.
author: Pam M.

description:
I have been here twice already. This explains a lot if you ask people who knows me. 
I had seasonal flavor twice (pina colada) once with matcha once with black sesame flavor. I like seasonal and matcha best but black sesame is good too. Probably I will come back.
author: Simbel G.

description:
Absolute crap. Only three flavors of ice cream: matcha, black sesame, and tofu. There's supposed to be a random special flavor but they were out of it. The staff were rude, impatient, and unhelpful. The customers were loud, obnoxious hipsters. Due to the ridiculously limited selection of soft serve ice cream flavors my kids opted for mochi ice cream. It was standard, basic. I asked the staff where their production was housed and they seemed at a loss. Deer-in-headlights look. They replied that they don't make it themselves. It's shipped to them from New York. 

Why bother, I say.
author: Christine I.

description: Came on a Sunday at 1:20pm. There was already a line of about 15 people in front of me. They didn't let anyone in until 1:40pm. Ordered a regular size Taiyaki with 2 flavors: black sesame at the bottom and tofu on top. The tofu soft serve tasted just like how I remembered it in Kyoto, Japan. The black sesame could have more black sesame flavor. At $6.99 a bit pricey, but can easily be shared and split. I was surprised to find red bean paste at the bottom of the Taiyaki, which is a nice treat. The Taiyaki itself is yummy. It's crispy on the outside which helps hold the ice cream in and tastes like HK eggettes. Also tried the lychee colada, ginger zing and red bean mochi's all were delicious too.
author: Vinkin Ken T.

description: Amazingly delicious and refreshing taiyaki ice cream. Definitely better than any taiyaki ice cream in Florida, expect for maybe Taiyaki NYC's Miami location, which I have not been to yet. I ordered the matcha and black sesame soft serve swirl taiyaki with matcha powder and adzuki(sweet red bean paste). The ice cream was amazingly refreshing and delicious. The matcha flavor was prevalent, but not too prevalent in the ice cream. The black sesame ice cream was nutty and had a sort of vanilla and nutmeg taste in it, but it was also gloriously refreshing and delicious. The sweet red bean paste and matcha powder were a wonderful complement to the matcha and black sesame soft serve swirl. The fish waffle was quite crispy and very delicious and warm. The vibe of the place was a sort of Japanese hipster vibe mixed with modern San Francisco vibes. Overall, possibly the best taiyaki ice cream in the taiyaki mecca of San Francisco.
author: Nick C.

description:
I love MATCHA GREEN TEA!!! My husband and I went for dessert and ordered the Matcha Green Tea soft serve and it was SO AMAZING!! You can also add toppings for additional, I asked for the green tea pocky sticks and matcha powder. I enjoyed every single bite!! 

This spot is located near the Daiso in SF, Japan Town, and luckily when we went, there was hardly a line. By the time we got our desserts, the line was really long. It can get really busy, but the line seems to move fairly quickly. We also ordered the Mochi ice cream in these flavors: Green Tea, Black Sesame, and Lychee. All of them tasted delicious! Another plus is that there are benches in front of the shop where you can sit down and enjoy your treats. 

This is my new GO TO spot for desserts when we visit San Francisco!!
author: Joana A.

description:
Went around 8:30pm and there was a small line after us. Didn't have to wait too long.
We got the small taiyaki "fish cones" and they were delish! (My taiyaki had a bit of red bean in it near the tail.) You can ask for samples of the soft serve ice cream, and you get to pick 2 toppings for the small size. Seasonal flavor was honey lavender. Be careful when you bite the taiyaki cuz the ice cream can get everywhere. The tofu ice cream I got was nice and light--exactly what I wanted since I was still full from dinner. I'll be back for the black sesame ice cream!
author: Amy Y.

description:
Would have been 5 stars, but the service was terrible! It's pretty slow right now and the lady working the front/cashier had a bad attitude from the start with us. I get it, you're in a hot environment and it's pretty slow, but that's no reason for you to be rude to me and my friend. 

When we asked what the seasonal flavor was she gave us a quick look of exhaust and answered in a monotone tone. 

Other than that, this place is overpriced but their matcha ice cream is good.
author: Kiana M.

description: The matcha soft serve was good, and the sesame soft serve was alright! The taiyaki was sweet and help up pretty well. They put a little bit of red bean paste at the bottom of it, which was a delicious surprise (even for someone who typically dislikes red bean!).
author: Natalie L.

description: We went to a Japanese plaza in San Franscico and we saw a freaking long line of people at this ice cream store so we decided tag along in line... can't believe first time we try their ice creams; they were so good not that sweet and very tasty yummy melt slowly in my mouth... boi boi they were so yummy. I will come again everytime I go to San Franscico... recommend everyone, it's worth the wait in line.
author: Johnny T.

description: This place is the best and a real hit with locals. I loved the black sesame flavor and got it in a waffle cone. If you haven't had black sesame before it is wonderful: not too sweet and kind of nutty. The line moved quickly.
author: Carolyn F.

description:
I just got back to San Francisco from Japan last week and had been having sugar withdrawals so I stepped up to the Uji counter in hopes to calm my inner screaming three-year-old that demanded ice cream.

Uji delivers. Their sesame ice cream is intensely black sesame in flavor and their matcha is right inline with the sesame. I have had plenty of bad matcha or sesame ice cream cones in Kyoto and Tokyo, but Uji outdid then all. It is nice to know the next time I am in need of a sugar fix I can head to my local Japantown and save myself 17 hours of flight time.

Uji, you are now my third favorite ice cream place in SF!
author: James T.

description:
I've been seeing these desserts everywhere on IG over the past few months. I was determined to find a place in SF but had no luck until this place popped up on yelp! I have a sweet tooth and was determined right there and then I had to get that UJI dessert! 

This place is new. We went there on a Monday afternoon so there was no line. We were helped right away. I got the deluxe dessert in a fish cone. It comes with red bean on the very bottom, plus two flavors of ice cream (I got the matcha and sesame flavor), comes with two chocolate bar and pocket sticks. The fish cone was fresh out of the oven when I got my dessert and I devoured it. I know I will be returning for more! Oh and they also have Mochi ice cream here in a variety of flavors!

This place is in the same shopping center as Daiso. Small place with no tables but they do have benches right in front of the store.  
 
Minus one star for not having many toppings available at the time
author: C O.

description: There is a really long line, but it was well worth the wait. I got the seasonal flavor, roasted purple sweet potato, and it was so delicious. It literally tasted like a roasted sweet potato in a cold, soft serve ice cream form. I will come back another time to try their matcha & black sesame swirl in a taiyaki cone.
author: Cristy L.

description: The ice cream is good, they have several flavors, i like their matcha flavor and red bean fillings. The staff could be more helpful.
author: Uyen N.

description:
tasted delicious. a bit more on the pricey side but they give you more than the normal amount. costumer service was great and i only had to wait around 2-5 minutes more my food to come  
*i went during the night time so there were very few people and i waited in line for a !!minute!!

10/10 would go again
author: Elizabeth P.

description:
First time it's really good I wish San Francisco is closer to Sacramento lol  eh but it's worth it.. 

9$ for large fish cone and deluxe  yummmmm I got :Black Sesame flavor
author: Hannah C.

description:
We were lucky to come before the after dinner rush started. This place is sooo busy during the day and since we came later at night, we managed to get in when they weren't too busy. 

I got the small taiyaki cone with matcha icecream and it was so delicious! I'm actually not a matcha person but I really enjoyed the taste of their matcha icecream. (It comes with 2 free toppings)

My taiyaki cone snapped :( so I couldn't get a good photo of it... I had to hold it by the paper. I wish the taiyaki skin would've been a little thicker so it wouldn't have broke so easily. But overall really liked this place!
author: J Z.

description: It was a total surprise to find this cute ice cream shop in Japantown. We weren't actually looking for dessert but we couldn't resist to try it once we saw the line and interesting menu. We came on a late Monday night so the line was not bad at all. I was surprised to see people even lined up at this hour so I understood right the way that this is one of "secret" ice cream places. After checking out their menu, I had to get one. They offer very interesting, or say traditional, soft serve flavors. The regular flavors are matcha, black sesame, and tofu. They also offer seasonal special flavors. Even their "regular" flavors are very interesting. Instead of regular waffle cone, you can select more interesting taiyaki cone, which is Japanese traditional fish-shaped cake. I ordered the small taiyaki cone with black sesame soft serve and chocolate stick and pocky stick. Quite a presentation when it was served! I loved the creativity right the way. The black sesame flavor soft serve was amazing. Not too strong of black sesame. Not too sweet. The consistency is just right so the soft serve doesn't fall off the cone too quickly. The taiyaki cone itself was also very good. It's made right in the store and cooled slightly before putting the ice cream in. After we almost finished the cone, I discovered tiny bit of red bean toward the end of the fish!!! What a surprise! It's just so cute and so creative.  I definitely recommend this place to anyone who likes interesting flavored soft serve!
author: Wanting H.

description:
I had a very disappointing experience.

First of all the wait time for a taiyaki cone was 45 minutes according to the menu board. I asked the cashier if this was an accurate estimate and she said she didn't think they were making them today, which was untrue because everyone was walking away with one. So I was very confused at her comment.

Secondly, the menu says if you get a regular or a deluxe you can have 1-2 flavors. I ordered a regular in a cone and asked for 2 flavors. The cashier said they don't do 2 flavors so again I was very confused by her comment.

I ended up getting black sesame in a cone and was underwhelmed.

Lastly, the soft serve wasn't all that great. I was expecting super creamy soft serve like they have in Japan, and the soft serve was actually kind of icy. 

I don't think I'll be back.
author: Jessica B.

description:
The ice cream is soooo yummy! I love the fish cone too. I would recommend asking for an extra paper cup for when the ice cream starts melting because it can get a little messy. 

They have about 10ish toppings but I just stuck with the pocky sticks. The flavors include: matcha, tofu, black sesame, and their seasonal, sweet potato. The small size is a pretty decent size, I would only order the larger size if you're sharing with someone.

It was quite pricy - for 4 small cones, we paid $29 (including tip)... still worth it!
author: Christine D.

description: First off, let me say that the hours on Yelp and on Google are both wrong. They open at 1PM officially - the hours sign on their door says 1PM. I got there a bit before 12:30PM and had to wait around for them to open (although they opened at 12:45PM). I got the taiyaki cone with matcha ice cream, red bean paste, and (Matcha) Pocky. The ice cream was pretty smooth and flavorful, but I've had better (in NYC). The ice cream became drippy towards the end, and it was really difficult to eat the red bean with the ice cream the way they put it on. The Pocky was a nice addition though. The taiyaki stayed crunchy even though there was ice cream in it, so I definitely appreciated that. There was also a ball of red bean at the tail of the taiyaki which was a pleasant surprise. $6.50 for a dessert of this size is way too expensive, though I understand that they can charge that because of the novelty and so on. Not a bad place, although there's not really space inside the store to sit or hang out; there are benches outside though. And there's wifi if you need it!
author: Andrea W.

description:
It was absolutely delicious ! The matcha ice cream made for a perfect dessert. 

During the weekdays the wait isn't long  and I got my ice cream in less than five minutes.
author: Neha B.

description: I never had taiyaki before, but have seen it all over social media. Considering that we were in Japantown, my family and I decided to try this place out. We weren't disappointed! I got the black sesame flavor with chocolate sticks and sprinkles. My sis got matcha flavor with chocolate sticks and matcha flavored pocky. We both really enjoyed our taiyaki. The black sesame was slightly sweet and creamy. I would definitely get this next time, but small size lol. The deluxe size is very big (and fulfilling). Definitely coming back!
author: Krystal C.

description: This place was ok but not as amazing as other reviews suggest. We got the sesame and green tea ice creams. Neither wow'ed is...
author: Erin W.

description: A lovely surprise, and probably the best thing I've eaten in Japantown. Wasn't too sure what to expect with the long lines, but it moved quickly. The ice cream was creamy with a good matcha flavour, and the taiyaki was crunchy and fresh - a great way to end. Probably on the pricier side (particularly if you get toppings, it adds up quickly and ended up being around $6-7 for one) but a nice treat.
author: Alice C.

description: I got the Matcha Sesame Large Taiyaki. I am huge matcha fan, but I'd say the sesame flavor impressed me more than the matcha. The soft serve is rather icy than creamy which i think the texture works better on the sesame than it did for the matcha. Overall, it's a fun snack to get in summer time.
author: V L.

description: Took a day trip to the city and found this neat little ice cream joint. Very tasty black sesame ice cream and the cutest fish shaped cones. I will most deff go back
author: Taylor J.

description: I got the matcha soft serve in a waffle cone and was obsessed. The flavors are very limited (only 4 flavors that include tofu and black sesame). Depending on who's at the front desk, sometimes they let you sample the flavors. The waffle cone is great and they give you so much soft serve on a single scoop. It's not overly sweet which I respect and the size was very filling. Depending on when you go, the line can be ridiculously long, so be prepared to wait.
author: Kalani R.

description:
I first tried Uji Time last year at their Berkeley location, so I was excited to see one had opened up in San Francisco! I've been wanting to try it again since then because I remember their tofu soft serve being good and one of the only places around I could get it. I got a regular sized taiyaki with tofu soft serve - but you can also order a second flavor for a regular size if you want to. Note that getting two flavors means that one flavor is inside the taiyaki and the second flavor is swirled on top NOT having two flavors swirled together. My friends thought the flavors would be swirled together - it's not how it is, but they didn't mind too much. 

They're still in soft opening and the line was out the door on a Tuesday about an hour after they opened. The wait wasn't too bad and they work pretty quickly. 

The cost for one regular taiyaki cone was almost 8 dollars which seems pricey but for the size you will see it's a reasonable cost. It's also extremely filling so if you want to finish it all don't come here after having a big meal!
author: Alyssa G.

description: Finally get to try this place and sad to say compare to Japan it did not wow me. I was so excited to find one I thought was as good as Japan but alas the search continues. We try all 4 flavors. Let's start with their tofu which taste like soyful dessert drink in San Jose so it's ok. The matcha was just ok like any matcha ice cream you can get almost anywhere. I knew it wasn't the same as Japan once they gave me the ice cream. Japan has a more darker green color with a strong delicious heavenly matcha flavor to die for. The sesame flavor base of my taste bud I like better than the matcha and tofu. Now for the seasonal flavor which is miso pumpkin ......... OMG.... it was....... it was... not good at all! A very strange taste which I would never recommend. That recipe needs to be buried and RIP. Seriously ! Last the fish which is a no no. It was very hard and doughy. The waffle cone is way better. Just say this place did not wow us 4 even the two that haven't been to Japan didn't enjoy it. In the end it's a 3 star. I know my review is a bit dramatic as long as u don't get that miso pumpkin flavor and the fish cone than overall it's not too bad.  Would I recommend it? Sure. But only get the regular waffle cone , never get the miso pumpkin and good to share to try for the first time. Would I come back? Probably not unless I'm with people who wants to try for their first time to test their own taste bud. Remember, everyone's taste is different. Again 3 star.
author: Christy V.

description:
Tried their ice cream at the SF ice cream festival. I ordered a matcha cone and a black sesame cone. Unfortunately when I received my order they gave me a pineapple ice cream... what? Turns out they didn't have the black sesame and decided to sub it with pineapple without asking me first... I bring it up to the lady at the register and asked if if was the sesame. She turns behind her and asks, then turns to me and relays the message from the man making the cones, saying they don't have the black sesame. That's totally fine, but why would you take my order for black sesame & knowing that you don't have it, then serve me a pineapple before asking if that's okay with me? She stood completely frozen waiting for my response. I shook it off and just took the pineapple cone. Hopefully in the future they will learn how to communicate within their staff and management will teach them about handling customer issues.
But on a separate note. The matcha was good, didn't taste synthetic like other "matcha" ice creams. Pineapple was alright...
author: C P.

description: This is a review of just the ice cream, not the taiyaki, although I would imagine the ice cream also affects the taiyaki. I found the ice cream to be incredibly icy in texture. Compared to the other japanese soft serve place in the same plaza, well let's just say it doesn't compare. The flavor is not bad (black sesame) but I couldn't get over the texture, especially since it's a rather pricy cup of ice cream. Cute idea though.
author: Joy C.

description:
After seeing taiyaki all over my Instagram and Facebook feed, I knew I had to try It out asap. Uji time seems to be the most known chain for taiyaki so of course that was my go-to place. We ran down the street after dinner to catch dessert and barely made it 15 minutes before closing time. Oh gosh this place was poppin! The line was pretty long especially in the last 15 minutes and only got longer to the point where an employee had to cut It off. Luckily, I was able to get to try one! The service was a bit slow. I think the employees were trying to clean and work at the same time so that caused a bit of a delay on orders. Anyways, I opted to get no toppings to try the matcha and black sesame rather than the one topping, one flavor option. You can always get some sprinkles or some pocky anywhere but how often do you see black sesame and matcha as soft serve flavors? I'd definitely recommend choosing the two flavors if it's your first time. Ahh love at first bite. There's that sweet spot in any kind of matcha dessert and they hit It pretty well. It wasn't too sweet and It wasn't too bland. BUT the Star was definitely the black sesame. I was super hesitant in trying this. Black sesame does not sound appealing to me whatsoever, but I gave into peer pressure and got It haha. I can truly say that black sesame is one of my favorite ice cream flavors now. Where has It been all my life! The flavors mixed together pretty well and with that freshly baked cone? Even better!! I had a hard time finishing It but got far enough to try the red bean paste. I'm not too big of a fan on the paste but I think it's just my personal preference. I'd opt for a cone instead next time for some yummy soft serve. 

My friend let me try his fruity basil mochi. It happened to be a secret flavor so I'd ask the employees working about additional flavors they may have aside from the list because that flavor was amazing!!
author: Yvonne P.

description: Great place! Very fast service even if the line is long. Just wished they had more flavors... like perhaps, a common flavor. If not, you're stuck with matcha, black sesame, and tofu.
author: Peter T.

description:
I was sold by Instagram foodie's to come to this ice cream spot. The fish cone and soft serve looked amazing and oh so delicious. Boy was I wrong...

Made my fiancé wait in line for over 20 minutes and insisted that this place was not just a hype (like every other new Sf dessert spot). Once again, I was wrong. Thank goodness for the girl that came by and brought samples of their 4 flavors. The matcha was the only flavor that was somewhat okay. The tofu flavor... why?! Just why would you ever make a dessert taste like tofu?! As soon as I realized I didn't eat any of those flavors, my fiancé made me continue to wait another few minutes so we can at least try the cone. Unfortunately, they don't tell you until you look at the screen, which is inside and nowhere in sight when you're waiting in line, that there's a 15 minute additional wait for the stupid fish cone! I'm literally tolling my eyes and I continue to type. Anyways... how was he cone, you ask? It tasted like any other waffle cone but wasn't even cooked the whole way. Hopefully I don't get a stomach ache from it...

All in all, I got a great photo out of this place and maybe, if they add more flavors that don't taste so bad, I'd be back. Note to self: don't be sold by Instagram photos.
author: Anastasia N.

description: I ordered Tofu flavor in the fish cone. I thought it was good. It tasted like a light soymilk. My boyfriend ordered miso pumpkin and matcha flavors in the fish cone. The matcha was good but miso pumpkin was a bit weird to him.
author: Pim N.

description: At first I was unimpressed at this small store but after seeing the flavors they offered I was intrigued. Their current seasonal special is purple sweet potato - I tried some, it was interesting to say the least. At the end I settled for tofu soft serve in a cone, and loved how refreshing and light it was. It wasn't over-powerly sweet, yet still had that hint of soy. The matcha was strong but did not stand out for me. While it is more expensive compared to other soft serves, I would still recommend because of its unique flavors.
author: Sabrina L.

description: When the weather is 55 degrees that calls for ice cream right? This place is amazing! I was really stoked that they opened one here in SF because their original location is in Berkeley. All of the staff were very friendly and didn't rush any of their customers to select their order. They're very generous and provide you samples of all their flavors. The prices did throw me off because I thought they would skimp on the red bean paste and ice cream, but after my experience it's worth every penny.
author: Monica Colleen D.

description: Line is usually long, but it moves fast. You can ask for a sample of the soft serve to see which flavor you like. My friend told me about the tofu and I did not like it at all. I got the black sesame. The fish taiyaki cone was ok. I wish it was softer.
author: Karen H.

description:
More than just a pretty picture for the "gram", it's as delicious as it looks.
My co- workers and I came here around 7 pm on a Friday night and the line was insane, but well worth the 15 minute wait.

I had the tofu ice cream in the fish taiyaki. Although tofu ice cream doesn't exactly sound appealing, it's quite delicious. Comparable to the Asian tofu pudding (to-fu- fa), very light & aromatic. You also get two free toppings (I opted for the matcha powder and the soy powder). The taiyaki itself was perfect in texture, taste, and complemented the soft ice cream. The red bean paste in the fish fin was my favorite.

Bonus- they have a "special flavor" of the month. It's currently Corn Flower.
author: Ada C.

description: The line here is super long, but it does go by quickly. The ice cream is average. Nothing really special, but then again I have never had bad ice cream.
author: Nin J.

description: This place is definitely overhyped. The line to this place was ridiculously long but it goes by pretty fast so it wasn't too bad. The fish cone is def Instagram worthy but other than that, the ice cream and fish was meh. Coming in they let you try the different flavors like tofu, black sesame, and their special flavor which is nice. The tofu flavor was really good! If you like the tofu dessert with ginger sauce then you'll definitely like this. Black sesame was meh. The matcha ice cream wasn't anything special. The ice cream itself wasn't super sweet which was good and had that nice bitterness of matcha. The fish cone was kind of hard instead of being fluffy like I thought it would be.
