Overall, this place is ok, wouldn't go out of my way to get this again.
author: Kelly N.

description:
As someone who was just walking by having no idea what this place was, I was very satisfied with my Deluxe Taiyaki Matcha cone. The line was a bit ridiculous but expected around popular SF destinations. Once we got to the front of the line, cashier was very helpful in the few questions I had about what specific toppings were. We ordered. We paid, and our come came out within 5 minutes. 

Flavors were great. The matcha and black sesame were great. Texture and flavor. The cone does make it a bit messy but hey. It's fun! Maybe letting the cones sit and cool down a bit before serving ice cream in them because it was still a bit soft and bottom of cone had leaking melting ice cream. Again not the end of the world.
author: Oskie A.

description:
This is a very creative idea, soft serve ice cream in unique flavors, inside a fish shaped cookie (taiyaki) with red bean paste at the bottom. 

Only 2 stars because the soft serve is just so-so good (I got green tea & vanilla), the price seems really high, especially to add toppings, you pay over $1 for 2 Yan Yan sticks or a little matcha powder or sprinkles, and there is always a long line. Minus one star for each issue. It's worth trying once to see if you like it, and it's a fun food. But I wouldn't go back again.
author: Venus S.

description: literally such a great dessert place.  The person working the cashier was really nice and let us try the soft cream!  I actually really enjoyed the tofu flavored soft cream.  if any of you guys are from China/Taiwan, a close reference would be 豆花, which is basically like tofu.  I would really recommend the tofu flavor because it is light and refreshing and not too overwhelming.  Also!  We tried the taiyaki with the black sesame an matcha ice cream.  Those flavors are SUPER INCREDIBLY rich and if you enjoy a strong matcha or black sesame flavor, go for it.  If you don't, try the tofu!  The taiyaki portion was great.  All in all, definitely give it a try.  The portions are pretty generous, but given it is a little on the expensive side.  But the tofu soft cream, ya really can't get it anywhere else!
author: Rita C.

description: Very trendy, pretty looking but ultimately inferior ice cream. I had the taiyaki cone with sesame ice cream... The sesame ice cream was a bit watery and the Taiyaki was bland... With so many people waiting in line you're going to be setting aside a good half an hour and over 8 dollars and SF has so many high quality ice cream place... Try it once, just to say you did and move on.
author: Max R.

description:
Tried this on a Saturday evening. The line was crazy but it moved at a pretty good pace so I didn't feel like I was waiting there endlessly. I got the Black Sesame Taiyaki cone. The flavor was amazing and the ice cream itself was creamy and not too sweet. My boyfriend got the matcha in a regular cone and again, the flavor was right on point. It was incredibly flavorful and really showcased a well balanced and carefully crafted matcha taste. 

Overall I'd definitely love to come back again!
author: Leia M.

description: It's not that great. The ice cream quality was okay. Just like any other regular ice cream places. The texture of the fish was blend and hard! Wish the crust was a lot more softer.
author: Ping D.

description: I was really excited that they finally opened up a location here in SF! I came here during a weekday night and there was barely any line. I got the deluxe taiyaki with lavender honey and matcha ice cream with red bean paste and pockey. It was pretty yummy and super cute!
author: Michelle C.

description: I kind of had high hopes for the black sesame. I guess I'm just not a fan of the slightly grainy texture. I just always expect soft serve to be smooth all around.
author: Cheska L.

description: I stopped here to have dessert since I was shopping at Daiso for cheap stuff.  There was quite a line on a Friday afternoon and the smell of freshly baked taiyaki (fish waffle) enticed me to join the line.  There was not much of a wait (10 min) to order a regular taiyaki (I wanted large but I was saving my stomach room for delicious dinner later) with matcha (green tea) ice cream and 2 toppings: chocolate stick and azuki (red bean).  I also tried their tofu ice cream which was interesting since it tasted just like tofu surprisingly but I was craving matcha.  It tasted delicious and the ice cream held up really well.  The ice cream didn't melt that fast which is the problem I have had with Taiyaki (place in NYC that sells taiyaki ice cream).  Also, the fish waffle cone is crunchier and more durable than Taiyaki as well.  It wasn't that messy to eat at all.  I would come back if I'm ever in San Francisco and need a pick me up after shopping at Daiso.
author: Julie Ying X.

description: Tofu ice cream cone is just okay.  The taste reminds me of the tofu fa my mom buys at our local Asian supermarket. However, its consistency is too icy and not really creamy.
author: Alyssa D.

description: The waffle scent was what lured me toward this shop. Very small place. No seating area inside the shop, but was in a nice cozy plaza where you can find benches all around the plaza. Tried match green tea ice cream.. sure was yummy. Will try other flavors the next time I visit.
author: Tomo C.

description: Matcha soft-serve topped with matcha powder-- finally something strong enough to quell the matcha cravings I've had since visiting Kyoto!  And tucked in the most instagrammable red bean filled taiyaki fish.  So good!
author: Joanne G.

description:
I came here at 7:15pm on a Saturday and the line was super long! I waited around 35-40 minutes. 

I sampled the black sesame ice cream and the matcha one. The black sesame tasted icy (not creamy) which I didn't mind but it didn't have much flavor so I went with the green tea one! The ice cream was good but nothing to ring home about. I got the fish cone because it's no fun without it, but the fish cone was kinda bland and too thick so it tasted like a eggette. I've had this fish ice cream at SomiSomi in LA (I think this is a copy of SomiSomi) and it's much thinner and crispier at SomiSomi which I prefer.

I definitely would not wait that long for this place again - I only did it because my friend and I were catching up in line and didn't mind the wait! I enjoyed it because it's pretty hard to mess up green tea ice cream but I would rather go to Sophie's Crepes in the other plaza across the mall :) they have bomb ice cream and crepes.
author: Sophia L.

description: The matcha soft serves here are the BOMB! The matcha flavors are perfect and it's not too sweet. Wait time was minimal, despite it being a weekend - service was really quick. Unfortunately my boyfriend couldn't keep the ice-cream in the taiyaki cone and it fell out (in part because while the taiyaki cone looks great, it really isn't that well-designed for soft ice-cream). The servers immediately ran out and replaced the ice-cream in a cup within a minute of this whole debacle. I was blown away by their service - we never even asked for more ice-cream!
author: Sam M.

description: After eating a whole lot of seafood, having some soft cream to lighten up my palette was what I was expecting and this place did the job. I ordered a Tofu soft cream in a Taiyaki, because that sounded the most appealing at the time, and it definitely tasted like frozen tofu. I did get two toppings of Kinako and Pocky Sticks which helped to balance the tofu taste. As weird as tofu soft cream sounds, I kind of enjoyed the different taste.
author: Erica S.

description: This place is located inside a small shopping mall. They have many options on ice cream flavors and toppings as well. The staff was very kind and patient with us. We got the taiyaki, which is filled with your choose of ice cream and toppings. The fish like cone was baked perfectly and was soft. At the end of the tail was filled with red bean paste. Great treat to cool down with on a hot day!
author: Mylo D.

description:
I've never had anything quite like Uji time, and now that I have, I don't think I'll ever quite be able to replace it when a craving strikes.

The obvious draw is their Instagram-worthy taiyaki fish cones: thick, crispy-on-the-outside, soft-on-the-inside waffle cones (that are really more cake than cone) filled with a sweet red bean paste at the tail. Anyone who comes here and doesn't get one is missing out!

The taiyaki come are filled with one of three regular soft-serve ice cream flavors (matcha, black sesame, and tofu), or a seasonal flavor. My go-to is the black sesame: it's perfectly sweet (not saccharine) and creamy with a potent, nutty sesame flavor. But both other flavors are good if those are more your jam. Seasonal flavors haven't been my thing, although I'm waiting for the day they have taro as a seasonal flavor. 

From there, you can choose from a number of toppings: I myself like the sprinkles and chocolate sticks, which are flakey cylindrical cookies with a chocolate filling inside. I use them as a spoon to scoop up the black sesame ice cream, with the sprinkles as a nice unexpected crunch. Once you eat the bulk of the ice cream, you get to eat the ice cream-soaked cone and then the red bean filling at the bottom, which is arguably the best part.

The place is small, hot, and cramped, but clean with warm lighting and well lit video menus. There's nowhere to eat your cone on the inside, but the mall has a nice bench right outside with a mini Japanese zen garden behind it and plenty of their seating options throughout.

You almost always have to wait a long time, but it's worth it. Although, hot tip: if you live near the one in Berkeley, it's well worth visiting that one instead due to the shorter line. 

Highly recommend to out of town visitors and locals alike -- it's delicious, charming, and chances are you won't be able to get anything like it outside of Asia itself.
author: Emily M.

description: Went to Uji Time at Berkeley couple times, I am glad that they finally open one in San Francisco! Went there on Tuesday with no line, how lucky! We had the tofu and black sesame flavor in a taiyaki fish cone, they are so good!
author: Mable L.

description: Don't let the long line fool you, the service is pretty quick. I love the purple sweet potato seasonal flavor and will be extremely sad to see it go. I like to get the sweet potato small taiyaki with red bean (delicious!) and chocolate sticks (fantastic!!!). The taiyaki is fresh and goes perfectly with the ice cream. I have to come here everytime I am in JapanTown.
author: Emily X.

description: I'm just here for the taiyaki! The day I came they were out of dango and they were out of their tofu ice cream. I really wanted to try both so I was a little disappointed. But what can you expect? The line for this place was out the door, so things our bound to be sold out. Taiyaki is very tasty. The best part is when you bite down into the cone and get a mouthful of sweet red bean paste. Yummm
author: Jameela F.

description: Save your money and time. My GF and I went here to try it out since it's been viral on social media and so we decided to stop by since we were already in SF. Upon approach the shop, we noticed there was already a line formed. We waited for about 10-15 min. Ordering was quick and we received our Ice cream in about 5 min. I got the black sesame with red bean and French crepe topping in that fish shaped cone lol. The black sesame was pretty good. The bread was over cooked and the toppings I didn't really care for. Eating it was messing but that goes for any ice cream on a cone. There is red bean towards the bottom of the cone like the bread pastries you would buy normally. Personally, I don't care to go back. It was nice to try it out but for a small for $5,l and waiting long, I'm good for some cold stone ice cream or a Walmart ice cream tub or some froyo (you get the point.) if you want to get many likes/comments on social media, i would say go here lol. I only gave it 2 stars because the black sesame was pretty good.
author: Ben Z.

description:
Uji Time is amazing!! There is a long line always, but it's worth it. The deluxe taiyaki is wonderful - I love with black sesame ice cream, wafer sticks, and a refreshing mochi. All-together with the fish-shaped cone, it is even instagram-worthy ;)


Tip: Just watch the times on the board when you finally get a chance to place your order, to make sure you don't get a cone that will take another +50minutes like we did by mistake.
author: E. H.

description:
Their matcha soft serve is not very creamy, but rather slushy and icy and very cold even by soft serve standards. The Taiyaki (the fish-cone thing) tastes okay, made a little stale so that it is stiff enough to hold up the soft serve (but that compromises on the flavor). They let you sample their flavors, and I tasted their black sesame and tofu: sure it tasted as advertised, but because the soft serve is icy, not creamy, it couldn't balance the unusual flavors well. 

Look, if you are happy to pay for that Instagram brag then by all means. If you want dessert that is actually yummy, I say go to the West Mall to that crepe stand that puts faces in their ice cream (Belly Good Cafe and Crepe), they make for cute insta pics too.
author: Anita Y.

description: Very good ice cream served in a cute taiyaki freshly made! The sesame was rich with the right sweetness level. Well worth the wait!
author: Liz Y.

description:
Waited in a long line for these treats. I got the tofu icecream and seasonal flavor: sweet corn in a taiyaki cone. 

The icecream was just done right.  Every bite was so satisfying and delicious. 

The tofu icecream was my faveeee. Tastes just like tofu hua/ tofu pudding. But creamier and just as yummy.  

I got my icecream in a taiyaki cone but honestly other than for pictures, the taiyaki wasn't that worth it. 
On the bottom of the taiyaki it had red bean filling inside, which I didn't mind, but did not expect.  

I also tried their green tea icecream and it was really really good. Not all matcha icecream are made equal, but definitely this one was woooorth and good. 

I will come here again but just for tofu or green tea ice cream in a waffle cone.
author: Daisy S.

description: I had a small fish shaped cone with black sesame soft serve ice cream with azuki bean paste topping.  The ice cream was delicious, just the right amount of creaminess. Although, the cone was cute, it is not friendly when the ice cream is melting! It quickly drips down the outside versus if you get the waffle cone, the liquid is contained in the cone. By the time I got to eating the cone, it was no longer crunchy. Next time, I will get the waffle cone!
author: Lena L.

description: "Ice cream was good, but fish cone sucked, " says my girlfriend. I brought her there for a date so that's that.
author: Danny P.

description: The soft serve was quite good. Had the perfect sweetness. I'm planning to try their tofu flavor next. So far, I've tried the sesame and matcha, and they're both delicious. I'd go more often, but it's quite pricey, which is why I gave them a 4 star. But then again I can't really complain about the price because this is San Francisco, everything is expensive. Oh and to avoid the lines, try going at around 3 PM in the afternoons. First time I went there were 3 people in front of me, second time I went, there was only one. So if you're a soft serve (ice cream) lover like me, I'd definitely recommend you trying this place.
author: Emiliea C.

description: Bonus points for cuteness, but the softserve wasn't all that great. I got the black sesame with some toppings. Taiyaki was ok. Meh experience over all.
author: Pia C.

description:
I tried the tofu flavor ice cream & it surprisingly tasted just like tofu. But I wanted to go with the basic matcha so I ordered the small size taiyaki cone with matcha ice cream. The taiyaki cone itself is pretty small, but the ice cream was swirled 3-4 inches above the cone. The small taiyaki cone ($5.99) comes with 1 flavor (matcha, black sesame, tofu, and their seasonal flavor) and 2 toppings of your choice (french crepe, azuki, kink, matcha powder, pocky stick, poppy seeds, sprinkles, and a wafer stick). The taiyaki also had a little bit of red bean in the bottom towards the tail. So if you like red bean, it's easy to take out, but if you like red bean, mine barely had a spoonful of it. 

I thought the taiyaki cone was good, but not worth the hype. I wouldn't make the effort to return, however I would go back only if I was in the area. I know the lines can get really long, so I went on a Tuesday night at around 8:30PM. But if I return and there's a long line, it's not worth the wait.
author: Victoria H.

description:
Decent matcha and sesame ice cream. When we went, they had a special corn flavor, which I really enjoyed. I thought their ice cream lacked consistency -- the matcha, for example, was pretty thick and creamy, but the tofu flavor was rather watery.

I think convenience of location is a bigger draw for Uji Time than anything else (that, or all the taiyaki photos). They're a pretty small location, so there's usually a line out the door. If I was in Japantown, I'd probably come here for soft serve, but other than that, there are better places in SF.
author: Jackie Y.

description:
I understand that this is a soft opening and I'm trying to be understanding because I myself work in a similar environment (boba) but they were supposed to open at 3:00pm and we ended up waiting an hour since we got there early (2:35) and wanted to beat the line. They posted a notice sign a while after 3pm saying they were going to open at 3:30, after a line started forming. It's kind of left us an unprofessional first impression.

Now for the actual soft serve, I like simple things so I was only going to get the sesame flavor in a cone with no toppings. They offered two free toppings ($0.50/ea) to try to compensate for the wait, so I just added poppy seeds. The flavor of the sesame was good and I think it made it better with the poppy seeds. I would say that it's better than the lavender flavor, which my friend got, because the lavender wasn't very strong at all. Overall, the flavor would be 3 stars.

Again, I want to be understanding and all but that 30 minute wait made me miss my train and late for work so it was just an unfortunate series of events. 

I'd stop by if there wasn't a line, but it isn't worth the wait.

Also, maybe their AC wasn't working because it was quite warm inside which doesn't make too much sense since it's specialty is ice cream.
author: Mary Z.

description: Delicious soft serve place that is worth the wait. The staff is fast and attentive. The flavors are sweet but not overpowering. Make sure you get the taiyaki come with red bean in it!!
author: Bimbo B.

description: Had a sweet tooth craving and took my bf and friends here. Long lines during dinner time. I ordered a regular taiyaki with matcha and black sesame ($6.99). They came out within 2-3 minutes of ordering. The taiyaki came out mildly warm but for good reason. You dont want the soft serve to melt too fast. The matcha was ordinary, slightly sweet, but the black sesame was great! Not too "toasted" sesame flavor. Taiyaki cone was ok, you can take the eggy goodness. Azuki beans at the bottom of cone was great too. Ask for the stamp card!
author: Thomas L.

description:
The lines here can be long but the wait time isn't too bad. They are well staffed and organized. When I stopped by the place there were four flavors available, Matcha, Tofu, Black Sesame, and Lavender. The flavors are unique and delicious and the Mochi ice cream is always great.

Unfortunately I would recommend just getting the ice cream in a cup, since the Taiyaki and waffle cone both are very bland and tasteless.
author: Brian H.

description: I got three different Mochi (Mango thai basil, chocolate chip, and lemon), and was impressed by the subtle texture of both the ice cream and the freshness of the rice mochi wrap. There isn't much of a line on Monday's around 6 pm, and the speed with which the workers took our orders and prepared our desserts was great. Of course, many Mochi and ice cream flavors were unavailable by the end of the day, and certain items take longer to prepare than others (my friend and I thought that the 10 minute wait for taiyaki would be too long), but otherwise Uji is in a great location (in the heart of Japantown!) and ridiculously satisfying for anyone with a sweet tooth. I was sorely tempted to buy another three pack of Mochi (~$7), but decided to make a return trip in the near future instead.
author: Stephanie G.

description: Delicious, the matcha hit the spot. The taiyaki is a must (waffle cone) your last bite at the tail is red bean paste.
author: Sarah T.

description:
Pros: decent quality ice cream. Menus are expected. Price is okay. 

Cons: long lines. Poor customer service. Clerks should be more professional.
author: Jay S.

description: Eh.. for the wait, it wasn't worth it. Got the green tea soft serve with fish cone, the soft serve itself is grainy and not smooth like it should be. The cone is mushy and just doesn't hit the spot
author: Vanessa Y.

description:
I would rate my overall experience to be about 2.5 star . I had very high expectations for this place when I saw the "coming soon" sign poster posted that they were going to open in Japantown . I know that they are still currently in there soft opening stage but please as customers are browsing the menu , the cashier should let them know ahead of time what they do / do not have in stock . Don't tell them after the customer asks them about it . 

You need some serious ventilation installation in your shop . It is soooo stuffy inside . Even the poor cashier standing in the front taking customers orders had a mini fan infront of them cause it was so stuffy inside .. I understand you need to make taiyaki that's why its so hot . But I had to wait for 3 different flavored icecream coned taiyaki . My friend passed them to me one by one & I was carrying them outside to wait because I was afraid if we waited for all 3 of them in the shop , the soft served icecream would've melted by then .

Mochi Icecream 
You have 12 different flavors listed, but only 3 of the 12 flavors were available !?! Like I said in the beginning , you should let customers know ahead of time what is / isn't available before customers start listing what they want to order . Wanted the green tea flavor , sorry not available . Wanted the sesame flavored , sorry not in stock . Wanted the red bean flavor , sorry we don't have . Can you just tell me what you have available right now ?? The cashier told us what they had but we couldn't really hear what they were saying . We just told them to give us one each of whatever flavored they had . Don't know what flavors we got but we received 3 frozen mochi icecream (had to wait a bit for them to defrost) they didn't taste anything special or something I would want to try again .

Am I not mistaken that Uji Time is known for their taiyaki soft serve ice cream cones . Shouldn't you make the taiyaki cones on the spot when the  customer orders it . We ordered 3 taiyaki soft serve icecream cones and dearG who knows how long it was made and just sitting there . Each cone is suppose to take about 15mins to make according to the menu that they show . All 3 cones came out in less than 10 minutes wait time . When I held the cone it wasn't even warm & it even became deformed looking as I was holding it . 

Taiyaki soft serve flavors : 
Tofu : tasted like Asian Vitasoy soymilk flavor 
Sesame : very light sesame taste (creamy / milky)
Matcha : very very strong matcha flavor . Being a crazy matcha addict , I love matcha . But I wanted to eat it as matcha soft serve ice cream and I expect it to be a tad bit sweet . But every bite I took it would just get bitter and bitter with the grainy matcha powder . It felt like I was just eating soft served matcha powder instead of soft serve matcha icecream . 

Topping Add On :
Was making sure that the dango listed under the topping add on was similar to mochi . Asked about it and wanted to add it on . Then the cashier informed to us they didn't have it . At this point I was just annoyed that we were informed after we inquired about wanting to add it on . We just added pocky to our taiyaki . They gave us about 5-6 sticks of pocky . Made our fish look like a porcupine ..

Don't think I would come back to this location but hopefully in the future if I ever need to do something in the east bay , I'll go try out their Berkeley location .
author: Annie L.

description: This place probably has the best soft serve I've ever tried. I am not a fan of tofu or black sesame at all but honestly, theirs is really good. The line was pretty long which is understandable since it's new but I feel like it was worth the wait. Total came out to around $7-8. Definitely will come back again :)
author: Chris M.

description:
The mochi is very good and they offer flavors that even Americans would like. 
The taiyaki is AMAZING the dough is so delicious. The matcha ice cream is very strong flavored and smooth. 
The line is very long and not efficient but I think they have only been open for like a week. Hoping that gets better but we like the dessert so much we go regardless.
author: S K.

description: Came here on a Tuesday afternoon. Everything in Japan was very peaceful and not hectic at all. The place didn't have a line nor did it look lively. It was humid inside, assuming that their AC was broken? Anyways, I paid $6.50 for a small fish waffle with matcha ice cream + 2 toppings. It was my first time here, I would go again. Customer service was friendly, but the lady that was taking orders seemed kind of rude but maybe she's just having a bad day. Everything was delicious, especially the matcha ice cream. 9/10 would try again.
author: Mimi L.

description:
I got Black Sesame Taiyaki with azuki bean and green tea pocky.

I didn't care for Taiyaki when I got it at another place but this Taiyaki was bomb! The ice cream  and azuki (red bean) were really good too!
author: Jeanette M.

description: So I heard that this place can get really busy, but I came on a weekday and there was no one there! I was really excited to try it because I've had taiyaki before but something about this place made it seem more authentic than any other taiyaki place I've been to before. I ended up getting the black sesame soft serve in a red bean filled taiyaki. It also came with two free toppings so I added matcha powder and pocky. I was absolutely in love with the taiyaki! The black sesame ice cream was amazing and the matcha powder gave it a nice touch! It was so refreshing and light. The taiyaki itself was very soft and pleasant. I really enjoyed and was surprised that I would actually appreciate the red bean filling. I would definitely come back here cause there's so much to do in this japantown plaza !
author: Kaitlyn S.

description: Everyone there is super polite, the cones, taiyaki, and ice cream are super tasty. Don't be fooled if there's a line - because there's always going to be a line. It moves quickly!
author: Mark S. I.

description: I remember seeing the sign on their door before they opened and I'm happy I finally had the chance to go.  There isn't much selection for ice cream so I opted for the black sesame in a cone.  There was a line but the place was also really small.  I love ice cream and I have to say that I enjoyed it!  It's an interesting flavor and had a hint of peanut in it.  It's right next to Daiso so right after shopping you could come here for a sweet treat.
author: Mikayla M.

description: ahhh this place is so solid! and the products are super instagrammable - hence the 5 stars. we came here after getting ramen at hinodeya - basically the most perfect evening.  i got the large taiyaki with matcha and black sesame soft serve flavors - so good! it was my first taiyaki! you can also select toppings, and i added red bean.  they offer regular cones and cups as well, but why would you choose that? lol.. my friend got mochi and enjoyed those as well.  will definitely be back!
author: Christina L.

description: Black Sesame all the way!! Better than Bi-Rites' Black Sesame in my opinion. The small size will be big enough to share for up to two! Matcha is also good, but you can get matcha anywhere nowadays, whereas the black Sesame you can not. Obviously you need to get the Taiyaki cone to get the full experience, also it is filled with red bean at the bottom.
author: Yeji S.

description: The matcha green tea soft serve with taiyaki was amazing!
author: Thalia H.

description: I just had the pleasure of literally doing business with Uji Time Dessert.  My business, Raff's Party Machine Rentals, teamed up with Sharon and her team to provide their awesome handmade soft serve ice cream and warm, fresh Taiyaki cones for the folks at Cisco in SF.  They are a professional outfit, very hands on and helpful with their customers.  It's great when you can find a business that not only has a superior product, but delivers it with exceptional service.  I look forward to partnering with Sharon and Uji Time for more events!
author: Chris R.

description:
If you want a taiyaki later in the night, Uji is your best option. Serving sizes are generous. Note that the taiyaki cones have a stiffer texture (like a traditional taiyaki mixed with a cake cone) than a normal taiyaki because they are in a cone. 

Service is quick and every cone is Instagrammable, presented through a faux matsuri curtained stall located in the store. The stall acts as the traditional pickup location you'd find at a cafe and is really just the nicest little addition. It goes with the whole Japanese town facade thing in the mall. 

We tried the matcha and the rose flavors. Very good. I wish they had more types of toppings and maybe a few more flavors, but it's a small shop. For seating, go upstairs and find some tables.
author: Heather D.

description: I love this place! They were sold out of the tofu and the Honey Lavender which was a seasonal flavor so I have to come back to try them out. The waffle cone is so soft and moist too. I ordered a small with green tea matcha ice cream. I should've gotten a swirl of that and sesame, but like I said I'm coming back so I'll probably get it next time. It's worth checking out and a great addition to Japantown.
author: Dara S.

description: This place was amazing ! The lines were kinda long but it was worth it. If you're not sure on what to get, they offer samples. I recommend the taiyaki though.
author: Vonne T.

description: Stopped by around 8:45pm on a Tuesday and there was only one person in line in front of us. The price is pretty steep. I paid $7.58 for a regular taiyaki cone with matcha soft serve. The soft serve was pretty good. The matcha flavor was on point and the texture was soft and creamy, as it should be. The cone was just okay. It was doughy, not easy to eat with the soft serve, and not very flavorful, but I did like the red bean filling at the bottom. That was a pleasant surprise. I also don't know how fresh the cone was. On the menu, it says it takes 5 minutes for the cone to be made, but we got served right away. Overall, though it was a decent dessert, I think this place is overhyped and overpriced. I rather take that $7.58 I spent on one cone and but a whole tub of green tea ice cream from ranch 99!
author: Lexi R.

description: It was nice to try this place out, but the price was a bit pricey for me. The black sesame flavor was my favorite and the matcha flavor was alright. The ice cream itself didn't really have a creamy soft serve to it, but it's all based on preferences so I probably wouldn't say it was my best experience.
author: Sua H.

description: Uji time finally opened in SF! Since its fairly new, the wait can be 15-20 mins. The taiyaki fish was the must have along with different flavors of ice cream. They had matcha, tofu, sesame and seasonal flavor. The seasonal flavor was lavender which was okay compared to the rest. Overall, the tofu flavor really stood out and very yummy. The wait for your order came instantly which was wonderful. One flaw to this experience was the ice cream melted the movement we received it. Barely had a chance to take pictures.
author: Melanie N.

description: Long lines - felt like we weren't moving for a while but after ~30 min, we made it to the front. Service was friendly. I got the black sesame taiyaki. I was a bit disappointed that the black sesame flavor was so light. However, the matcha flavor was pretty good! The taiyaki was soft and had a nice toasted flavor with a bit of red bean paste at the bottom. The ice cream melted very quickly and it became quite messy at some point. It's definitely unique and worth trying out - not sure I would stand in line for this again.
author: Yin H.

description: The only reason for three stars is because the flavors were average, nothing I haven't tried before but it's still tasty! I got two flavors of Matcha and Tofu and both were refreshing with the right amount of sweetness. If you ever had the asian dessert of tofu pudding (aka Tofu Flower) then that's what the flavor is! Annnd, at the bottom of the fish, there's red bean!
author: Christie C.

description:
Really loved their tofu soft serve ice cream. It's a very unique offering and it's not overly sweet. I also tried the sesame flavor but you can find that ice cream at other stores. The deluxe taiyaki has red bean inside and was fun as a cone. The regular waffle cone is quite good with the ice cream too.

Wish they opened past 9pm on week nights.
author: Ali F.

description: Came here last night and hardly a line..good timing, I guess.  I got the black sesame in the taiyaki small fish cone.  I thought the black sesame could have had more flavor to it.  Had other black sesame before and this was okay.  With the taiyaki cone, you get 2 free toppings and unfortunately they didn't ran out of azuki bean...ugh.  It is good they give you 2 free toppings, but nothing great to choose from.  Maybe add mochi and some other unique ones.
author: James L.

description: Love the ice flavors, especially the tofu.  They ran out of many toppings, so that was disappointing.  They had a nice variety of mochi ice cream flavors, but nothing extra unique.  The line is the only reason I haven't gone back.  That was a brutal wait.  Then again, it was the weekend.
author: Annie R.

description:
The ice creams are good, my favourite is Tofu and Macha in Taiyaki Cone. The Tofu is a little bit too sweet compared to the one I had in Japan but is generally good.

The service though, needs improvements... The lines there are always confusing, sometimes mixed with their neighbor ice shave, because of lack of proper space for a short line. The waiter/waitress sometimes keep chatting among themselves while you keep waiting....which I really hate...and sometimes, there were just no one at the counter for some minutes. Always noisy, the tables need better cleaning, also, it needs better air circulation there.... Not a great place to sit down...but since it's the only place I found Tofu Ice cream around here....I still come on weekends quite a few times....
author: Yiping L.

description: I came here on the hottest day In SF, i love the tofu flavor ice-cream so much! The fish cone is just so cute and also delicious.
author: Emily M.

description:
We waited for ~30 minutes, and i thought it would be a lot slower, but the line moved relatively fast. 

Ice cream in a taiyaki.
How can you not like it?
But to be honest, that was the extent of my feeling.
The tofu ice cream and matcha ice cream were decent, with tofu ice cream having a lot of soy flavor (of course), and both being not too sweet.

It was a pleasant surprise to see that there was red bean paste at the bottom of the taiyaki cone.

Overall, I would go back if I'm in the area, but probably wouldn't go to Japantown just for this.
author: Chris P.

description: I love this place! Great ice option with a unique twins tin both cone and flavors. A little expensive but I highly recommend trying it at least once. The only question I have: What does the tofu flavor taste like?
author: Miles M.

description: Went here just before closing. The line was out the door but it moves pretty quickly. I got the taiyaki cone with matcha and black sesame ice cream. Service was good and the ice cream tasted pretty good, but I feel that it isn't worth the price. Regular taiyaki cones are $7 while small ones (which are significantly smaller) are $6. Their main selling point is their unique Japanese flavors and cute taiyaki cones. It's definitely a nice place to try once but I would look for a cheaper place for the flavors if that's what you like.
author: Chris P.

description:
Saw this place while walking around JTown and it was empty when I came in. I went up to the register and asked what it was, and the girl just goes, "It's just ice cream."  Als wanted to try it so he got a matcha flavor in a fish-shaped bread thing. I took a bite to try but I didn't like the bitter after taste or the 30 minute long wait for "just ice cream". 

But I mean if you want something aesthetic to hold up in your insta pics, go for it.
author: Nicole A.

description: Their seasonal flavor a few weeks ago was sweet corn! And being a huge corn lover, I absolutely loved it! It might be weird to imagine corn flavored ice cream but they made it work. I didn't care too much for the taiyaki cone but I will come back to try other flavors!
author: Grace M.

description:
I couldn't believe my eyes when I typed into the search bar for soft serve and Uji Time showed up, I didn't even know they had opened a new location. When I got to the area where Mitsu Tea House had been, it finally clicked what the long line was for. It was still their soft opening and though the line was a tiny bit long, the wait wasn't actually all that bad. My friend and I was actually glad the line was long, because we had a bit of time to kill. 
At first we were both a little bit unsure of what to get and was leaning toward getting the black sesame soft serve, until we noticed there was a "seasonal flavor" being displayed. Due to curiosity, we asked the cashier and was told it was "Honey Lavender". Tempted by the name, we immediately decided to get the seasonal flavor and the cashier was very nice to offer us a sample taste before we decided on the actual order and it was simply delicious. 
We ordered the soft serve plain with nothing else besides the waffle cone (the taiyaki were with much longer waiting time, 25+ minutes for the large and 5+ minutes for the small) and it was really a good choice. Both the flavor of the lavender and honey blended very well together and was totally not overwhelming at all. The soft serve was delicious and just melt in your mouth leaving behind a very pleasant after-taste. The waffle cone was a bit plain but the sweetness of the soft serve and crunchy texture definitely made up for it. 
Overall, this was a very nice experience. The wait was a bit long due their opening but the time waiting for our soft serve was less than 10 minutes and we couldn't be happier. And we totally appreciated the very nice staff who offered to let us try out the flavor before actually ordering, it was a very nice gestures! We will definitely be coming back here once we get the chance, very excited for upcoming seasonal flavors.
author: Quynh T.

description: Equally instagrammable and delicious. A bit hard to find, but follow the line of people waiting to get this delicious treat.
author: Kelley C.

description:
Looked good. Line looked long but was about 15min wait.
Got a Matcha Soft Serve, after biting into it, I found a giant cavern of nothingness. Not likely to return.
author: Alan L.

description: Their taiyaki is super delicious! I got the small taiyaki with matcha soft serve. It's a bit pricey, but still a good treat.
author: Donna L.

description:
Wont be back.  Management needs to train their staff better or get new staff.  The sign outside their store says they open at 12:30pm and we were there at 12pm.  We decided to wait since my son really wanted to try it.  It was 12:35 and they had not opened their doors.  I asked the staff member if opening time was actually 12:30 or if it was a mistake on the sign. She just looked at me like she was annoyed AT ME, the customer, and said that they weren't ready.  I actually understand if you aren't quite ready but I just needed an estimate - 5 minutes I can do, but another 30 minutes is very different.  As a paying customer I had every right to ask "what time do you open?"

Well about 2 minutes after I asked her, she opened the doors and there was already a line of at least 10 people behind me.  I was the first customer - i gave her my order but guess what...they didnt have the Taiyaki (fish) cones and If I wanted it I would have to wait another 30 minutes.  Ridiculous.  No apologies or anything, btw, for them not having the cone we came here for, for their FIRST customer.  It wasnt like they ran out and needed to make more!  Unprepared much?

Your business sells 1 thing: ICE CREAM inside CONES and you and your staff didnt get there early enough to have your ingredients ready by opening time of 12:30pm.  
Unacceptable.

Customers flock to your store, Uji time, because yes, you are very popular. And yes, the ice cream is decent and the cone is instagrammable.  Customers are willing to pay $6 bucks or more for your ice cream in a Taiyaki cone and thats why they visit you - but only if you have it available? Sheesh.  Luckily, there are other places I can go to get ice cream.
author: M M.

description: Been to the Berkeley one before and I gotta say I'm impressed. It's located next to Daiso and when we got there at 8pm there was a small line forming because people wanted to try flavors and there was only one cashier. Inside was pretty small and warm and I decided to try the tofu which was okay in my opinion. Got the black sesame in a cup and it was about 4$ it was pretty good. I will be back whenever I'm in the area.
author: Tina C.

description: Very rich and creamy green tea taste. Probably the best of the same ice cream in San Francisco or Northern California ! I took away that one star because it is not the best compare what I had in Hong Kong and Japan. Sorry ...
author: Wai C.

description: Solid ice treat in a Taiyaki cone. Line gets a little too long sometimes. More Taiyaki cone dessert places should open soon.
author: Karl K.

description:
A friend & I stumbled across this place when we were in Japantown. I wasn't looking to get ice cream, but once I saw it was the place with the fish taiyaki, I had to come in & try it out. There was probably about 4-5 people ahead of us, so the wait wasn't that bad. But by the time I got my ice cream the line was out the door. 

We had samples of Matcha & Black Sesame. The matcha tasted good, creamy & not too strong. But I decided on the black sesame. The only sad thing is that I didn't get the fish taiyaki since the wait time for it was 45 mins.. So, I just got it on a waffle cone & called it a day.
author: Vangielynne P.

description: It is located inside the East Mall, next to Daiso. The soft serve is not too sweet, with a strong matcha flavor. Just the way I like it! I wish they were a bit more creamy. I need to come back for the fish cone.
author: Kritika K.

description: I want to say I attempted to come to this place 3 times, but all three times the line was ridiculously long but finally one day coming at the right time I was able to try this place out. I saw it was very popular on social media so I had to try it out to see for myself what the buzz was about. I ordered the matcha green tea served with taiyaki, why my friends ordered the half and half with the much bigger taiyaki. There are two sizes you can choose from I choose the smaller size. It was quick to order and get your order at once. I have to say I was not impressed at all. I was a bit more disappointed, the taiyaki tasted like it has been sitting out for a long time, so it tasted and felt like it was stale, the soft serve melted really quick, and mind you I have had a few taiyaki's with soft serves at a few other places. I honestly have to say it was just a buzz that was going on, but it was really nothing special. I didn't think it was the best , Ive def had better. I'm not sure if I would ever come back especially waiting in line for this. If maybe there was not a line I would give it a second try but I dont think it was worth it.
author: Tiffany K.

description:
I mean, who doesn't want their Japanese-flavored soft serve served in a cakey cone shaped like a fish with a good helping of red bean paste in the bottom?

Black sesame ice cream is delicious and not too sweet. The matcha is good too, but you've got to be in the right mood for it. Haven't tried the tofu flavor yet...
author: Rachel B.

description: The ice cream was delicious, but the cone didn't hold up well. Within 5 mins of eating it started to leak and fall all over my clothes and shoes. Nonetheless, it is very visually pleasing. But I do wish they had more ice cream flavors available.
author: I K.

description: Both times I went I was underwhelmed by my treats. I take my Japanese dessert very seriously. Had the pumpkin ice cream once and the black sesame the other time. Boring but not awful. Not worth the hype and def overpriced
author: Sally R.

description:
My friend was headed out of town. Just thought we would give it a try, but I was the only first timer. I had no idea that this place had other locations that were popular. At the time of my visit, the location was still running a soft opening. Uji Time offers a variety of taiyaki sizes with varying flavors of soft serve, tons of flavors of mochi ice cream, and they even had calpico slushies. 

Food - 3/5
I got the larger taiyaki with tofu and matcha flavor (protip: you can choose more than one flavor). For those of you that don't know, taiyaki is essentially a fish shaped cake (similar to a firm pancake). This particular taiyaki was filled with ice cream and red bean paste. The ice cream filling flavors were interesting (matcha green tea, tofu, black sesame, and honey lavendar). I would definitely recommend the matcha flavor. Honestly, I think I would get the small one next time. If the ice cream sits too long, the yummy freshly made cake gets cold.

*Be careful with your licks and scoops of ice cream. We saw someone drop theirs on the floor and it doesn't get much more disappointing than "floor ice cream".

Service - 2/5
Again, this was a soft opening and this is the first SF location so naturally the line was out the door and down the hall. It was about a 30 minute wait to try this delicious treat. I think the major problem was that people didn't know what flavor they wanted, causing long order times.

Ambience - 4/5
There is not seating inside, but it is located in the mall with seating right out side. Which after the hype dies down, would be a great place to enjoy the taiyaki.

It was a great treat, but I don't think I will be back until they figure things out.
author: Ryan J.

description: Visit ones here while I was in town. I got the black sesame ice cream. It was my first time having taiyaki and I really enjoyed it. I've tried other places with black sesame flavor but Uji's is more flavorful which I liked. And the ice cream itself is pretty creamy. My favorite part was the cone of course cruchy on the outside and sweet and chewy on the inside. Delicious.
author: N D.

description: The line can be a little intimidating, but it moves quickly!!  Yes, I honestly came here because I wanted to Instagram the hell out of it.  My niece who is into everything food and Japanese decided to take the adventure with me to Japantown to try out the Taiyaki fish cone with soft serve.  The line could've been a lot worse!  Honestly, it was entertaining to watch the cones before made right there through the window.  I had the green tea matcha soft serve with pocky and sprinkles.  Kind of sad that they were out of mochi!  The soft serve was delicious - very matcha-y.  The cone was not what I expected.  A lot of reviews said it was crunchy on the outside with a soft texture inside.  My whole cone felt soggy through and through.  It was a little disappointing.  I feel like if you can't eat this fast, it will create a giant mess of soft serve in your hands.  Bottom line, take a quick snap and eat away!
author: Reena P.

description: Better than Somi Somi. I really like how strong the flavor of the soft served ice cream are.
author: Melanie L.

description: Omg I'm full support for this business, I just wen't today and tried the matcha soft served ice cream with a taiyaki cone and it wasn't burnt nor undercooked. I also tried the seasonal ice cream called purple yam also known as taro ice cream and what a awesome flavor, semi floral. I hope they stay in business!.
author: Wolf B.

description:
Wow, this place hasn't been open for that long, but they need to get a bigger place ASAP.

The wait was quite long, but luckily we got free samples to go with our patience. Their flavors are matcha, black sesame, and tofu, with their seasonal being sweet corn (only for now). I tasted their matcha first, and it was strong like it should be. I also tasted their black sesame, and it was smooth and amazing. In case you're kind of repulsed by these weird flavors, please don't be fooled. They manage to make them taste creamy and flavorful.

Now, the line is long after dinner, so it's best to get it during after lunch to before dinner. Nonetheless, it was totally worth the wait. The wait for the actual ice cream takes about 1 minute (waiting for your order). Also, I was especially pleased when the guy who made mine was stopped by his co-worker who said, "No, it's not pretty," and proceeded to refill my cone with ice cream. I've concluded that they do take great pride is the aesthetics of their presentation, which I appreciate.

The taiyaki fish cone was great, especially the mix of red bean and black sesame which was oddly delicious. The only issue is that since the ice cream melts, once you bite into the fish, the ice cream begins to drip down your clothes and hands. Luckily they give you a wrapper for your cone, but either way, stock up on napkins. Despite its wait and drippy fish, this place is definitely worth stopping by.
author: Annika T.

description: The ice cream is amazing! The toyaki cone is surprisingly soft and fluffy. You just have to eat the ice cream quickly before it melts
author: Nathan G.

description: This is my favorite place to get ice cream in all of SF! Sure you might have to wait a little (15 mins at max), but the wait is so worth it! When I order I get the regular sized ice cream in the taiyaki cone with matcha! This dessert has the perfect amount of sweetness because most of their ice creams are not that sweet (but the cone and the surprise at the bottom is). It's honestly such a fun place to go to if you are in Japan town! Plus they have seasonal flavors which can be very fun (ie cherry blossom).
author: Ella Y.

description: Its alright. Pretty hyped place but i love the look of the fish with the ice cream but just don't really enjoy eating it.  I got the green tea with the fish and after like a good minute or two the ice cream melted into the fish.... and it got all messy and sticky which kind of ruined my appetite to finish the fish.  the place is okay, its clean and seems like theres always a lot of people.  not sure if i'll be back for the fish and the ice cream... maybe if it was hot i'd probably only get the ice cream lol.
author: Ben Z.

description: No longer fresh made.  The fish cone is cold.  The frozen yogurt is too watery down. No way as good as before.
author: Ben A.

description:
YAY for location!

-1 star for the long line and no tables to sit  :(

Came here with my bestie and immediately began to be excited! Although the menu on the screen is really well put, the price tag on it is really small, so you do have really get all up in there in order to see the price!
The place is really small so there is always a long line, but its worth it.
I recommend the Green Tea (Matcha) than the black sesame. The Black Sesame taste kinda odd to me, but never less, it's still a good flavor! 
The waffle cones can be better and the taiyaki is too dough-ie .
author: Anney T.

description: Be prepared for a long time and seeing people post their fish on to social media. I really like the tofu soft serve and the sesame. Best combo ever.
author: Jan H.

description: The taiyaki cone was amazing. I would come here again and again!! We came during the soft opening and a few minutes before close, and there was still a long line. Despite closing at 9:30 they stayed and helped everyone who was still in line. Super rare to see these days! The soft serve is one of the best I've had, as well as the red bean paste that is in the taiyaki cone. 15/10
author: Victor P.

description:
A touristy type of food that you try just once to find out what the hype is about. I would give 2 out of 5 stars for the quality of the soft serve and taiyaki individually; but since the combination of the two (with pokies sticking out and mochi on top) is a cute concept seen in places like Harajuku (Japan) that you only see tourists lining up for, I am giving Uji Time Dessert 3/5.

The service was good. Wait time was good. It was a fun experience overall, but I wouldn't return for the flavorless, icy matcha soft serve.
author: Eura C.

description: Fun flavors, colors, and varieties. It's a nice place to go for dessert right in the heart of Japan Town. It was tasty and they give huge servings. It's a place you go to feel happy. Good times and good memories there for sure.
author: Dexter H.

description:
the line is soooooo long, it was around the corner of the shop! maybe waited up to 30 minutes but it didn't bug me much haha
they give out samples and btw the current seasonal flavor is sweet corn!
ordered the black sesame deluxe taiyaki with poppy seeds and chocolate pocky sticks + 3 salted caramel mochi + matcha soft serve. 
the black sesame wasn't as flavorful in my opinion and didn't really taste like the flavor it was supposed to be.
the taiyaki was more crispy and tasted exactly like a waffle cone.
the matcha soft serve was soooo good! the flavor is very rich and has the delicious deep taste of matcha. it's a little more bitter so beware if you like more sweet matcha flavors!
the service is very nice and goes by pretty quickly! they offer recommendations if you're unsure what will go good with a specific ice cream etc.
they also serve you fairly quickly, less than 3 minutes in our case. they also have "secret" mochi flavors not listed on the menu board near the register :)
there's also two lines, one for cash and one for card.
author: Xuan L.

description: The mochi flavors were odd. We ordered a ginger and lychee and coins not make out the difference between the two. It was also too sweet.
author: May L.

description: I LOVE IT! I am bias towards all things matcha but all their other flavors (MINUS SWEET CORN - seasonal flavor) were amazing! They have black sesame, TOFU!!!!, matcha, and a seasonal flavor. I sampled all of them and loved it all. I usually get the small and I'm stuffed. You gets some toppings too depending on what you order. I like their Azuki (red bean paste), but I wish they can add some mocha or something. I always tell myself to just get a regular cone, but how can I say no to that taiyaki!? I just can't. There is a wait, so if you are impatient... then it might ruin your experience. It takes a while to make the teriyaki cones and the small size is the most popular so if that is what you plan to order, just know there is a wait. They have a live update on their board (pretty cool). I'm so glad they finally opened one in San Francisco. Been dying to go but the one in Berkley opens at hours I'm never there.
author: Kristina L.

description: tried the large size matcha ice cream taiyaki. The ice cream was not fully mixed well and the taiyaki was made for a while so its very soft and not crunchy. The taiyaki recipe was not a good one (not taste good) and the fish mold was too thick causing part of the taiyaki never be able to cook well. This combination of ice cream soaking into the taiyaki making it look good on the photo but not taste good.
author: Peaceatom ..

description: The green tea ice cream is as good as it gets. Came here after getting some ramen in the area, and wanted some ice cream. They also have mochi ice cream which looked good. The waffle cone was really good too. I normally hate waffle cones but not this one.
author: Andrew R.

description: Came here on a Sunday around 3pm and boy was there a long line out the door! The line wasn't really worth it, but because of my love for Matcha and Black Sesame, I had to try it! We waited around 20 minutes and decided to get the small matcha takiyaki, small black sesame takiyaki and three mochis for a total of $20 (a little less to be accurate). The matcha and black sesame was good. The black sesame tasted a little more chocolatey to me than sesame - but I liked them both equally. We got the chance to sample their tofu flavor and it tasted like soybean more than tofu, but suggest matcha or black sesame over it. The takiyaki had red bean at the bottom when you reach the end which was a pleasant surprise. It was filling because it is much thicker than a cone, but satisfying on a hot summer day. We also had the lychee colada, matcha with chocolate, and black sesame mochi to take home - to my disappointment, the lychee colada didn't taste like lychee and the matcha chocolate chip didn't have ANY chocolate chips :( thus the lower ratings. They have the secret Mochi flavors at the cashier on the desk if you're interested but nothing stuck out to me so I went with the usual. You're also able to customize your ice cream with pocky sticks, cracker sticks, matcha powder, etc. I got a taste of it and it's not bad, but definitely not waiting in line again for it.
author: Amanda C.

description: Delicious sold served ice cream! They have 3 flavors plus a seasonal, which was sold out at 3pm.  I got the green tea and it was delicious!!!! Loved the taiyaki cone... the azuki beams at the bottom was a very pleasant and unexpected surprise!!!!! Wish they had this in the South Bay!!!!!!
author: Kay L.

description: First time tried Tofu Ice Cream, light tofu flavor and not very sweet, we like it very much. Ordered with Taiyaki Cone, at bottom the red bean paste is little too sweet. Cone itself is not as good as waffle, I will not order Taiyaki cone next time. After all, we like both Mocha and Tofu flavor very much.
author: Shrabbit A.

description:
The one time I tried their seasonal flavor and it was pineapple; amazing! Other than that, the matcha is always my go too with some red bean. 

Def would recommend this spot to a friend. 

Warning: weekends, and ESP Friday the lines are pretty long. 

Love that they have a digital menu to tell you how long the waits are for different sizes.
author: Gerline R.

description: Tofu ice cream highly recommended. It's light enough but with distinct taste and fresh tofu.
author: Grant L.

description: Matcha ice cream is more on creamy side. I like Stronger matcha flavor; it's just ok to me; I rather go buy in supermarket
author: serena j.

description: Wow, amazing desserts. Had the matcha ice cream with fish-shaped pastry cone, and mochi ice cream. I usually don't like matcha ice cream because they're usually too milky, but theirs is just like the real green tea and so refreshing. Great stuff!
author: Nicholas T.

description: I recommend the Matcha Taiyaki. The wait can be pretty long, so prepare to wait awhile, and the place is like a sauna! Probably from the Taiyaki makers. The Taiyaki has the CrUnCh on the outside and the soft inside you expect. The matcha is nice and not to sweet. We will be back! :)
author: Angie C.

description: Food was great! The flavors were super interesting (sweet corn doesn't taste like what you'd think), and the texture was perfect. They get super busy pretty easily though so go early!
author: Gayle Q.

description: tofu ice cream taste good like sweet soy milk. i like the texture of poppy seed on top. small taiyaki comes with red bean inside also. the taiyaki-bean combo was too sweet for me at the end. but there is some beuty in the mixture of ice-cream soaked taiyaki, crunchy outside and nicely soft inside
author: Zihao S.

description: I literally drove to Uji because I was curious about their softserve ice cream and i was seriously craving ice cream. However, the service was poor. When I asked to taste the flavors the cashier looked annoyed and frustrated. I also wasn't impressed by the flavors so I ended up not ordering at all. It was definitely a disappointment.
author: Natalie M.

description: Great ice cream but a long line. Very interesting flavors, good size portions and prices were not that bad.
author: Eric K.

description: This place was just OK. We were walking around Japan town around 8pm last Friday, trying to get some yummy crepes from Sophie's, and saw a long ass line so I got curious. I waited until we were heading home an hour later, no more line! I ended up getting the taiyaki with matcha and sesame soft serve with red bean base, it was overwhelmingly sweet for my taste and the taiyaki was too thick. If you want the best taiyaki experience, try Recess Italian Ice and Desserts in San Jose! I promise it's worth the drive!
author: Loriean M.

description: The ice cream is super cute and yummy. Would have been 5 stars if not for the unlabeled food. My sister has a severe nut allergy. She ordered the black sesame with kinako (toasted soybean powder) after having a lick she said he tongue felt funny so we double checked. Both had nuts! People with sensitive allergies should be aware that they don't warn you before hand. Luckily they replaced it right away for free which was nice.
author: Giselle C.

description:
I asked for Taiyaki with redbean only and I got Empty Taiyaki. I had to go back to the store and asked for red bean filling and They dont even say sorry for taking the order wrong and for me to make the trip back to the store. 
I wouldnt recommend this place
author: Budeul K.

description: Come here when there's a line. The one time I came when the place was empty the fishy cone was not fresh, but soggy.
author: Debbie I.

description: This place is great. Very great ice cream. Can be very busy at times. The only downside is the prices are a little high for me.
author: Joe A.

description: not overall the best way to put it, but taiyaki along with soft serve ice cream is not to be missed in Japantown, it is located on the othwr building besides Daiso, they give regular selections of ice cream, matcha, black sesame and tofu. I got taiyaki regular with pina colada as it was their seasonal flavor at that time. For regulat size, it is quite huge and tasted good. The red bean on the bottom combines with the ice cream makes the wait worthed.
author: Bryan T.

description: not worth the wait in line.. we waited for almost 20-30mins but wow, what a disappointment. We were expecting something similar to the ones you find down in LA but this missed it by a mile. the flavors are not good, just taste sweet and not truly like the flavor it is supposed to be and what was really disappointing was the fish cone. The cone was flavorless, thin, and I didn't even want more than 1 bite.
author: Jessica S.

description:
This place is only good for photo ops. The reason there's a long line is because everyone is ordering the fish cones but they need to let all the freshly made ones cool down before they put the soft serve ice cream in there. And when they don't logistically plan for the amount of people coming this creates a huge delay. I understand that this is still a soft opening but please sort this out soon. 

The communication behind the counter is horrible. We were patiently waiting for our number to be called. And when I was expecting our number to be called based on ascending order, they didn't call it. They continued past it, serving other customers the same orders I bought. They gave everyone a heads up about a 30 min delay to make the cones and I know they're busy/stressed in the back so I didn't want to complain too much about the wait. After waiting some more, I kindly asked what the status was and they said they called it already. Ok, then why didn't you call it again during the 30-40 min I was waiting inside which by the way is super hot in there (there's no ventilation in there, with no fans except for a personal one that the cashier has faced towards her). If someone doesn't pick up their order, they should continue to call the number for that person to come.  Not just once and call it a day. The second mistake I made today (in addition to coming here in the first place) was giving them a 20% tip when I ordered. Never again.
author: Patrick R.

description: We got there at 2:00p.m and waited in line . We are first in line! It was good! I like it! My Friend treated me ! Very nice people in line to talk too! And I for got to tell we were overcharged also! My friend just look at her bill!
author: Marie W.

description: Although the wait was long the ice cream was super good, and extremely instagramable.
author: Sabrina T.

description: They leave the door open and then kick us out. Good tip they open an hour later than what they put on the open time
author: Tiffany K.

description: So like it's 1:15 and we have a line of about 30 people and they haven't opened. The employees are not communicating with anyone or making eye contact. One just ran through the door. It would be easier if I had a clue of wether they are gonna open or not instead of ignoring all the customers that are here. The sign clearly says the 1:00 pm and Yelp says 1:00 pm but they are just ignoring all of us which is really poor customer service.
author: Tamara S.

description: Not as great as I thought it would be for the price. I got a regular black sesame and matcha taiyaki cone and it tasted just as basic as the pictures people would post on IG. It's definitely a one-time thing for me.
author: Emily L.

description: This review is solely for the woman who took my order today January 24, 2018 at approximately 6pm. It was my first time here and I was super excited to try this place out. I look at their menu and didn't know what to get. I ask the woman at the cashier questions like "what's the seasonal flavor?" "Can I get two different flavors?" She seemed to give me rude, short answers (as if I'm an idiot). After contemplating a bit more on my order, she slightly turns around and begins to mingle with two guys along the side conversing instead of helping or suggesting items to me. After I finally decided on the matcha and sesame swirl in a waffle cone, I pay. She literally throws my card back. I watched it as it was slipping away in my hand. I held my tongue. And she was lucky I didn't get ghetto on her ass or else that would've been a bad sight. I wait for my ice cream and see the sign that says "you should not combine flavors as you will not be able to enjoy each one" well thank you lady at the register for letting me know that! Words of advice for customer service: smile and act like you want to be there.
author: Marie N.

description: We stumbled upon this delicious treat while in Japantown today and it was amazing. The black sesame ice cream was so good. My daughter had tofu which she said tasted like vanilla until it didn't...staff was very helpful and service was quick.
author: Michelle S.

description: We went around 2:30 so the line was long but it moves fast! We got the small matcha with red bean and pocky stick toppings. The matcha ice cream had a good tea flavor without tasting powdery, it was blended in very well. The red bean was the perfect amount of sweetness and sticky consistency! Definitely worth a visit.
author: Justina H.

description: Mini taiyaki cone has a surprise red bean filling baked into the cone. It is spectacular. Honey lavender is the seasonal flavor and is delicious without feeling soapy. The black sesame is my long time favorite. I hope the Berkeley location adds the mini, red bean filled taiyaki cone soon!
author: Savvy S.

description: The regular green-tea cone was amazing. We were initially here to get the Taiyaki cone, but there was a 20-minute wait and we only had 5 minutes left in our parking meter.
author: Ladan M.

description:
Had dinner in Japantown and decided to stop by to check out Uji Time. Normally, we don't go out of our way to try the latest dessert hype, but since we were in the area, we thought - why not! The line was long, but we figured it would go fast since its soft serve ice cream. It's already pre-made, how long would it take, right?! Well, 40+ mins later we were finally able to order our desserts.  

The good thing is they offer free samples, before placing your order.  Just note that when you ask the cashier for the sample, he/she has to go to the back of the store where the soft serve machines are located and then walk back to the front to give you the samples. Not very efficient, in my opinion, and I think this is the reason it takes so long to order.  Once you order though, the desserts are ready within seconds. 

Flavor selection is limited - only 4 flavors available: matcha, black sesame, tofu, and their seasonal flavor (sweet corn). We got samples of tofu and sweet corn - tofu was kind of weird only because it literally taste like tofu. Sweet corn was ok.  We opted for the matcha and black sesame in the regular size taiyaki cone . Out of the two, the black sesame was our favorite.  The matcha was a bit on the bitter side but was still good.  What wasn't good was the under cooked taiyaki cone - the middle was still doughy. A bit disappointing since that was the reason we decide to get the dessert in the first place.  We didn't try the mochi ice creams so can't comment on those. 

I would probably give them another try if I was in the area, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come back.
author: Jenny L.

description: Super fast, fresh taiyaki, red bean paste wasnt strong, and yummy month flavor (strawberry rose).
author: Desiree S.

description: I'd recommend getting here a little early because the line gets a bit long. They offer free samples so don't be shy to ask. I ordered the sesame flavored ice cream but as I was waiting for my order, I asked to try a sample of the tofu flavor. If I had requested it earlier, I would have definitely gotten the tofu one instead. The black sesame was delicious nonetheless. Coming back soon for that tofu ice cream though!
author: Chantelle N.

description: I felt kind of tricked. I saw it on instagram and thought it will be amazing. I bought the taiyaki cone with sesame and green tea ice cream topped with red bean. Waited excitedly for 10 min while they made the cone... I imagine every bite would be magical. I was wrong. The cone was just meh and on the softer side. Their ice cream was like the cheap one I can buy in bulk any where else. It look great on Instagram but not worth calories in real life.
author: Sompatsorn K.

description: First time I went here, I wasn't expecting the line to be so long on a Tuesday. However, decided to come back and the line was much shorter and the service was fast. Ordered the regular taiyaki with matcha green tea and sesame soft serve. My friend ordered the same, but with tofu and black sesame. I really loved the matcha and tofu soft serve, but the black sesame kind of lacked in flavor. It sort of had a faint Oreo taste to it. The taiyaki itself was delicious and crunchy, plus the red bean was also as tasty. Highly recommend the green tea soft serve if it's your first time here.
author: Kam J.

description: For me, this place is just hype to be honest. I felt that the Taiyaki wasn't particularly well done. It didn't taste like anything, and it was a bit hard and too doughy. As for the ice cream, I got the matcha and black sesame. The matcha ice cream did not taste like matcha at all. Honestly, I've had better matcha ice cream at other places so I really wouldn't recommend it here. As for the black sesame, it was better than the matcha, but mediocre at best. I only tried the taiyaki ice cream so I can't say much about the other food items they serve but if you're looking for good matcha ice cream I'd suggest else where.
author: Sandy Z.

description: The line is crazy long but it moves fast.   The taiyaki (fish cone) has red bean at the bottom as liner to keep it from leaking.   The Deluxe is the way to go.   Love the pocky and azuki beans.   This place is way more busy than the Berkeley location.   Sampled the seasonal soft serve ( tofu) which taste a lot like soy milk.   Its not my thing so I end up getting the black seasame and green tea.   I was hoping for a swirl but it was two different layers.   Still very good for a hot day in SF.
author: Danny C.

description:
Tried this for the first time. A very long wait. Sampled the 4 soft serve flavors. The tofu was bland. The sweet corn was a bit sweet. The black sesame seed was good. I ordered the green matcha which tasted good with a little bitter aftertaste in a small fish-shaped cone with 2 pocky and 2 chocolate sticks which turned out to be chocolate striped pirouette cookies. I ordered 3 mochis which tasted good: mochaccino chips (coffee with chocolate chips- very few),
Lychee colada, & Ginger zinger which had a little bite. I ate the cone quickly but when I took the last bites the melted soft serve oozed all over like a prior Yelp review warned.
author: Nora T.

description: The sesame flavor was amazing!! Also tried matcha flavor. It was equally tasty!! Yum!! I would definitely come back if I were in the neighborhood.
author: Virginia T.

description: ice cream is the love of my life, and i'm a sucker for anything that resembles a waffle...so when i saw the soft serve tayaki combo while i was visiting japantown, i knew i had to try it for myself. the line was pretty long, and it was at least a 20 minute wait which is longer than i'm usually willing to wait for something like ice cream. when it finally got to my turn, i was extremely excited to dig into my black sesame and matcha swirled tayaki. however, the line didn't live up to my expectations of how good it was going to be. the ice cream was mediocre at best, and the tayaki was a bit overdone - it was very hard on the outside, even though a tayaki done well is supposed to be soft and just slightly crispy. overall, it wasn't terrible and it's very instagram worthy, but i would probably get a crepe next time i'm in japantown instead.
author: Ellaina L.

description: Extremely long line, the place is literally a hole in the wall. Super cramped inside but they make it work. No seating inside so don't expect to enjoy your yummy snack there but there is a bench outside of the ice cream shop near the stairs. Yummy ice cream
author: Michelle N.

description: Ran out of fish cones right when I got there. Around 2pm. Without those cones, this place is just a typical ice cream place with only TWO flavors of ice cream :(
author: Omar M.

description: The soft serve black sesame seed was ok. I hoping for it to be more creamier than "icy"
author: Korena G.

description: seasonal flavor was pina colada but not sure they need to have that.  the matcha and black sesame were both great with strong accurate flavors and paired perfectly with the adzuki tail filled taiyaki both in taste and appearance.  lovely aroma permeates the area which certainly increases the line.  it's hot in there, and overall does melt fast.
author: Rob C.

description:
OHMYGOSH!!!!!!
I walked out of Daiso and I saw a super long line and I thought the boba shop that used to be there suddenly made something new and special. I realized that it was no longer a boba shop but an ice cream shop! A worker came out and gave us samples of the flavors tofu, matcha, and black sesame. I ended up getting black sesame and matcha. They even allowed you to get 2 free toppings !!! I def recommend
author: Annaleigh N.

description: Freshly made taiyaki cones really goes a long way!
author: Tango Alpha I.

description: Got the chance to visit Uji times soft opening in the peace plaza in Japantown. The wait is at times 45 min if you want a Taiyaki cone. Which is after already waiting line which can get to about 20 people + unless you visit early. Once through the door it felt like a sauna which I felt was unpleasant for anyone going to for cool treat on a hot day. I understand they are constantly working with heat but it might be for the greater good of all to work on cooling so that their employees and customers are comfortable. I enjoyed the matcha+black sesame deluxe Taiyaki cone with two toppings of mochi and matcha pocky sticks. I loved every bit of it but do feel that it being soft serve takes away from that creamy goodness a lot of us find comforting in icee treats that have such complex flavorings. I will be searching elsewhere for a more flavorful matcha ice cream but would like to bring any of my friends who visit from out of town to get the experience here, other than that I won't be returning solely for the soft serve.  (==)
author: Leslie T.

description: I came here with a friend on a Friday night and the line was long. I thought it was really sweet that the staff stayed past closing to serve everyone in line. I ordered a mini taiyaki cone with black sesame soft serve and green tea pocky sticks. The black sesame soft serve reminded me a lot of peanut m&ms! It's definitely a cute and delicious dessert to check out if you're in Japantown.
author: Jackie T.

description: I've been wanting to try matcha soft serve in a taiyaki for so long after seeing photos of it on instagram and knowing there's an uji time in Berkeley. After it opened in San Francisco, it was hyped up so much and I was scared that when I went it would be overhyped. Luckily, it wasn't. I got matcha and black sesame soft serve in the taiyaki for about $7 and it was so good. The soft served tasted great, not too sweet but with enough flavor. I didn't think the taiyaki would still have red bean inside because it was filled with the soft serve, but it did and it was so good. This is a must try!! Other flavors included the tofu and the seasonal one. When I went the seasonal flavor was lavender and it tasted pretty good, very flowery. There were samples of each soft serve flavor being passed out and I was able to try most of them before ordering. The line was pretty long around 5pm but it was definitely worth it. I would come back to get the same soft serve and I would come back to try the ice cream mochis!! They also have calpico slushes which sounded really interesting.
author: Lauren L.

description: Green tea, tofu, and lavender soft serve were phenomenal.
author: Joe L.

description: Stumbled across this place while walking around Japan town. The matcha ice cream was delicious in the famous fish cone and the smell had me salivating while in line. I waited about 15 minutes-it was def worth it! I can't wait to come back when i am in town.
author: Mel K.
