description: Strong matcha flavor with a hint of tea bitterness yet not too overwhelming.. mixed well with the creamy and nutty sesame!!  Topped with my childhood's favorite rainbow sprinkles! Yum~ !!
author: Joey K.

description: Very cute and trendy. They didn't have many flavors available on their mochi menu, because they were sold out. Taiyaki was the real star and the matcha and black sesame flavors were real winners in my book.
author: Jesse H.

description: Love the Taiyaki Ice Cream. Thanks to Yelp for the great reviews.
author: Mega Team R.

description: Great experience!!! Even though it was a dog opening, there was a line!!! I've had matcha (very delicious soft ice cream) and their seasonal flavor, which is honey lavender right now in a taiyaki cone. There are four flavors in total, the ones I've mentioned plus black sesame and tofu.
author: Ludmilka A.

description: One of those trendy food places. The ice cream tasted good and these cute fish cones are great for pictures. I ordered a mini and it cost me $6.50, not sure if it was worth it. If you are a matcha fanatic, however, I definitely recommend trying this out sometime! Just a tip, but if you don't want to wait in a long line then try to get there before opening.
author: Kristin J.

description: My husband and I happened to be in Japantown and I remembered that this place existed based on friends' posts.  After a bowl of udon, and full already, we went to try this place.  The line was around the corner, and the wait was about 40 minutes.  My husband decided to get the black sesame, while I chose the tofu and matcha combo.  There was a sign that stated for small size tayaki the wait was an extra fifteen minutes and for the regular it was five minutes.  My husband's liked the sesame.  I am a matcha lover, but my favorite was the tofu.  I thought it was refreshing, but my husband thought it was weird.  My husband finished his in record time because he said it was melting and dripping.  I ate a bit slower and it didn't melt that much on me.  I was so full I didn't finish it.  Probably we should have shared.  They also have ice cream mochis.  I had my eye on the ginger and the mango Thai basil.  The latter is on a secret menu post-it by the cashier.  Apparently, they also have a store in Oakland.  I went on Yelp and saw a picture of their menu and the prices are lower.  Either the prices in Japantown are more expensive or they've increase the prices since last year, the date that someone posted that a photo of that Berkeley menu on Yelp.
author: S Y.

description: I think just ok for the green tea ice cream; the matcha taste is not strong and too milky; I like strong matcha taste
author: Serena J.

description: Black sesame was light on taste. Green tea was rich. Tofu was good. Fish cone was good. Not worth the wait.
author: Bon B.

description: Taiyaki with tofu ice cream is pretty good. Would try matcha next time.
author: Kei S.

description: I tried tofu and green tea ice cream.  Tofu is better for me. I went back the next day for more!  :)
author: Karen H.

description: If I could give this place 7 stars I would! Loved the fish cone and the green tea and sesame soft serve!
author: Julia W.

description: My best friend and I saw the long line at this place, so we were curious to see what the hype was about. The wait wasn't too horrible, about 10+ minutes (Friday afternoon ~1pm-ish). We both got the matcha soft serve. The matcha soft serve tasted good, but its not something I would absolutely go out of my way to get. Especially if the wait is more than 10 minutes long.
author: Miss E.

description: The desserts here are delicious and definitely worth waiting for. They have a range of amazing Asian flavors of ice cream like tofu, sesame and matcha. My personal favorite is sesame. My biggest issue is the wait to receive your dessert. It was slightly crowded, so I understand. Forgetting my order multiple times was my problem. I had to constantly check for my order and remind the staff of what I ordered. My friends had received their desserts 15-20 mins before me, I ended up holding our group back. I really wish they were more efficient when making the desserts and they stop forgetting customer's orders.
author: Natalie N.

description: Over hyped up place. The soft serve is more icy than creamy. Not worth the price. If you paid over $8 for a taiyaki cone and 2 flavors of soft serve plus toppings, you have been taken. The matcha soft serve is not sweet, does not have the mild green tea flavor (light green colored) and is not creamy. It is bitter, dark green, and icy. The seasonal flavor right now is Honey Lavender and is overwhelming on the lavender and icy. Not creamy at all. The taiyaki cone is worse to the point that I couldn't finish eating it. It tasted stale. And from other reviews it had to be sitting for a long time and was possibly undercooked. The batter for the taiyaki did not stand out and was not memorable. Also it was not very deep so you are not getting that much soft serve. As far as toppings go, they still do not have the dango/mochi and several others. The red bean tastes like it came from a can. Overall, nothing was memorable, Instagram worthy, or worth the money. I would not recommend this place. Try at your own risk.
author: Nana R.

description: The waffle fish cone was good but would be nicer if they had more kid friendly flavors as their soft serve. We had the green tea flavor which l liked but my kids say they preferred the traditional vanilla, strawberry or chocolate.
author: Jeannie L.

description: This place is good for maybe a one time try and then that's it. I admit it looks pretty cool and the soft serve was good but I can't see myself going frequently. They offer a mini size and regular size for their fish taiyaki with ice cream. When I went they had tofu sesame and matcha flavor. My friend and I got the matcha and sesame swirl and also the tofu since it seemed unique. The matcha was really good and you can can actually taste the flavor unlike some places. The sesame just tastes like chocolate to me but just with black coloring. Surprisingly the tofu flavor was good. It might not be for everyone but I liked it because it was not too sweet and reminds me of soymilk instead tofu. When you get to the bottom you taste the red bean paste they put. Although the line was long, it only took 10-15 min of waiting till I got to order. Over all I recommend to try this place out if you haven't gone and want something to satisfy your sugar rush.
author: Ryan T.

description: You wait for it but at least they display approx wait time so you know. Got the regular fish with tofu and black sesame. Not too sweet and unique flavors for soft serve. With tip was $8 but that's not unusual for this town.
author: Elizabeth K.

description: Love their lavender soft serve, very relaxing and the honey totally upgraded the favor.
author: Crystal C.

description: Hey this is a step up and a far cry from the usual dessert craze. Mochi light,  fluffy, squishy and chewy texture. Fresh soft serve ice cream with delightful unique flavors found in Asia. It struck a chord and hit the spot, a most try for those that crave something new and traditional.
author: J. S.

description: we came here after a dinner across the bridge, not realizing this new place. very nice place. although small and long line, they were pretty fast. matcha ice cream was pretty good. i got the seasonal flavor with the chocolate stick, which was a cookie roll with cholocate. give it a try; you won't regret it!
author: Duke B.
